story:
Jenny Jahlee's FIRST full length studio album, "MORE LOVE!!!

 

"From deep within my heart it drips,

honey down to my fingertips, 

A pulling and knowing that the time has come,

to share the music that has been done. 

The vibrations dance inside me now,

but the music is getting  too loud.

I need your help to set them free,

in a way that all can share and see.

Truly an honor to surrender myself,

and sit before you, asking for help.

Calling on the community we share,

To co-create, and lay it all bare." - Jenny Jahlee

:)

After 15 years of writing, singing, learning, growing, understanding, and creating, the time has come to put these songs born from my deepest and softest moments, into a beautiful and thoughtful album. 

I have been singing for as long as I can remember, with music as the forefront of my upbringing, and ultimately, my healing. Through many compelling life struggles, deep insights into the human condition, and a wild love for growth, I have crafted these songs to convey the vastness of it all. "More Love" is a simple reminder of the one thing that needs to be practiced and cultivated above all else; to LOVE in any way you can.  

Over the years I have been fortunate enough to perform many live shows, and collaborate with incredibly talented and eclectic artists. However, what I desire to create most is something tangible. A real studio album would not only be a creative container for all to enjoy, it would also be the perfect way give the world my best. 

Words fall short when trying to express the depth of gratitude I have for all of the support and kindness I have experienced this far. Music is such a vulnerable expression of the self, and you all have made me feel so loved and supported over the years. Lets take this journey together. 

What we need to make the dream, a reality:

This process has been a whirlwind of emotions. Between feeling like a badass, and being far in over my head, there is a lot going on!

I have carefully crafted perks for you, and teamed up with some community members to really make this a collaboration. 

PLUS, 10% of ALL of the money I raise is going straight to the firefighters out in the beloved columbia river gorge. This is a cause very close to my heart, and it really is the least I can do to try and help the people who are trying to save one of my favorite places in the world. 

The "Breakdooooowwwwwnnnn":

On the album we will have many flavors of folks playing music, collaborating, participating, and keeping the inspiration alive throughout the whole process:

Lucas Brookbank Brown on guitar, Chris Reed on guitar, Django Koenig on guitar, Nick Werth on percussion, Tim Ortlieb on drums, Ryan McAlaxander on bass, Eli Dyer on Trumpet, my father, David Lee on the keys, Josh Lorenzen on etherial sounds, and many other special guests!

These are the real-world connections that have made this all possible;

I am recording at Hollowed Halls in Portland, OR with Justin Phelps at the end of October!

Between artwork by my sister, pints from Volcanic Bottle Shoppe, handmade wood and opal hat pins, poems and songs, shirts and stickers, catered dinners by my best friend, massages by me, and some other fun treats, there is a perk out there for everyone! Its been a joy getting to collaborate with my community to bring these offerings to life. 

It really is a community effort and I couldn't do this without YOU!

Here is a realistic breakdown of costs, (dunnn dunnn dunnn):

Studio time & Producer/ Engineer - 2,500$ (5 days at 250$/day + 500 for studio A + 20$/hr producer fee)

Mixing and Mastering - 2,700$ (150$/song, 18 songs - including mixtape)

Paying the musicians - 1,000$

CDs - 200$

Perks (Shirts, stickers, arts, pins, ect) - 500$

Indie GoGo Fees - 500$

Incidentals (music gear, travel expenses, making a mixtape, dog food, wine, therapy sessions, and the like....) - Priceless

That totals up to 7,400$ Just to cover the basics. 

 

SO! Thats a big chunk o' change. However, I have investigated some of the album costs these days, and this is a fairly low end/ middle ground for how expensive things can typically get. 

The gratitude I have for your offering:

By supporting this album, titled "MORE LOVE", you are supporting just that. To me and many others, music IS love. It is a true honor to make music and inspire others to follow their passions. We all lift eachother up! The songs I write are meant to inspire, give understanding, create joy, and move your body, which in my mind is a damn good offering to this wild world we all share. 

But let's get real...

Asking for help, financially and mentally, from the community is a hard thing to do. However, allowing myself to be vulnerable, to be humble in my endeavors, and learn to really enjoy the process is pricless! Thank you, a million times over. 

Other Ways You Can Help:

I see you out there, folks that are strapped for cash, or just would rather offer other abundances to this cause. I love it! You can still support this album by sharing this campaign, loving your neighbor, calling to say hello and check in on the process. MORE LOVE is the baseline, so give that out to everyone, in any way you can.

THANK YOU SO MUCH!

THANK YOU for reading this far, for being in my life, for your support and kindness, for allowing me to express myself, and for being a heart centered person. We are all making a difference, and it starts with gratitude, and I am overwhelmingly, deeply, irrationally grateful. Now, lets make some music!

story:
Hello legends!

It's Jas here and I'm super excited to finally be releasing my debut album and planning a Summer tour for New Zealand 2018.

Last year I made some pretty big life changes, including leaving my full time job / home and taking the gigantic leap to full time musician/world traveler.  Some once told me "Ifs it terrifying and amazing... you must pursue it" so .... Mission accepted.

I recorded "See what you did there" with the help of local lyttelton producer/extrodiner Ben Edwards.   After a great two weeks in the studio.. And Bens magic skills ... boom .. an album!  Full with rock riffs, delicious harmonies and even some slower moody tear jerkers.

The album focuses mostly on the time I spent working and living in Asia ... while doing ALOT of people watching (but the acceptable non creepy type)

I was lucky enough to perform at the Edinburgh fringe festival the last two years, where I met many extremely talented musicians ... three of which happen to be joining me for the upcoming tour.

After some great gigs and general life experiences, I invited the girls to come be my kickass band in New Zealand... I can't wait !

The "See what you did tour' will be rocking around New Zealand in Jan and Feb 2018,

As an independent artist, I want to play and tour all around the world ..  and course one day be friends with Bon Jovi ... but in all honesty, just being to keep creating great music while performing live.

Our journey will take us all over New Zealand in the months of January and February and we are looking at playing all types of venues in all types of cities and towns.

We will be posting weekly vlogs on Youtube to share our incredible experience and to make it feel like you all are there with us every step of the way. We also want to help you all feel inspired to pursue your own dreams, because anything is possible once you decide to take the risks and make your dream a reality!

We are all so excited about New Zealand but we need your help to make this dream a success! We are looking to raise around $10,000 NZD  and any contribution you decide to make will really help us out more than you know.

Here's a quick breakdown of some of the expenses so you can see first hand...

Tour van @ $100 a day $6000

Petrol $600

Food @$10 a day each $2400

Accomodation $6000

Album plus mixing and mastering $10000

Promotion and PR $1000

Total ... $26,000 NZD

It seems these days that as a musician you are always trying to break even ... and touring is no different.  We all really appreciate your support.

We will be  giving away perks to specific donation amounts! Be sure to look on the sidebar to see what you can get when you support this tour with your donation. :)

Thank you all for taking the time out to read about our incredible adventure. We appreciate every single one of you. We would love to personally meet you, so please be sure to leave your name and what city you’re in in the comments below so we can try and secure venues near that specific area! Ready set ... Money Money Money ... Money Money Money (no pun intended)

Thanks guys!!!

Here's a quick breakdown of some of the expenses so you can see first hand...
Tour van @ $100 a day $6000
Petrol $600
Food @$10 a day each $2400
Accomodation $6000
Album plus mixing and mastering $10000
Promotion and PR $1000
Total ... $26,000 NZD
It seems these days that as a musician you are always trying to break even ... and touring is no different.  We all really appreciate your support.
We will be  giving away perks to specific donation amounts! Be sure to look on the sidebar to see what you can get when you support this tour with your donation. :)
Thank you all for taking the time out to read about our incredible adventure. We appreciate every single one of you. We would love to personally meet you, so please be sure to leave your name and what city you’re in in the comments below so we can try and secure venues near that specific area! Ready set ... Money Money Money ... Money Money Money (no pun intended)
Thanks guys!!!

story:
Who is Mandy?

I am! 

I am a jazz vocalist and music educator from Alberta. The past seven years I have spent most of my time with kids. I tried to figure out exactly how many but I can't. So to give you an idea, this week (November 2-8, 2017) I have seen 79 children for various types of music lessons. Most days we sing, play piano or ukulele and learn music theory. Other times we just play games and talk. Every day children share their love of music and their view of the world with me.  This is probably my single greatest source of inspiration.

My other passion is jazz. I studied vocal performance at Grant MacEwan University in Edmonton, Alberta and have performed with a variety of groups ranging from small jazz ensembles to dance cover bands to barbershop and other types of acapella groups. I love singing most things but the energy that comes from playing jazz is unlike any other.

Music with Mandy is where these two worlds collide. Jazz is playful and interactive by nature, the musicians are always working together and improvising to make a piece come to life. It is my goal to bring children into this active improvisation at my live performance. I do so by inviting young musicians to perform with me and by creating games out of jazz standards for audience interaction. It is my goal to use this album to take me across Canada to communities big and small and introduce jazz to children and their families. "On the Sunny Side of the Street" will be the single most important tool to create connections to communities and introducing my style of music to a younger audience.

What I Need & What You Get

The funds raised will go to (in this order):

  • Producing, mixing and mastering
  • Musicians
  • Album art and design 
  • Printing fees

If we do not raise the entire amount I will record a shorter EP instead of a full length album. On the other side, anything extra will go to touring with the album!

The Impact

High quality and diverse music needs to be accessible for families. Music with Mandy is making that happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you believe in this project but cannot contribute financially please consider helping in other ways.

  • Tell everyone you know about the campaign
  • Go to a MWM show
  • Volunteer at a MWM show or event

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Mauriel Strawbridge aka Mauriel Bizio.  I'm the manager / business partner with Nicky Barness aka Asian C.  I've known Nicky since she was 18.  I noticed she was different that a lot of artist that I have worked with in the past.  With some success, she worked with various groups prior to teaming up with me.  After moderate success with these other groups, she wanted to take her music career to the next level.  We made a deal that was equally beneficial to both of us, she's the artist, I'm the network, kinda like Michael Jackson and MTV.  But there's one problem.

Nicky was involved in a domestic altercation.  Because of legal reasons,  we can't go into details.  Nicky faces an up hill battle.

Currently Nicky is one the right track, being a responsible person and mom first, then an recording artist second.  She works with me during the day, selling home alarm systems.  Thanks to her, I'm the number one sales rep in my local office.  Then we operate our music business during the evening.

Our current projects are:

  1. Building her website www.nickybarness.com

  2. Producing her 12 track mixtape “Don’t Ask, Don’t Tell”, with 12 music videos.

  3. Her own reality show showing her struggles and successes, (we shoot video every time we meet up)

  4. And her own talk show we she features local talent.


What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $7,000 in donations to help produce and market Nicky Barnes music, studio time, Facebook, and Youtube adds, Local flyers, local Television Advertisements, and other projects listed.  


Other Ways You Can Help

All donations will be greatly appreciated, another way you can help is to share our story on your social media sites, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram.  Also, don't forget that we sell home alarms, so if you know someone who has gotten broken into, or you know someone who just moved into a new home, have them contact us.  We can service them anywhere country.  



Thanks for all your support.

story:
For months now, I've been slipping in and out the Biggest Little City in the World, Reno, NV, pushing faders instead of pulling levers. Either way, it has been backdrop to quite a gamble.
     The investment has been in myself, working hard recording in a studio instead of my bedroom, where I recorded my first solo CD in 2010. That disc, a no-frills, 14-track collection of sparsely arranged guitar/vocal tracks continues to be a fan favorite and a source of pride. My one regret is that I did not invest in it more - really in myself more. A friend did the artwork for free. My ilyAIMY bandmate, Rob Hinkal, recorded it for a couple lunches. The whole thing cost me about $1,500 to make. I didn't fully realize the songs' potential. I didn't have a CD release. I didn't promote it. For some reason, I felt like I shouldn't make a "big deal."
     Five years later, I have a crop of nuanced new songs I am jumping-out-of-my-skin excited about. They are a complex combination of ideas I've titled, "A Message in the Mess;" They could be a car hood splatter painted unless I take the care to see the Pollock paintings truly in them. They need instruments - upright bass, mandolin, a string quartet - that we don't have in my existing band, and someone who understands how to arrange them.
     Enter Joel Ackerson and his incredible band, The Novelists, of Reno, NV. Joel helped my friend, Justin McMahon, realize two incredible CDs, and I knew he was the right person to help me now. We've currently finished three of the 11 songs intended for the CD. They are SO good. I'm SO excited. I financed the flights, mixing, artwork and recording to this point scraping together every free penny of a folk-musician-substitute-teacher salary to get the first installment, a three-song EP, ready. I wanted something to show you where I'm going and get you as excited as I am for the project - The full-length version I need your help to continue.
     I've decided if I must ask for money to complete the CD to the highest standard ... I might as well contribute to as many talented artists and small business people as possible. You'll make your contribution not only to my music, but to an entire community of makers I've brought together for it. People I'm excited for you to meet. People like:

Will Schaff - https://www.flickr.com/photos/samsa1973/
Justin Lloyd - jlloyd designs
rob hinkal - (He takes amazing pictures, too!?!) http://www.ilyaimy.com
Justin McMahon - https://www.facebook.com/noticeeverythingcreative  http://www.reverbnation.com/bholden
Morphius Records, Inc. - http://www.morphius.com/


What I Need & What You Get

I'm going to have to fundraise more money than ilyAIMY has asked for in the past since I have to hire the players to round out the CD, fly back and forth to Reno, pay for photos and a website. And also because I plan to promote this one this time, giving loads of free copies to DJs, dream venue owners and concert series presenters. My goal is to finish the remaining 2/3 of the project within the year.


Other Ways You Can Help

Nothing - not even your money - is more important than your support. Tell people about the campaign. Send them a video of one of my songs. Repost and retweet. And give me ideas. If you want a cool incentive I didn't list, pitch it to me.

story:
Русское описание в конце

Hello, everyone! 

We are a band “Slumber Woods” from the heart of Siberia. 
We play electronic music and sing in different languages.

About Us

Slumber Woods is a synthpop band from Krasnoyarsk, Russia. 

It consists of Tanya – Kevi ka, one of the singers, along with fellow music-maker Sasha – Stupid Squirrel.

We live in Russia, but our music is something that we want to be heard everywhere in the world, this is why we have decided to write our first album fully in English. 

Although we are a young band, recording our debut album is very important for us. It can be released with your support.    

What We Need & What You Get

There are some things we have already taken care of ourselves - all the music and lyrics are already written, we have created our own ideas and concepts. 

The only thing that we have yet to solve is to collect 1900$ needed for:

  • professional equipment
  • a recording studio
  • experienced sound engineers

A certain amount of money will be spent on realizing and shipping all the rewards (hard copies of the album, printing booklets with photocards, wooden badges, hand-made toys). A small procent will be given to the platform. This is why we are asking for your help.

We have chosen a reward system which will allow everyone to have something for supporting us. 

Rewards can be send almost everywhere and we will do our best for you to recieve them as quickly as possible. However, we will be able to send all the rewards only after finishing recording our album. 

In Details

Our album is called “Once Upon A Time”. 

It will include 10 full songs + intro and outro. All the music and visual design will be connected by one idea which we believe will strike everyone's fancy. And you can help us make this happen!

Right now we just finished a photoshoot. These photos will be included in a booklet (each song will be illustrated by one photo), along with the album, will be available if you decide to help support us.

Risks & Challenges

If  we don't reach our goal,  all raised money still will be spent on recording. 

We strongly believe in our music and we will work really hard to complete our album even if something will go wrong. Surely, it can take some additional time, but we will do our best to release our album

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help us by sharing our songs and covers with your friends and spreading the word about this campaign! 

We thank you very much for your time, attention, and support!

Slumber Woods

Official Group in VK - https://vk.com/slumberwoods

Soundcloud - https://soundcloud.com/slumberwoods 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Привет!

Мы – группа Slumber Woods из самого сердца Сибири. 
Мы играем электронную музыку и поём на разных языках мира.

О нас

Slumber Woods - синти-поп группа из города Красноярска.

Коллектив состоит из вокалистки Тани - Kevi ka и музыканта Саши – Stupid Squirrel.

Наша музыка – это нечто такое, что бы мы хотели донести до всех уголков Земли, поэтому свой первый альбом мы решили записать на английском языке.

И пусть мы все еще достаточно молодая группа, мы уже серьезно нацелены на запись нашего дебютного альбома. И он может быть выпущен с вашей помощью.  

Что нам нужно и что Вы получите

Есть вещи, с которыми мы можем справиться своими силами: мы уже написали музыку и тексты, разработали несколько креативных идей и концептов. 

Но такие вещи, как

  • специально подготовленное помещение
  • профессиональное студийное оборудование
  • опытные звукорежиссёры

требуют денег, на что мы и собираемся потратить 1900$.

Часть денег будет потрачена на производство и отправку всех наград (печать дисков, фотокарточек, изготовление эксклюзивных значков и дизайнерских игрушек). Также нам потребуется отдать небольшой процент от суммы этой платформе. Именно поэтому мы и просим о вашей поддержке.

Мы постарались разработать систему вознаграждений таким образом, чтобы каждый смог получить награду за свой вклад.

Мы сможем отправить вознаграждения практически куда угодно, и мы сделаем всё возможное, чтобы вы смогли получить их как можно скорее. Однако, выслать все вознаграждения мы сможем только после окончания работы над альбомом.

Детали

Наш альбом называется “Once Upon A Time”. 

Он будет включать в себя 10 полноценных песен + intro и outro. Вся музыка и визуальное оформление будут объедены одной идеей, которая, мы надеемся, понравится каждому. И вы можете помочь нам  это реализовать!

Совсем недавно мы закончили фотосъемку. Из этих фотографий будет составлен комплект фотокарточек (каждая песня будет проиллюстрирована фотокарточкой), который будет доступен вам вместе с альбомом, если вы решите нас поддержать.

Возможные риски

Если мы не соберем нужную сумму, все собранные деньги все равно уйдут на запись альбома.  

Мы верим в нашу музыку, и мы закончим работу над альбомом, даже если что-то пойдет не по плану. Конечно, это может занять куда больше времени, но мы приложим все усилия, чтобы релиз альбома состоялся.

Как еще вы можете помочь нам

Вы также можете помочь нам, поделившись нашими песнями со своими друзьями и рассказав людям об этом проекте! 

Большое спасибо за уделенное время, внимание и оказанную поддержку!

Slumber Woods

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Official Group in VK - https://vk.com/slumberwoods

Soundcloud - https://soundcloud.com/slumberwoods

собранные деньги все равно уйдут на
запись альбома.
 

Мы верим в нашу
музыку, и мы закончим работу над альбомом, даже если что-то
пойдет не по плану.
Конечно,
это может занять куда больше времени,
но мы приложим все усилия, чтобы релиз
альбома состоялся.

Как еще вы можете
помочь нам
Вы также можете помочь нам, поделившись
нашими песнями со своими друзьями и
рассказав людям об этом проекте! 

Большое
спасибо за уделенное время, внимание и
оказанную поддержку!

Slumber Woods
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Official Group in VK - https://vk.com/slumberwoods
Soundcloud - https://soundcloud.com/slumberwoods

story:
Welcome!

My name's Beth and I live and work in the Derbyshire Peak District where I run a small creative business called Rowan Song.  I have a lifelong passion for music and have been writing songs in the folk genre for the past 20 years or so.  This album of all original material expresses the themes that I love to work with creatively...the voices of the land that I live on, the spirits of place and the mythologies that are woven into our natural spaces through history and storytelling. 

The Dark Peak has been my home for the past 10 years, taking me on a journey of healing and transformation.  I so much want to share the magic and beauty of this place that has enchanted me for the past decade. At a time when so much of our landscape is under the threat of environmental harm there is more need than ever to celebrate and honour our natural spaces.  This collection of songs aims to do that and to inspire others to listen to the voices of their own special places within nature. 

To make this album and create a physical CD product we ideally need to raise a minimum of £2200.  This will cover recording time in a small local studio, mastering, registrations and a run of professionally replicated CDs.  It breaks down like this:

Recording/Mastering - £1250

CD Replication - £600

Registrations - £150

Artwork - I will be doing this myself!

There will also be campaign costs of the 5% fee we incur for using the Indiegogo platform plus card payment fees.  

Total: £2200

That's the minimum, but if we raise more than that then it opens up the possibility to meet some of our stretch goals which would be super amazing!  They go like this:

  • £2500 would allow us to make a fuller booklet for the CD with lyrics
  • £3500 would allow us to upgrade our equipment for live performance which would open up where we could take this music to share
  • £6000 would see us back in the studio for a second album (Faery Tails) which is already written and waiting!

So, let's have a look at those rewards and perks...

I have a range of special goodies for you to choose from!  If you'd like a musical reward then you can choose:

  • a digital download of the Voice of the Moor album on completion
  •  a digital download combined with an extra track from the next album...a special preview which will only be available via this campaign. 
  • CD of the Voice of the Moor album will also be available once we have secured enough donations to fund the majority of that part of the project (see Plan B below!)
  • In person concerts! I will come to your venue with any size of audience and give you a full recital of all the songs from the album plus some new songs that you will be the very first people to hear! Any questions, just ask! This is a great option if you have a bit more to spend or want to get together as a group or moot to combine your donations.

There are also other creative rewards on offer, handmade by myself - choose from ceramic jewellery...

...and small dishes...

...or A5 greetings cards featuring the album cover art for the Voice of the Moor CD from my original painting...these are also a lovely size for framing...

...or a beautiful handmade stained glass bird created by local artist Sarah Brelsford (only one available)...

In case you can't decide, I've also put together some bundles for you which give you a little bit of a discount on some of the items :)

New rewards will be rolled out to the campaign page as we go along, so check back with us every so often to see what's new!

There is an unavoidable shipping charge for physical rewards, but I have tried to keep this as low as possible. 

Do remember to check when the shipping date for your reward is.  Obviously the album in any format can only be delivered once it is complete.  We are estimating end of 2017 for this assuming everything runs smoothly.  If there are delays for any reason then you will be informed by email.  Other rewards that need to be hand made may also take some time to produce so please bear with me while I create your items for you.

So...what happens if we don't reach our target?  Well, I am trusting we will, but just in case, then there is a Plan B!  Assuming we have raised enough to cover the recording costs then we will go ahead and record the album. We will then release it digitally for sale online.  This will get the album out there while we work on raising the remaining funds to support the production of the physical CD. For this reason I will only make a CD reward available once we have received enough donations to fund the majority of that part of the project. 

At this time in humanity's relationship with the earth it is more important than ever for people to feel connected to and a part of the spaces and places they inhabit. When we listen to the voices and stories of the land we exist upon, watch them transform and turn through the seasons, it creates the possibility for a new and deeper kind of relationship with nature and the places that we call home. 

This collection of songs explores my own journey of relationship with the places that call out to me in this way.  I hope that sharing them with a wider audience will inspire others to explore their own relationship, to remember the stories that the land holds for them and will share if they quiet their minds to hear.  I believe there is great value in that both for people and for our planet.  I would love it if you could help me make this happen!

As someone with a strong creative background and the owner of a creative business, I also have a great track record  in taking the seed of an idea and seeing it all the way through to a finished product.  I know how to plant, nourish and harvest! I also take my responsibility to the people supporting me very seriously (I wouldn't have a business if I didn't!) so if this project is crowdfunded I am keen to honour that trust and belief in me and this album.

While this project would represent a new kind of creative project with new challenges, I am really excited by that.  My creative background has given me a heap of transferable skills developed over many years, so I am confident in my ability to see it through to an end product. 

However, there are also new challenges related to the administrative side of releasing an album that must be addressed to ensure it is released in a form that can be sold and listened to across the greatest variety of outlets.  To deal with this I have researched thoroughly and sought the advice of more experienced recording artists to make sure I have allowed for these in the budget.

    Not everyone can contribute and we totally understand that.  However, if you'd like to support the project in a different way then please share this campaign in any way you can on social media, with friends and family and/or with anyone you think might be interested.  We value and appreciate every kind of support! 

    Find us online at:

    www.facebook.com/BethReesMusic

    https://twitter.com/RowanSongCrafts

    www.youtube.com/user/rowansongvideos

    https://soundcloud.com/user-912625019

story:
Concept Rock in the Alamo City

As if we needed more reasons to love the flourishing arts scene in San Antonio! Everything about our original show speaks to the talent and passion for excellence we have in our city. From the show's story creators and music composers (Ricky, Richard, and Tito), the vocalists (13 of them who sing their butts off, including lead vocalists Lucas Jack & Bekah Kelso), the 5 piece house band (a.k.a. the badass driving force of wild prog/pop rock at the center of our show), the multi-media content producer (award-winning artist Daniela Riojas will be creating and curating this dynamic and vital component of the show), sound and light technician (the best!), recording engineer/mixing/mastering house (yo Zinc Media!), right down to the awesome local print company who will press our CDs and posters (Core Media), the wonderful non-profit presenting our performance (we love The M.U.S.I.C. Project) and the community theater house that will host our performance (the Josephine Theater), EVERYTHING about Paradise City is showing San Antonio the love.

Ricky, Tito and Richard, friends and veterans of the San Antonio music scene, first began writing the show in the 1980s after working on previous projects together, including the psychedelic rock opera "Alice", which made big waves in central TX in the 70s and 80s. Over the years, Paradise City took many forms but was never completed. Until now! Finally, with your help, it is coming into full performance fruition. 

Though composer and friend Tito Villalobos Moreno is no longer with us on this physical plane, his spirit is infused in the music of Paradise City. We are so happy that his son, Tomas Villalobos Moreno, a very talented graphic designer, did the artwork for our poster, deepening the link between Tito's legacy and this special project. A portion of proceeds from ticket sales will benefit The M.U.S.I.C. Project and The Tito Villalobos Moreno Memorial Scholarship Fund.

The music of Paradise City tells the story of a small-town rock band, Jimmy and The Heroes, and their journey to a colorful new city where crowds flock to promises of freedom and excess. There they find friendship and even love as Jimmy meets a drifter named Jenny. All seems perfect in Paradise, until the truth is revealed about the forces fueling the city. Things aren't what they thought it would be. Love and loyalty are tested. Is Paradise City a dream or can Jimmy and Jenny make it a reality?

We have the music, the story, and the talent. Now all we need is YOU!

What We Need & What You Get

For the Live Show and EP Release, we are raising a production budget of $31,500. We are raising our budget through the Indiegogo platform *and* via business sponsorships.

GREAT NEWS! We've already raised the first $6,000 via some awesome local sponsors that we can't wait to tell you more about! 6K down, $25,500 to go.

Does that sound like a lot? Our production budget covers the cost of rehearsal, session, and performance pay for 13 vocalists, 5 band members, a sound technician, light technician, and stage crew. It also covers the theater rental, sound equipment, artwork and print costs. Finally it allows us to produce the live show’s original, compelling multi-media content and to record, mix, master, and replicate the EP of selected tracks. 

Perks! We got em! With contributions ranging from $10 all the way to $7500 (our premier business "Title Sponsor"), we have tons of ways for individuals and business sponsors to be a part of our project and help us showcase some of San Antonio's incredible talent.

We have perks available at several different levels for those who are local and can come to our show, AND for those who are not here but still want to be involved.

Business Sponsors - Our IndieGogo campaign focuses on our crowd-funding partnership with awesome individuals. If you are a business owner or work for a business that might like to consider one of our sponsor packages, we want to talk to you!

The Impact

Your contribution provides the operating budget needed to make this wild rock show a reality and demonstrate San Antonio's commitment to original music and outside-the-box artistic endeavors. Austin's not the only city in Texas with an incredible musical heritage! 

Lets come together and put on a home town rock show like nothing else we've seen.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to our campaign right now, no sweat. You can still be involved!

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

That's all! Thanks for taking the time to check out our campaign. We hope you're as excited as we are. We will be keeping you updated here and on our website www.paradisecityrocks.com. If you have thoughts, comments, or any questions about our project, feel free to reach out directly anytime to our show's co-producers, Ricky Hernandez & Bekah Kelso.

With love and gratitude!

#paradisecityrocks

story:
Future Indie video music show:

Hi I'm Rosie G. and I have been in the Radio and Record business for over 3 decades which include WBLS-FM,WRAT-FM and record companies such as,EMI,Capitol & BlueNote Records,to name a few.Since I began in this business my goal has always been to help Independent artists understand the business of music and how best to share their music with the world.

What We Need:

In order to make playMYmusic.FM a vehicle to successfully support independent artists.Contributors generous donations would be used to acquire some necessary tools such as:

  • DSLR cameras

  • Lighting Equipment

  • Professional Microphones
  • Computer
  • Latest recording & editing programs
  • Latest production programs
  • Soundproofing materials

 

  • Another portion of funds received from contributors will also be used for payment of Performance Right Royalties for usage of videos from Indie artists/bands. As well as promotion of playMYmusic.FM on:

 

  • Social media
  • Print media
  • Customized hats and T-shirts with playMYmusic.FM's name and logo

What you get:

Several of the Major record labels,some Indie labels and artists have contributed many of our perks for our donors. Showing their support for Independent music and playMYmusic.FM.

  • special 7' edition vinyl from Masters at Work
  • boxed sets from Linkin Park and The Hollies collectibles
  • autographed CD's and posters from famous Hip Hop artists
  • autographed Vinyl from Tommy Boy records
  • customized hats & T-shirts w/ playMYmusic.FM logo
  • DVDs of artist concerts

 

The Impact:

Our show will be all about YOU, the Independent artist/bands and followers,supporters and music lovers of Indie music in all music genres.

My overall goal has always been to give unknown artists from various musical genres the opportunity to have their music heard not only by the public but also by movers and shakers in the ever-changing record industry. Now we need YOUR HELP to make this project a reality.

 

Other ways YOU can help!

If you are unable to help in a monetary way, hey we understand and it's cool. We get it. You can help in other ways by sharing our campaign with your friends,family and any Independent artists/bands that you may be following or know personally. You can also check out our social media pages on Facebook, Twitter , Instagram

Remember Independent artists are the FUTURE STARS OF TOMORROW! Thanks for checking us out and for your support! playMYmusic.FM Unleashing the Unknown, Unsigned and Unheard.   Support independent artists/bands and their music! Have a great day and a better tomorrow! See ya soon!

story:
"TESLA" THE IMMIGRANT WHO CHANGED OUR WORLD

SoBe Arts in partnership with The Colony Theater is producing the World Premiere of TESLA, a multidisciplinary opera about the exceptional life, brilliant inventions and futuristic explorations of Nikola Tesla. His radical visions of scientific potential, which led to his rise as well as his downfall, resonate even more powerfully in the 21st century. 


We need your help to make sure Tesla's grand vision to liberate nature’s energy and create a path to an environmentally clean future is illuminated with music, unique set and costume designs, carefully mapped digital animations, mechanical electrical stage devices, and poetic storytelling.  

We believe this production will help bring into focus Tesla's tragic sacrifices and, through the emotional juggernaut of his story, will contribute to raising the awareness of the dangers of living unsustainably as Tesla predicted over a century ago. To meet these goals the work will receive a "live" world premiere and the production will be professionally recorded, videotaped and edited for worldwide distribution.  

We are increasingly drawn to the parallels between humanity, culture and environmental sustainability. It is this conflict that is at the heart of our motivation to tell the tragic and inspirational real-life story of Nikola Tesla, one vastly more captivating than that of any epic protagonist. Tesla's prophetic work framed the worlds portrayed in science fiction and also formed the foundation for modern-day wireless energy transfer, wireless communications, laser beams, neon and fluorescent lighting, radio transmission, remote control and robotics

The creative team from "Fairy Tales, Songs of the Dandelion Woman" and "Intelligent Systems, the surrender of self in mystical contemplation" will be taking their collaborative work into a new level for "TESLA" by, not only presenting extraordinary mapped animated projections, unique set designs and costuming, but will include an amazing physical mechanical-electrical recreation of Nikola Tesla’s Polyphase AC motor which grows and develops throughout the evening and finally becomes an electrically charged Tesla Coil during the infamous Colorado Lab scene “Sex and Electricity”

Over the last two years we have, with considerable effort, been able to raise about 85% of the funding needed for the premiere of TESLA. We are still raising the last 15% of the funding needed to finally make this much-delayed world premiere a reality and truly need your help!  Please make a secure tax-deductible donation of any size to SoBe Arts a 501 (c)(3) nonprofit organization. We need this final bit of funding by May 31 to allow us to guarantee the September premiere. If the funding is not raised by June we will not have time to prepare for the September premiere in which case we will have to return most current funding by terms of the grant awards. Current funding comes from state, county and city grants as well as private foundations and a few individual contributions from longtime supporters. However, with your help we shall prevail, of this we are certain.

The funding raised on Indiegogo will specifically go to hire the creative team and help build the unique sets, digitally mapped projections, period costumes and intense lighting required for this production.  If we are so fortunate as to receive additional funding beyond our goal, you can be sure it will be used to hire professional vocalists & musicians, enhance all production values and upgrade our DVD recording by hiring additional pro cameras and operators as well as significantly enhanced sound recording equipment.

Please make your donation today and together we can insure that the telling of TESLA's vision, and this beautiful opera, is finally realized!

THOMAS BABE, CO-LIBRETTIST

"Tesla" Co-Script writer Thomas Babe was one of a group of 70s US playwrights who laid the ground for the likes of Quentin Tarantino and Aaron Sorkin. Like David Mamet and Sam Shepard, his plays contain half-crazed but intelligent, articulate characters. Darker passions of the human soul feature strongly Mr. Babe's writing first came to widespread attention in 1975, when his play Kid Champion, with Christopher Walken as a physically and emotionally broken rock star, bowed at the Public. Mr. Babe's plays were often populated by mythic figures from history. Fathers and Sons, for instance, featured Wild Bill Hickok. (The play was later the basis of a 1995 Walter Hill film starring Jeff Bridges, the screenplay for which Mr. Babe co-wrote.) And Salt Lake City Skyline concerned Joe Hill. A then-unfamous John Lithgow played the labor leader. 

The cast of Thomas Babe's "Taken in Marriage" at the Public Theater

Mr. Babe's work rarely lacked for top acting talent like John Lithgow and Walken. A Prayer for My Daughter, set in a police station, starred the solid foursome of Jeffrey DeMunn, George Dzundza, Laurence Luckinbill and Alan Rosenberg. Rebel Women featured Mandy Patinkin and Peter Weller. And the cast of Buried Inside Extra—a rare play directed by Joe Papp himself — included Hal Holbrook, Dixie Carter, Vincent Gardenia and Sandy Dennis. Taken in Marriage, the women of a well-off New York family are gathered in the basement of a New Hampshire church for a wedding rehearsal starred Dixie Carter, Colleen Dewhurst, Kathleen Quinlan and Meryl Streep. 

CARSON KIEVMAN, COMPOSER & CO-LIBRETTIST  

For decades, Carson Kievman's work follows an independent course that blends new music with the theatrical, visual and literary arts. His symphonies, operas, chamber music, music theater and experimental works have been performed internationally in stage, concert, dance, and museum settings, from SoBe Arts to the Berkeley Art Museum; Ysbreker (Amsterdam), the Pennsylvania Ballet (Philadelphia), The Public Theater (New York City), the Rote Fabrik (Zurich), the Tanglewood Music Festival (Lenox), and the Nationaltheater Mannheim (Germany). His works have been broadcast by British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC); Nord Deutsche Rundfunk, Berlin; Radio France, Paris; National Public Radio (NPR), and other media outlets worldwide. 

 Carson Kievman’s work in opera has been informed by a lifetime working in music and theater. He started composing at age 16 and directing for the stage at the age of 19. Kievman has created 23 multimedia music-theater works, including 7 full length stage works, such as California Mystery Park, Hamlet, Tesla and Intelligent Systems (commissioned by a fellowship from The National Endowment for the Arts and the Donaueschingen Music Festival, Germany). 

Symphony No. 2(42) CD New Albion Records (Naxos)

Kievman has created various large scale orchestral works, including Symphony No. 2(42) (1991), Symphony No. 3 (hurricane) (1995), Symphony No. 4 (biodiversity) (1998), Symphony No. 5 (2010) and Symphony No. 6 (no man’s land) (2014). Symphony No. 2(42) was commissioned by the Florida Philharmonic Orchestra to honor the 200th anniversary of Mozart's death, recorded in 1996 by the Polish Radio National Symphony Orchestra-Katowice, and the Polish Radio Choir of Krakow, Delta David Gier, conductor, and released on New Albion Records. The recording was selected by Mark Swed of the Los Angeles Times as one of the Top Classical CDs of the year and received radiant notices including, “Original in its outrageous flights of fancy” (Los Angeles Times), “A truly original and artistically sensitive work" (All Music Guide) and "It provides one of the most powerful musical experiences I have had in recent times." (Spoleto Today). 

JEFFREY MARC BUCHMAN, STAGE DIRECTOR

Opera News calls director Jeffrey Marc Buchman "a formidable talent.”, and the South Florida Classical Review claims "Buchman has mastered an art beyond the powers of many directors". Following enormous success directing the premiere of Madama Butterfly for the National Theater in Managua, Nicaragua, Mr. Buchman returned to create a critically acclaimed production of La Bohéme.  

This season, he mounts a new production of Don Giovanni for the Academy of Vocal Arts in Philadelphia, Don Pasquale for Opera Naples, Carmen for Indiana University, Il barbiere di Siviglia for Lyric Opera Baltimore, a double-bill of Stravinsky's Mavra with Ainadamar, by Osvaldo Golijov, Magic Flute for the Brevard Music Festival and La Traviata for the University of Cincinnati College-Conservatory of Music.

The 2014-2015 season saw Buchman create productions of L'elisir d'amore for Cincinnati College-Conservatory of Music's summer program, La boheme for Indiana University, Suor Angelica & Gianni Schicchi for Intermountain Opera and the University of Miami, Lo speziale for New World School of the Arts, Manon Lescaut for Mobile Opera, Il barbiere di Siviglia for Syracuse Opera, Don Giovanni for the Miami Summer Music Festival, Cosi fan Tutte for the Brevard Music Festival and the World-premiere of Carson Kievman's Pulitzer Prize-nominated multimedia opera Intelligent Systems, which the South Florida press named one of the "Most Innovative Productions of 2015". He was also Artistic Director and creator of the ground-breaking arena event entitled LiveArts, which drew together over 1500 performers, including the Grand Rapids Symphony, Ballet, Opera and Broadway.  

Image from premiere of "Fairy Tales, Songs of the Dandelion Woman"
story_txt:
"TESLA" THE IMMIGRANT WHO CHANGED OUR WORLD
SoBe Arts in partnership with The Colony Theater is producing the World Premiere of TESLA, a multidisciplinary opera about the exceptional life, brilliant inventions and futuristic explorations of Nikola Tesla. His radical visions of scientific potential, which led to his rise as well as his downfall, resonate even more powerfully in the 21st century. We need your help to make sure Tesla's grand vision to liberate nature’s energy and create a path to an environmentally clean future is illuminated with music, unique set and costume designs, carefully mapped digital animations, mechanical electrical stage devices, and poetic storytelling.  
We believe this production will help bring into focus Tesla's tragic sacrifices and, through the emotional juggernaut of his story, will contribute to raising the awareness of the dangers of living unsustainably as Tesla predicted over a century ago. To meet these goals the work will receive a "live" world premiere and the production will be professionally recorded, videotaped and edited for worldwide distribution.  
We are increasingly drawn to the parallels between humanity, culture and environmental sustainability. It is this conflict that is at the heart of our motivation to tell the tragic and inspirational real-life story of Nikola Tesla, one vastly more captivating than that of any epic protagonist. Tesla's prophetic work framed the worlds portrayed in science fiction and also formed the foundation for modern-day wireless energy transfer, wireless communications, laser beams, neon and fluorescent lighting, radio transmission, remote control and robotics

The creative team from "Fairy Tales, Songs of the Dandelion Woman" and "Intelligent Systems, the surrender of self in mystical contemplation" will be taking their collaborative work into a new level for "TESLA" by, not only presenting extraordinary mapped animated projections, unique set designs and costuming, but will include an amazing physical mechanical-electrical recreation of Nikola Tesla’s Polyphase AC motor which grows and develops throughout the evening and finally becomes an electrically charged Tesla Coil during the infamous Colorado Lab scene “Sex and Electricity”

Over the last two years we have, with considerable effort, been able to raise about 85% of the funding needed for the premiere of TESLA. We are still raising the last 15% of the funding needed to finally make this much-delayed world premiere a reality and truly need your help!  Please make a secure tax-deductible donation of any size to SoBe Arts a 501 (c)(3) nonprofit organization. We need this final bit of funding by May 31 to allow us to guarantee the September premiere. If the funding is not raised by June we will not have time to prepare for the September premiere in which case we will have to return most current funding by terms of the grant awards. Current funding comes from state, county and city grants as well as private foundations and a few individual contributions from longtime supporters. However, with your help we shall prevail, of this we are certain.The funding raised on Indiegogo will specifically go to hire the creative team and help build the unique sets, digitally mapped projections, period costumes and intense lighting required for this production.  If we are so fortunate as to receive additional funding beyond our goal, you can be sure it will be used to hire professional vocalists & musicians, enhance all production values and upgrade our DVD recording by hiring additional pro cameras and operators as well as significantly enhanced sound recording equipment.
Please make your donation today and together we can insure that the telling of TESLA's vision, and this beautiful opera, is finally realized!

(The play was later the basis of a 1995 Walter Hill film starring Jeff Bridges, the screenplay for which Mr. Babe co-wrote.) And Salt Lake City Skyline concerned Joe Hill. A then-unfamous John Lithgow played the labor leader. The cast of Thomas Babe's "Taken in Marriage" at the Public Theater
Mr. Babe's work rarely lacked for top acting talent like John Lithgow and Walken. Rebel Women featured Mandy Patinkin and Peter Weller. And the cast of Buried Inside Extra—a rare play directed by Joe Papp himself — included Hal Holbrook, Dixie Carter, Vincent Gardenia and Sandy Dennis. Taken in Marriage, the women of a well-off New York family are gathered in the basement of a New Hampshire church for a wedding rehearsal starred Dixie Carter, Colleen Dewhurst, Kathleen Quinlan and Meryl Streep.

story:
WHO ARE WE?

 

Decibelists is a new music project from Emma Alabaster and Leo Ferguson. We wanted to do something very different from the music we’ve each made in the past: to create music that reflects our activism and work for social justice and music that would create a space for our friends and our community to dance and feel safe and powerful. We think that is a gift we can give back to the city and the community that has nurtured both of us.

 

Leo Ferguson is a drummer, composer and producer who came up in NYC as a musician playing punk-y Riot Grrrl music in high school, studied jazz performance, listened to hip-hop and spent years composing with a pencil and paper. He currently works as a community organizer in New York City, fighting racist policing, resisting Trump and building people power.

 

Emma Alabaster is a bassist, vocalist and composer who grew up in Brooklyn and has studied primarily as a jazz upright bassist. She currently works as an arts educator in NYC schools, shelters and community centers and as a health educator in medical schools. She leads songs and chants at protests and is Lincoln Center Boro-Linc’s Artist-in-Residence at Snug Harbor Cultural Center.

 

The music we’re making is experimental pop, driven by a fascination with the city, fighting injustice, sex, love, humor and the ocean. It’s got cool collaborations, laptop beats and ancient Casios; strings and brass; it draws on all of our skills as arrangers, writers and instrumentalists.

 

We are native New Yorkers — so is most of our band. The city — this city — feels like another member of the band. So much of our lives and our activism is intimately bound up with the place that we live. We want our music to be connected to this complicated place that lifts us up at the same time it tears us down — that protects and nourishes and divides and threatens all at the same time. Hopefully this band can be part of creating more spaces that nourish and feed our community in NYC and beyond — a little shelter in the storm.

 

WHAT ARE WE WORKING ON?

 

Album: We have a completed album, recorded in fancy studios, tiny bathrooms, a school gymnasium, a cabin in the woods and a few different living rooms, including our own. Our album features some incredible guest artists --  rappers Soli of The Machine, and Majesty of Legendary Cyphers; members of the Pitchblak Brass Band; and Pulitzer-prize-nominated poet and songwriter Cornelius Eady. There are also guest appearances from local masters Rosi Hertlein on violin, Sara Schoenbeck on bassoon, Michael Winograd on clarinet and Mary Cherney on flute. The rest is all Leo & Emma — we filled out the album’s sound with our own singing, bass, drums, guitar and keyboard-playing, laptops and samples. The songs are all original and written collaboratively between the two of us.

 

Live Band: Our band is filled with amazing people: Theo Baer on keyboard, Ora Batashvili on guitar and violin, Hannah Temple on keyboards and Seradin Veonne on vocals, all of whom are wonderful musicians dedicated to this project and who share our values. You can check out our facebook page and sign up on our mailing list to stay up to date on chances to see us play live.

 

Music Video: Additionally we have begun shooting for a music video about gentrification that we plan to release before the album this summer.

 

HOW CAN YOU HELP?

 

We want our band to be rooted in our community, so we also want to ask for the support of our community. So far we’ve paid for everything ourselves but there’s only so far you can go on a shoestring. In order to move forward at this pace we need your help.

 

Your support will help pay for: album mastering, music video completion (filming and editing), commissioned artwork by Chanel Kennebrew, and all the other stuff it takes to be a gigging band. Any money raised over our goal will help greatly with the costs of maintaining this project — paying musicians, renting rehearsal studios, gear purchase and upkeep. Indiegogo takes 5% of whatever we raise.

 

Art is important in these dangerous times and there are so many other places that need support now more than ever. So we also want to share our fundraising labor towards an organization we admire and work with closely, The Justice Committee (JC.) We are donating at least 5% of what we raise to JC in honor of the late and beloved Daniel Majesty Sanchez who worked there as a volunteer and then staff member.

 

Founded in 1985, The Justice Committee is a grassroots organization dedicated to building a movement against police violence and systemic racism in New York City and empowering low-income Latino/as and other people of color to address these issues. Current work includes organizing Cop Watch teams that deescalate, and observe police activities and organizing for justice with the families of people killed by the NYPD.

 

Please pre-order our album, donate what you can and spread the word. Thank you!

www.decibelists.com

 

Indiegogo Promo Video shot by Tonilyn Sideco and Leo Ferguson. Edited by Drew Dickler.

story:
Opera reimagined

Join us as we explore Baroque opera as it was meant to be heard. This is an opera company unlike any other in the region :

  • one that uses historical instruments and performance practice, as Handel and his contemporaries performed them.
  • opera that reflects the environment in which opera was created.
  • luscious and ornate music exquisitely played by a smaller ensemble, performed in an intimate setting where the audience can feel the story and drama of the opera in a new and exciting way.

American Baroque Opera Company, based in Dallas, presents both familiar operas and rarely heard gems of the baroque, as fully staged productions, in an intimate style to educate new audiences about authentic early music performance practice. 

What We Need 

Let's break down the operational, educational, and artistic elements:

  • Presenting opera takes more than beautiful singers and sets. The orchestra, stage director, and backstage folks are professionals! Plus, planning a season takes coordination before the production and artistic staff, venues, and other arts organizations.
  • We are introducing this art to people new to opera or just tired of another Carmen! And. . .
  • We have partnered with several schools to create masterclasses and other educational opportunities.
  • School performances cost us, too.

The Impact

This season, the American Baroque Opera Company debuts with an opera cabaret, designed to entice opera lovers to enjoy the music of Baroque composers and sample what ABOC can offer. In March, the Company will produce its first fully staged opera, Handel's masterpiece Alcina, in the Dallas Arts District. Eric and Miguel, along with co-founder Hillary Coyle, wish to present lush opera productions to a diverse audience, both current opera-goers and arts lovers who want to dip their toes into the cool, refreshing pool of Baroque masterworks. 

  • We love opera, and we hope to let you see how uplifting and exquisite it can be.
  • Our educational goals include teaching students about Baroque practice (which is seriously lacking in the music programs today) and providing free tickets to underserved youth.
  • Get in touch with us if you having questions about Baroque opera, ABOC, or our directors.

Challenges

Our biggest challenge is getting the word out to North Texas audiences about the launch of our company. 

  • We could use your help in publicizing this funding campaign.
  • Talk to your friends and family about how they can be a part of ABOC.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share this campaign on Facebook.
  • Volunteer at our performances.
  • Bring your friends to our free events (sign up for our emails at baroqueopera.org).

This is the moment.

story:
French version below / Version française plus bas

Hello, my name is Florent CASP-TORRENT, I am a French engineer student and an amateur musician.  In 2016, I have created the musical project Melancholic Thoughts.
Music wise, this project offers to the listener a strong emotional experience, diving him into a melancholic atmosphere where sadness and purity co-exist.

Today, I am proud to present you my first EP:

Melancholic Thoughts
 

Several musicians, engineer and graphic designers collaborate on this project; They take advantage of their talent, adding a personal touch to the creation of this EP.

Thus, we offer you the possibility to join and live with us the adventure Melancholic Thoughts…

now we need YOUR help!

OUR NEEDS & YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS

During this campaign, YOUR contributions will allow us to finish the production of this EP, to release it living up to our expectations!

Creating an EP in a professional way requires an important financial investment.
Indeed, it is necessary to buy expensive material and MAO software, record some of the instruments in a studio. The EP has also to be mixed, mastered then pressed onto CDs. In addition to this, we must legally protect our work, to ensure its authenticity.
Here are the main expenses that we have to cover for the EP…

Supporting us, YOU give the opportunity to an amateur musician to successfully realise his first EP!

To thank you for your contribution, we have created
SEVERAL PERKS
which will allow you diving into the melancholic universe of the EP…

YOUR PERKS

  • included in all the perks:                                                     An invitation  to the release party of MELANCHOLIC THOUGHTS in Paris
    + download of the EP in HD

                                              The shipping costs are included


10 €        MELANCHOLIC THOUGHTS digital downloads
                 Download of MELANCHOLIC THOUGHTS with high quality
                 wav fies 24 bits

 20€       MELANCHOLIC THOUGHTS CD + DIGITAL
                MELANCHOLIC THOUGHTS CD
                + Download of MELANCHOLIC THOUGHTS in HD

35€        MELANCHOLIC THOUGHTS USB + CD
                MELANCHOLIC THOUGHTS USB with seperate tracks of the EP,
                main scores and other surprises...
               + MELANCHOLIC THOUGHTS CD
               + Download of MELANCHOLIC THOUGHTS in HD

45€        MELANCHOLIC THOUGHTS SHIRT + CD
                MELANCHOLIC THOUGHTS Tee-shirt
                + MELANCHOLIC THOUGHTS CD
                + Download of MELANCHOLIC THOUGHTS in HD

150€     MELANCHOLIC THOUGHTS STUDIO (limited 3)
                1 half day to record a song at  Sound studio
                + MELANCHOLIC THOUGHTS CD
                + Download of MELANCHOLIC THOUGHTS in HD

“I have contributed, now what else can I do to help?”


Melancholic Thoughts is a new project.
To help us realise this campaign, we need YOU to share it EVERYWHERE!

To your friends, your family, on the social networks (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter…) …etc.

YOU are the guarantor to the success of this campaign, thank you!!!
 


Version française

Bonjour, je m’appelle Florent CASP-TORRENT, je suis un étudiant ingénieur et musicien amateur français.  En septembre 2016, j’ai créé le projet musical Melancholic Thougts.
L’exigence de ce projet est d’offrir un expérience musicale forte en émotion à son public, en le plongeant dans une atmosphère mélancolique dans laquelle tristesse et pureté ne font qu’un.

Aujourd’hui, je suis fier de vous présenter mon premier EP,

Melancholic Thoughts
 

Plusieurs musiciens, graphistes et ingénieurs collaborent sur ce projet ; Ils mettent à contribution tout leur talent en ajoutant une touche personnelle à la création de cet EP.

Ainsi, nous vous proposons de rejoindre l’aventure Melancholic Thoughts...

Maintenant c’est à VOUS de nous aider !

NOS BESOINS & VOS CONTRIBUTIONS

Pendant cette campagne, VOS dons vont nous permettre de finir la production de cet EP, pour pouvoir le sortir dans les meilleures conditions possibles!

Créer un EP de manière professionnelle demande un investissement financier important.
En effet, il faut acheter du matériel et logiciels de MAO à des prix souvent onéreux et enregistrer certains instruments en studio. L’EP doit également être mixé et mastérisé avant d’être pressé en version CD. En plus de cela, nous devons protéger notre œuvre juridiquement, pour pouvoir en assurer l’authenticité. Voici les principaux postes de dépenses que nous devons encore assurer pour cet EP…


Grâce à votre soutien, VOUS donnez donc les moyens à un musicien amateur de réaliser avec succès son premier EP !

En retour, nous avons élaboré
PLUSIEURS CONTREPARTIES 
qui vont vous permettre de plonger dans l’univers mélancolique de l’EP…


VOS CONTREPARTIES
 

  • inclus dans toutes les contreparties:                             Une invitation à la soirée de sortie de MELANCHOLIC THOUGHTS à Paris
    + téléchargement de l’EP en HD

                                              Les frais de port sont inclus
 

10€        MELANCHOLIC THOUGHTS digital downloads
                Téléchargement de MELANCHOLIC THOUGHTS en haute-définition
                fichiers wav 24 bits

 20€      MELANCHOLIC THOUGHTS CD + DIGITAL
                CD MELANCHOLIC THOUGHTS
                + téléchargement de MELANCHOLIC THOUGHTS en HD

35€        MELANCHOLIC THOUGHTS USB + CD
                MELANCHOLIC THOUGHTS USB contenant les pistes séparées de l’EP, partitions et                      autres surprises…
               + CD MELANCHOLIC THOUGHTS
               + téléchargement de MELANCHOLIC THOUGHTS en HD

45€       MELANCHOLIC THOUGHTS SHIRT + CD
               T-Shirt MELANCHOLIC THOUGHTS
               + CD MELANCHOLIC THOUGHTS
               + téléchargement de MELANCHOLIC THOUGHTS en HD

150€    MELANCHOLIC THOUGHTS STUDIO
               ½ journée pour enregistrer un titre au  Sound studio
               + CD MELANCHOLIC THOUGHTS
               + téléchargement de MELANCHOLIC THOUGHTS en HD

 

« J’ai contribué, maintenant que puis-je faire d’autres pour aider ? »


Le projet Melancholic Thoughts n’est qu’à ses début.
Pour nous aider à réaliser cette campagne nous avons besoin que vous la partagiez autour de vous !

A vos amis, votre famille, sur les réseaux sociaux (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter…) …etc.

VOUS êtes donc les artisans du succès de cette campagne, merci !!!

story:
With technical facility that makes everything look easy (Opus Colorado) and rich tone that is especially impressive (Herald Tribune), flutist Cobus du Toit is quickly establishing himself as one of the leading flutist of his generation.

Havig won over a dozen competitions on two different continents, Cobus enjoys the variety that exists between chamber music, solo and orchestral playing. As the principal flute of the Boulder Chamber Orchestra for the last 5 seasons, Cobus has performed as a soloist with the orchestra numerous times and once again dazzled the audiences in Boulder, Colorado with the Concerto for Flute and Orchestra by Carl Nielsen in early 2015. Solo performances from past seasons include the Johannesburg Festival Orchestra, Boulder Philharmonic and Chamber Orchestra of South Africa. 

Cobus has been a prize winner at the 1st UNISA Southern African National Competition for Woodwinds and Brass, the Byron Hester Competition, the Myrna Brown Competition and SAMRO International Scholarship Competition just to name a few. As an international soloist, Cobus has performed in Taiwan, Russia, Japan, South Africa, Germany, France and the USA.

Cobus is currently the flute player of the Antero Winds, a Colorado based professional woodwind quintet that has been prizewinners at both the Plowman and Fischoff Chamber Music Competitions. Cobus can be heard on Gypsy Violin, recorded under the Salon Music label with Gina Beukes, violist of the London Symphony Orchestra, and also recently released an album with guitarist Patrick Sutton featuring the music of Piazzola, Takemitsu, Iznaola and Beaser.

Recent engagements include a performance in St. Petersburg, Russia as part of the Musical Olympus Festival, a solo recital at Sun-Yat Sen University in Taiwain and a seven-city tour of South Africa with guitarist Patrick Sutton. Cobus will also be traveling to Indonesia in 2015 for performance and teaching in Bandung city.

Cobus holds a Bachelor’s degree from the University of Pretoria where he studied flute under Professor John Hinch and graduated with a Doctoral Degree in Flute Performance and Pedagogy from the University of Colorado where he studied under Christina Jennings. He also received his Masters Degree from the same institution.

story:
Noël c'est le temps de donner. Depuis 20 ans, je donne de tout mon coeur pour créer de la musique qui vous accompagne pendant vos temps des fêtes. Aujourd'hui, je vous demande de donner à votre tour pour nous aider à continuer cette grande tradition. 

Je suis présentement en studio en train de préparer la production de mon cinquième album de Noël « La Magie de Noël ». Aujourd'hui, je vous demande de m'aider en achetant l'album d'avance. En échange, on va vous l'envoyer en exclusivité avant son lancement officiel.

Noël c'est vraiment le plus beau temps de l'année. C'est le temps de rire et de chanter en famille. J'ai le plaisir de faire partie des traditions de Noël de plusieurs familles et j'ai très hâte de partager ce nouvel album avec vous.

Mais qui es-tu?

Je suis Chuck Labelle, chanteur franco-ontarien, cowboy du nord de l'Ontario et passionné de Noël. Dans ma carrière, j'ai endisqué plus de 7 albums et j'ai eu le plaisir de collaborer avec plusieurs musiciens incroyables tels que Robert Paquette et Paul Demers. J'ai récemment reçu le prix Hommage au Gala des prix Trille Or. Pour écouter et télécharger mes albums, rendez-vous sur ma page BandCamp.

Et t'as besoin de quoi?

Il y a beaucoup de coûts d'associé à la production d'un album de cette qualité. J'ai besoin de votre aide pour rémunérer mon équipe, mes musiciens, mes producteurs, le mastering, l'impression, le design, la promotion, entre autres.

On cherche à amasser 23 000$ pour la production de l'album, le mastering, la fabrication, l'impression et tout ce qui doit être fait avant que vous receviez une copie dans vos mains.

Tu veux des cadeaux?!

En donnant ce que vous pouvez, vous nous permettez de continuer cette grande tradition et de partager la joie de Noël avec encore plus de personnes. En échange de votre contribution, vous allez recevoir plusieurs cadeaux tel que le nouvel album en primeur, un box-set de tout mes albums de Noël ou même un spectacle intime chez vous! 

Partagez votre contribution et faites votre shopping de Noël d'avance! Voici quelques idées de cadeaux pour vos proches. 

On va surement en ajouter d'autres au fur et à mesure que la campagne avance. Suis-moi sur Facebook pour découvrir les nouveaux cadeaux avant tout le monde!

Partagez la magie de Noël

Vous n'êtes pas en mesure de contribuer financièrement? Il y a d'autres façons de contribuer!

  1. Partagez cette page avec votre famille et vos amis sur Facebook et Twitter! 
  2. Ramassez le téléphone et appelez matante pis mononcle pis grand-maman et grand-papa! Ces gens ne sont peut-être pas sur Facebook, mais on a besoin de leur contribution pour que cet album devienne réalité. Contactez-les et aidez-les à faire une contribution à la campagne.
Partagez ainsi la joie de Noël!

Merci, merci, merci.

Vous me laissez entrer dans vos salons et célébrer Noël avec votre famille depuis plus de 20 ans. Merci pour ça! C'est grâce à des gens comme vous que je réussis à vivre de mon art et que j'aime faire ce métier après tant d'années. Vous êtes mon inspiration et pour ça, je ne pourrais pas assez vous remercier.

Un merci tout spécial à ma famille, à mon amour Hélène, à mes fils, à mes musiciens, à mes amis et à mes fans.

xox

Chuck

story:
What it's all about:

In 1994 I got my first guitar. Within the first month, I wrote my first original song - it was terrible. That's ok. The first one is supposed to be, and let's face it, very few 17 year-olds have anything to say that is worth hearing anyway. It's been more than 20 years with dozens of songs in my catalog it is time for me to make a contribution to the musical landscape. I have done this for too long to have nothing recorded. No label, or company is going to make this happen for me, and honestly, I'd rather do it with the control that an independent release provides. But I cannot do it without your help! 

What We Need & What You Get

Recording and releasing an album takes money (who knew?):

  • Nothing is free! It is true that the advent of home digital recording has brought the price down considerably, but even home recording requires an investment of equipment. I am looking to utilize some reasonable, but pro-quality recording studios that are available to me - and talented people rarely give their skills away for free!
  • Promotion is key. In addition to recording, mixing, master, pressing and distributing my album; there is also the need to promote it! A small amount of the collected funds will go toward creating promotional merchandise and campaigns to help get the music out in the world.
  • You will find several levels of perks for your contributions, several of which basically equate to pre-ordering the album. You have the opportunity for exclusive access, album mentions and credits, even a song commission and the declaration of a Patron Saint of Black Eye Affair. 
  • If we do not reach this goal, we will forge ahead. There will be a project. There will be a recording It will be released. The most immediate effects of failing to reach the goal will be the length of time it takes to finish the recording, the quality and quantity of the finished product, and the financial burden on Black Eye Affair.

All Said & Done

We live in an ugly world. Art makes it a more tolerable place in which to live. I feel like my music is worth being out there; that it has enough to say to take the risk of putting on the line. It's a nervous proposition, and I hope that what we make here does not disappoint. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Not able to contribute?:

  • Share, Share, Share! Share this campaign, share the Black Eye Affair Facebook page and YouTube channel, and come out to see Black Eye Affair perform live when possible!
  • Indiegogo has some great sharing tools to help me promote this, don't be afraid to take advantage of them and spread the word!

Stay golden Pony Boy.
