story:
My Tambourine

c'est le parisien Elio Della Noce et la montréalaise Ariane Brunet. La rencontre du duo se fait à Astaffort, en mai 2014, lors d'un atelier d'écriture de chansons chapeauté par l'auteur-compositeur-interprète Francis Cabrel. Le groupe s'est formé outre-mer, grâce aux sympathiques nouvelles technologies. Le choix de l'anglais comme langue mère du groupe s'est imposé dans le but de se distancer de des projets d'auteurs-compositeurs francophones respectifs de ses membres et d'étendre leurs horizons musicaux. Le duo entend toutefois mélanger leur langue maternelle commune à l'anglais, et donc présenter quelques pièces francophones. 
Passion Flowers, le premier extrait de My Tambourine (qu'on peut entendre en version pré-maquetté sur un vidéo youtube annexé), est né d'une collaboration avec l'auteur-compositeur-interprète londonien Piers Faccini. Ce dernier assure depuis l'écriture de l'ensemble des textes anglophones du groupe. Style folk à folk progressif. Les influences sont: Nick Drake, Bert Jansch, Crosby stills and nash, Piers Faccini, Fleet Foxes. Le jeu de guitare d'Elio navigue entre les sonorités Folk britanniques, la guitare africaine, et les musiques du monde.

Un premier EP
L'enregistrement de la première maquette de My Tambourine se fera au Studio History à Paris, en mai prochain. Réalisation de Philippe Almosnino (Keren Ann) et arrangements de Jean-Max Méry (Brigitte, Phoenix). 

Besoin de vous!!
My Tambourine est un projet naissant et totalement indépendant. Nous avons besoin de votre aide! Cela fait plusieurs mois que nous mettons notre coeur dans la confection de ses chansons. C'est un projet qui nous porte tous les deux et auquel nous croyons follement. 
Vos généreux sous nous permettront de financer les frais de studio à Paris et le travail de nos collaborateurs (réalisation, arrangements, mix et mastering). 



N'oubliez pas d'utiliser les outils de partage de Indiegogo et d'en parler à vos amis !!! 
Gros gros gros merci 
Ariane & Elio
story_txt:
My Tambourinec'est le parisien Elio Della Noce et la montréalaise Ariane Brunet. La rencontre du duo se fait à Astaffort, en mai 2014, lors d'un atelier d'écriture de chansons chapeauté par l'auteur-compositeur-interprète Francis Cabrel. Le groupe s'est formé outre-mer, grâce aux sympathiques nouvelles technologies. Le choix de l'anglais comme langue mère du groupe s'est imposé dans le but de se distancer de des projets d'auteurs-compositeurs francophones respectifs de ses membres et d'étendre leurs horizons musicaux. Le duo entend toutefois mélanger leur langue maternelle commune à l'anglais, et donc présenter quelques pièces francophones. 
Passion Flowers, le premier extrait de My Tambourine (qu'on peut entendre en version pré-maquetté sur un vidéo youtube annexé), est né d'une collaboration avec l'auteur-compositeur-interprète londonien Piers Faccini. Ce dernier assure depuis l'écriture de l'ensemble des textes anglophones du groupe. Style folk à folk progressif. Les influences sont: Nick Drake, Bert Jansch, Crosby stills and nash, Piers Faccini, Fleet Foxes. Le jeu de guitare d'Elio navigue entre les sonorités Folk britanniques, la guitare africaine, et les musiques du monde.Un premier EPL'enregistrement de la première maquette de My Tambourine se fera au Studio History à Paris, en mai prochain. Réalisation de Philippe Almosnino (Keren Ann) et arrangements de Jean-Max Méry (Brigitte, Phoenix). Besoin de vous!!
My Tambourine est un projet naissant et totalement indépendant. Nous avons besoin de votre aide! Cela fait plusieurs mois que nous mettons notre coeur dans la confection de ses chansons. C'est un projet qui nous porte tous les deux et auquel nous croyons follement. Vos généreux sous nous permettront de financer les frais de studio à Paris et le travail de nos collaborateurs (réalisation, arrangements, mix et mastering). 

N'oubliez pas d'utiliser les outils de partage de Indiegogo et d'en parler à vos amis !!! Gros gros gros merci Ariane & Elio

story:
WHO

Hey, I'm Shawna Ray. Presently is the name of a new song I wrote on a milestone birthday, April 30th and the proposed name of this new collaborative EP - where you, the backer, have a say on everything. Through surveys here on Indiegogo and Birthday Backer voting, whether you support with $1 or up to $5,000 - you become members of The Ray Team, as if you are the record label. So you get to help decide what songs end up on the EP, and what the cover looks like. There are corporate sponsorship opportunities at the highest levels and I would love to work with you if you are interested in those options. And in the end, the story will be ours to tell. You're not only the supporter - you're the co-creator. So THANK YOU in advance for making this dream come true!!! 

Five years after my OPEN album was released, I have so many more songs I want to share while also seeking publishers for my book, “Destination is the Journey," a memoir that shares the stories behind these songs. Because of health issues and a major surgery in 2010 and again in 2013, I never got to tour with OPEN album, so that is the plan with this new venture, now that I am healthy and determined to turn my creative side into my career and tour with the Rhythm Ray band. 

The Impact

I am asking for you to help me celebrate my birthday this year through Indiegogo. This will be going out on my birthday, April 30th and ends May 17th. We hope to release the EP at a belated Birthday Bash concert on 7/11, July 11th, 2015. Everything from music to videos and concert planning – it will all hopefully get funded with your help here on Indiegogo. As soon as this project gets funded, I plan to start immediately. And whatever you back, it will get you your reward and also a voice in the project. I can’t wait to finally get this out! Thank you so much for your support! 

Risks & Challenges

The risk and challenge is…I am but one woman and have to outsource studio recording, CD duplication and such to other companies. So things beyond my control could happen to cause delays - but know that I will move mountains before I let a project fail. I will deliver. 

Other Ways You Can Help

For those of you who have already given so much and have a full plate of your own bills and goals, I totally understand if you are not able to give at all. Prayers and good vibes are free and also much appreciated. Also please share the links with your network or select contacts you feel might be interested in sponsoring. I have sponsored several projects, from $5 to $25 and friends and people I’ve ever met but believe in were able to publish books, make documentary films and record albums this way. So I am excited and getting over the uncomfortableness of asking for help. I truly appreciate your support, love and friendship. Thank you, for everything. 

Breakdown of Costs

Funds will be used to record 5 new songs on an EP and produce select videos to go on tour this summer. Of course you will get the MUSIC as well as some extra special things at each level detailed in the columns on the right side! 

If I am able to go beyond my goal, the extended flex goal of $15,000 will allow me to record a full album and tour, here is the full breakdown of costs per items for studio,  producer, musicians, duplication, artwork, promotions…

Flex goal #1: $15,000 to record full album and tour

$300 - pays for mastering - this is important for it to sound good for radio.

$1000 – goes toward artwork design and photos which will be used for the CD, posters, website, and promotion. Having a "brand image" makes a big difference!

$1000 – goes to duplicating the CD's and packaging them so you get a signed copy

$1000 - will enable me to have an effective PR campaign for the album to get it to the ears of fans as well as pitching to industry folks (labels, management, booking, licensing for TV and Film)

$3000 - will be a great boost for touring, stage manager and submitting and traveling to festivals 

$2500 – pays for the talented Rhythm Ray musicians who will play on the record

$2000 – goes toward making some visually and emotionally captivating music videos to go with the songs 

$5000 - pays the studio and producer to make the songs rock

story: Respected Scottish acoustic musician Craig John Davidson has been offered the chance to tour the USA coast to coast with Terry McDermott’s Lotus Crush. We just need to raise the money to get him and his support guitarist Innes Cardno to America to take advantage of this amazing opportunity.

story:
Hey Friends!!

ONE BULLET DOWN is heading back into the studio to record a 6-song EP in the best studios and with the best people in the city and we need your help.  

We want to bring you a top quality recording that has the stamp of the city's finest producers, engineers and studios.  This recording will take the listener through a spectrum of music that has been misplaced in the modern day singles world.

With your help we can elevate our recording process to include industry professionals like MIKE FRASER (AC/DC , METALLICA, AEROSMITH, BRYAN ADAMS) and in studios where these same artists recorded some of their biggest hits. We want to release a record that stacks up against our heroes.

Once complete, we feel the strength of this new material can compete in markets around the world, and we're going to take it there and we hope you'll be right there with us!


We have one-of-a-kind perks friends! Nowhere else will you find such unique rewards! We wanted to make sure we had something for everyone! See the individual perk videos for more info.


What We Need & What You Get

Monies received will go directly to booking large room studio time, top engineer and production time as well as final mixing performed by some of the worlds best mix engineers. 
In this digital world, it's easy to record something on a laptop and share it online, but we feel to truly harness what makes a great song is to embody not only the songwriting, but the traditional recording process as well. 
To do this properly, we have set a goal of $15,000.  The largest portions of this figure are consumed by live room studio time and the final mixing process. 

The chart below defines the dollar allocations more precisely. 

In the event we don't achieve our intended goal, we will reduce the number of songs produced in these live rooms with these top level engineers.

The Impact

For 15 years we have been recording and releasing records that were always just a little shy on quality. This time we want to ensure that no short cuts are taken with our songs and we will finally have the opportunity to produce a top quality product that rivals the best recordings around. 
We have narrowed down 6 songs that all have an individual perspective and unique character ranging from in-your-face rock to hip-hop. These songs will be our musical statement!

    Risks & Challenges

    The music industry is ever changing and we always pride ourselves in being at the forefront of technology and changing trends. Our live show is a testament to this as it stands above any other independent act. We feel the first step in this evolving industry is to have a sonic masterpiece as the foundation on which to construct and grow your brand. 
    We know the obstacles that face today's music industry but we truly believe that heart, passion and the soul that comes from real voices, instruments and sounds will always ring true to the listener.  We believe this is what will carry us and our brand across borders and to the next level. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Despite all the obstacles we face, we hope that you find our goal and vision to pursue our dreams resonates as true for you as it does for us. 
    Every little bit helps!   If unable to donate, please help by sharing our campaign to friends & family.  Just copy and paste the statement and link below:

    ONE BULLET DOWN IS HEADING BACK INTO THE STUDIO AND THEY NEED YOUR HELP.  PLEASE TAKE A MINUTE TO CHECK OUT OUR CROWD FUNDING CAMPAIGN.  LOTS OF COOL AND UNIQUE REWARDS AVAILABLE!
    http://igg.me/at/obdindiegogo


    Forever grateful - OBD


    PERK VIDEOS!

    OBD INDIEGOGO Perk # 1 - THE NEW 6-SONG EP - $10.00 


    Perk # 2 - JOIN OBD FOR A HOMECOMING GIG - $20.00
      Perk #3 - CUSTOMIZED 30 SECOND JINGLE - $25.00

    Perk #4 - DISPOSABLE CAMERA - $50.00

    Perk #5 - TEE SHIRT/THANK-YOU VIDEO - $50.00

    Perk #6 - CONTRIBUTE TO ALBUM/SINGLE ARTWORK - $100.00

    Perk #7 - JOIN OBD IN THE STUDIO - $100.00

    Perk #8 - DOCUMENTARY FILMING - $100.00

    Perk #9 - DRUM LESSON WITH OBD DRUMMER DEAN (SCHROEDER) REIMER - $150.00

    Perk #10 - CUSTOM OBD FLASHLIGHT ROBOT - $200.00

    Perk #11 - OFFICIAL OBD SPONSOR - $500.00

    NEW PERK JUST ADDED - PERK #12 - OBD SHOT GLASS

story:
Hello everyone! Welcome to my Indiegogo campaign! I'm reaching out to you all for your support to help me record 3 new original electronic pieces and produce a new music video. I also plan to perform this new music at a live show next year in New York City.

You may ask why I'm interested in creating electronic music after writing and performing on the saxophone and guitar after all these years? My interest was piqued about 10 years ago when I started using computer programs that taught me to write and record my own electronic music. Over the years while performing for audiences, I also continued to spend a significant amount of time revisiting and building on this new interest. I've become more and more excited about this new sound and am now ready for the production stage.

To give you a better idea of what I intend to produce, I created a sample piece for you to enjoy at the end of the video.  I also included other music videos and pictures of some of the amazing experiences and performances that I've been involved in over the years, ones that have combined and acted as building blocks to create the musician I am today.

I really hope that you will choose to join me on this creative journey and that the outcome will provide you with the same level of pleasure and excitement that I feel personally today.

Thanks again for checking out my campaign and for all your support! I can't wait to begin!

Best wishes to each and every one of you,

Ross



Here is a pie chart of the proposed budget for this project:

(Here's a video of a few performances I had this past year: playing a song with Ryan Miller(from the Band Guster), playing the national anthem in front of 4,900 Sky Sox fans before a game, and playing a show in NYC!)

 

If I am unable to reach my goal, I will still go ahead with the project. The more money raised, the better the songs, music video and show will be. 

(Here's a video of me performing at the Garage School in Karachi, Pakistan.)

You may also help by sharing this campaign with your friends and family via e-mail or on social media. You can also follow me on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram @RossMintzerBand. I'm grateful for any support. 

Without you this project will not be possible. Your help and support will allow me to do something I love. I'm grateful and humble. If you contributed to this campaign, thank you. The music is as much yours as it is mine.

(Here is a photo of me with students and family members before our first choir rehearsal in Karachi, Pakistan.)

(Here's a picture of me with donated instruments I collected that were shipped to children in Pakistan.)

If you would like to contribute to this campaign using bitcoin, please send all contributions to: 1BoVffMqYJdmjpTibuvJYHfxywEaQyEEQ8                                                                                                            

If you would like a perk please e-mail RossMintzer@Gmail.com. All bitcoin contributions will be tallied and reported in updates given throughout the campaign. 

FAQ

Q:When will the perks be delivered?

A: Each Perk perk has "Estimated delivery" below the description. If you got the "Digital Download" you MP3s sent to your e-mail as soon as they are recorded. If you ordered a T-Shirt, you will be asked for your size via e-mail before they are shipped.

Q:When will I find out the date for the show in New York City?

A: The show venue/date and time scheduled for June, will be announced in March-April. There will also be a link posted to livestream the show if you are not located in New York. If you got a ticket for the show and can not attend, you can exchange your ticket for a t-shirt and will be notified by e-mail.

Q:What is the money going to be used towards?

A: There is a pie chart that breaks down what the money will be used towards in the story section of the campaign.

story:
Who the hell is Cassius At Best?

Hey guys, we're Cassius At Best, a three piece indie-rock/alt-rock project based in Marietta, Ohio (right by the border of 'ol West Virginia). We like cats, burritos, good brews and friendly peeps. 

  • We're currently in the process of recording our debut EP and we need your crowdfunding assistance to help us create merchandise (t-shirts, stickers, etc.), CD sleeves and other promotional material to help us make this EP release more successful!
Josh Adams - vocals, guitar, stage spasms
Austin Locke - bass, headbanging, cat petting
Derrick Taylor - drums, rimshots, Herbert impressions
For fans of Manchester Orchestra, Coheed & Cambria, Dinosaur Jr, The Island of Misfit Toys.
Our background:
Back in the day, Josh, Austin and Derrick used to play in a metalcore band called I Come Alive (along with a few other metal/hardcore projects). We played several gigs with professional touring bands the likes of We Came As Romans and After the Burial. After things fell apart with the group, these three dudes came together in an attempt to write catchier songs based on dynamic rhythms and honest (sometimes crass) lyrical content diverse from the metal genre (in short, we didn't want to write breakdowns anymore). 
What we're doing as a band:
We started writing for this project around the beginning of 2015. Our idea was based on a pop-rock concept (approachable singing, four chord progressions) free of creative restrictions (we were tired of the metalcore formula and didn't want to get tied down to a particular genre). While "pop" was an idea for the band, the songs we developed are adversely dynamic with tempo and time signature changes amidst driving choruses. With honest and eager lyrics that capture the different meters of each song, we slowly began to appreciate the diversity of our music in comparison with the formulaic writing usually found in pop-punk, rock and metal bands.

Purpose of this fundraiser:
Let's face it, no one likes begging for money, and neither do we. Luckily, we all have day jobs and salaries that we funnel into this project for equipment, recording, promotion and gas to and from shows. Therefore, we'd like to be clear about our goals and intentions as we approach completion of our debut EP.

  • Production - We're currently recording the upcoming EP (five original songs) with our good friend and music veteran, Dave Cole (What To Say At A Funeral, ex-Jesse Smith & The Holy Ghost/Torture Store). We're paying him so you don't have to; if funding doesn't work, the EP will still be released!
  • Distribution -  Once everything's ready to go, we plan on releasing these songs through free hosts (Bandcamp, Soundcloud) and paid distribution to services like iTunes, Spotify, Amazon and Google Play. Your donation will help us pay for these services as well as printing/manufacturing of physical CD's/sleeves.
  • Merchandise - As it stands, we don't have any merch to sell at shows/online. While we have several designs and quotes for products, it's difficult for us to fund these endeavors and be able to pay our bills. Donations will help us print t-shirts, stickers, etc. The more funding we receive, the more designs/color variations we will be able to sell and award to donors.
  •  Promotion - There are a lot of good services out there that help bands with promotion and advertisement for a certain fee or monthly payment. We intend to promote an EP release and other updates via Facebook and other blog/zine ads. If we don't reach our mark on this one, we'll continue to promote our music through conventional means and services readily available to us. 
If we reach or go beyond our goal, all the paid perks are a go. If we hit higher than expected, donors can expect to receive extra merchandise and possibly additional content from the band (extra songs, music videos, personal show/concert). The impact of going beyond our goal will allow us to work harder and more efficiently, hopefully exposing more listeners to our band and music.
If we don't reach our goal, the EP will still be released! Since we are prepared with art and websites for a digital release, our music will be available for free download. Depending on the perk you choose, we will do our best to honor merchandise rewards such as shirts and physical CD's to all participating donors (any type of support will also earn our undying loyalty). 


What to expect from the debut EP:

The EP, which we've yet to title, will feature five original songs including our single "Scoundrel," which released in May, 2015. Similarly, the new songs will continue that angsty pop-rock feel we achieved working with Dave Cole on the single-- a raw, yet precise representation of our music we perform that's not dependent on artificial programming or auto-tune. 
Track Listing:
1. Friends & Counterweights
2. Broadway
3. Separate Identity
4. Dead Weight (I'll Die Trying, Too)
5. Scoundrel
Can't donate? You can still help us.

We don't expect everyone looking at this page to donate, it's ok. But if you enjoy what content we have available now and hope to see us succeed in any way, share our fundraiser, music and pages with your friends. Feel free to message or contact us about anything, even if it doesn't involve music (we like lots of other stuff, too).

  • Copy and share this page on your Twitter, Facebook, hell, take a screencap and post it on Instagram if you're feeling frisky.
  • Follow us on Twitter or Instagram via @CassiusAtBestOhio.
  • Share our videos/music online or with friends. If you tell a friend to listen to a song you really enjoy, you might just expose them to something new and different they would've never discovered on their own. 
  • Message us on social media or send us a kind email via cassiusatbestohio@gmail.com. We love meeting new friends/fans.
story_txt:
Who the hell is Cassius At Best?


 Hey guys, we're Cassius At Best, a three piece indie-rock/alt-rock project based in Marietta, Ohio (right by the border of 'ol West Virginia). We like cats, burritos, good brews and friendly peeps. 

We're currently in the process of recording our debut EP and we need your crowdfunding assistance to help us create merchandise (t-shirts, stickers, etc.), CD sleeves and other promotional material to help us make this EP release more successful!
Josh Adams - vocals, guitar, stage spasmsAustin Locke - bass, headbanging, cat pettingDerrick Taylor - drums, rimshots, Herbert impressionsFor fans of Manchester Orchestra, Coheed & Cambria, Dinosaur Jr, The Island of Misfit Toys.

Our background:Back in the day, Josh, Austin and Derrick used to play in a metalcore band called I Come Alive (along with a few other metal/hardcore projects). We played several gigs with professional touring bands the likes of We Came As Romans and After the Burial. After things fell apart with the group, these three dudes came together in an attempt to write catchier songs based on dynamic rhythms and honest (sometimes crass) lyrical content diverse from the metal genre (in short, we didn't want to write breakdowns anymore). 

What we're doing as a band:We started writing for this project around the beginning of 2015. Our idea was based on a pop-rock concept (approachable singing, four chord progressions) free of creative restrictions (we were tired of the metalcore formula and didn't want to get tied down to a particular genre). While "pop" was an idea for the band, the songs we developed are adversely dynamic with tempo and time signature changes amidst driving choruses. With honest and eager lyrics that capture the different meters of each song, we slowly began to appreciate the diversity of our music in comparison with the formulaic writing usually found in pop-punk, rock and metal bands.



Purpose of this fundraiser:Let's face it, no one likes begging for money, and neither do we. Luckily, we all have day jobs and salaries that we funnel into this project for equipment, recording, promotion and gas to and from shows. Therefore, we'd like to be clear about our goals and intentions as we approach completion of our debut EP.






Production - We're currently recording the upcoming EP (five original songs) with our good friend and music veteran, Dave Cole (What To Say At A Funeral, ex-Jesse Smith & The Holy Ghost/Torture Store). We're paying him so you don't have to; if funding doesn't work, the EP will still be released!

Distribution -  Once everything's ready to go, we plan on releasing these songs through free hosts (Bandcamp, Soundcloud) and paid distribution to services like iTunes, Spotify, Amazon and Google Play. Your donation will help us pay for these services as well as printing/manufacturing of physical CD's/sleeves.
Merchandise - As it stands, we don't have any merch to sell at shows/online. While we have several designs and quotes for products, it's difficult for us to fund these endeavors and be able to pay our bills. Donations will help us print t-shirts, stickers, etc. The more funding we receive, the more designs/color variations we will be able to sell and award to donors.
 Promotion - There are a lot of good services out there that help bands with promotion and advertisement for a certain fee or monthly payment. We intend to promote an EP release and other updates via Facebook and other blog/zine ads. If we don't reach our mark on this one, we'll continue to promote our music through conventional means and services readily available to us. 


If we reach or go beyond our goal, all the paid perks are a go. If we hit higher than expected, donors can expect to receive extra merchandise and possibly additional content from the band (extra songs, music videos, personal show/concert). The impact of going beyond our goal will allow us to work harder and more efficiently, hopefully exposing more listeners to our band and music.


If we don't reach our goal, the EP will still be released! Since we are prepared with art and websites for a digital release, our music will be available for free download. Depending on the perk you choose, we will do our best to honor merchandise rewards such as shirts and physical CD's to all participating donors (any type of support will also earn our undying loyalty). 
What to expect from the debut EP:

The EP, which we've yet to title, will feature five original songs including our single "Scoundrel," which released in May, 2015. Similarly, the new songs will continue that angsty pop-rock feel we achieved working with Dave Cole on the single-- a raw, yet precise representation of our music we perform that's not dependent on artificial programming or auto-tune. Track Listing:1. Friends & Counterweights2. Broadway3. Separate Identity4. Dead Weight (I'll Die Trying, Too)5. Scoundrel


Can't donate? You can still help us.


 We don't expect everyone looking at this page to donate, it's ok. But if you enjoy what content we have available now and hope to see us succeed in any way, share our fundraiser, music and pages with your friends. Feel free to message or contact us about anything, even if it doesn't involve music (we like lots of other stuff, too).  Copy and share this page on your Twitter, Facebook, hell, take a screencap and post it on Instagram if you're feeling frisky.
Follow us on Twitter or Instagram via @CassiusAtBestOhio.

Share our videos/music online or with friends. If you tell a friend to listen to a song you really enjoy, you might just expose them to something new and different they would've never discovered on their own. 
Message us on social media or send us a kind email via cassiusatbestohio@gmail.com. We love meeting new friends/fans.

story:
The "Operation Lily" mission...

We are seeking help along with family, friends, and fellow citizens to:

  • Create a trust fund for SFC William "Kelly" Lacey's 4 year old daughter.
  • As a father this is my chance (with you) to help SFC Lacey complete one last mission for his daughter.

      

  • A small amount will go to the Okaloosa County Veterans Memorial and the rest will go to trust for Lily's future. Except for CC fees and IndieGoGo fees, postage, etc, all funds will go to the trust.  

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to raise from $20,000 to $100,000 to have enough for to create the trust and select  an institutional trustee, SFL will not be the trustee. 
  • Along with the Operation Lily song, a CD (or download .zip of the Operation Lily Album) will be sent to every person who supports Lily at the $10 or more level.  For $12 we will mail you the physical CD. 

       


     

    We will ship your perks within a few days!

  • If we fall short of raising $13,000 the money will be gifted directly to the family. To create the trust and engage a bank trustee we feel like we need to raise $20,000 to $100,000.  We have an specialist attorney on standby for this purpose. They are donating their work for Operation Lily. 


Why? 

Imagine you are a four year old; proud of your soldier dad and told your daddy was killed in a foreign country :

  • No amount of money can replace Lily's Dad, Ashley's husband and the Lacey's son.  Still this fund professionally managed can be a reminder one day to a little-girl-grown-up of the many people that wanted to show love to Lily and honor what her dad stood for. 
  • I think Gen. George Patton said it best, "We should not cry that such men died, but we should rejoice that such men have lived."  Still, this father cries.  For me it is as much the fathering component lost (I just walked my daughter down the aisle at her wedding) as the hero soldier piece for me.  
  • SFC Lacey served with my son Aubrey Hanson at Ft. Knox. My son's tour was in Iraq a few years earlier deployed from Ft. Carson (4th ID).  The joy of my son returning has the counter balance of sadness for the families whose sons did not return alive.  

Risks

This is pretty low risk. Including producing the Operation Lily song (a rewrite of a 2010 song Hanson/Fritsch) I have spent about $500 of my own money preparing for this event. We are only offering materials that can be shipped immediately or within days.   

  • In the past (pre-internet) I raised $10,000 for the Marc Muncy Family (a Columbus, Ohio Police Officer, Killed in the line of duty). This was done with press releases and a mention or two by Channel 10 on the evening news. People donated to an account at Bank One (Chase).  I have raised money for Autism, a 4 year old with cancer, and similar causes. Generally with me a father (or lack of a father) is a key component. 
  • In 2005 I did a great deal of radio and TV and print to promote my book, Good Debt, Bad Debt (Penguin, 2005, 2007).  I hope to carry forward some of that experience in promoting Operation Lily and future SFL events. 
  • I don't under estimate how extremely difficult it will be to reach 1,000's of donors that will invest in this little girl.  We will need help from media and donors to spread the message. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please help us get word out and make some noise about Operation Lily.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! Or share the link http://OperationLily.com
  • Ask a blogger or TV, radio, or newspaper to write about Operation Lily. 
  • Want to be a fundraising partner? Create your own page at https://www.firstgiving.com/400106 
  • Gifts are tax deductible in general, we are a 501 c3.  If you have questions or need a paper receipt please contact me.  

Thank you for considering Operation Lily.  Jon Hanson, http://SFLToday.org 

More info. 4.5 min video for media:

https://youtu.be/Ragcz7LkTbQ

story:
Hello, we are YOURS. An indie rock band based in San Francisco, California.

We are currently a trio with Milton Nieves, Kazmo Vilmar, and Ahmed Meselhy. We all have a collectively different background; Milton, with roots in Puerto Rico, Kazmo From Brazil and Ahmed from Egypt and Japan!

We are aiming to have a sound that mixes the raw elements in rock, re-discovered through other genres that uses electronics. The band has been active and playing shows locally around the bay area for the past 2 years now.

We have recently finished and produced, with the help of our friends, a music video for our song King of the Hill. Our aim for the video is to be the first taste, a sweet sample of the kind of direction we want to take in our EP. It’s a taste of the new sound that YOURS collectively decided to walk towards.


We are asking for support through donations to help us pay the fees for the upcoming EP this year. With your help we can bring particular musicians to feature on most tracks and the opportunity to use proper equipment and time to produce our songs. We will be working at Tiny Telephone recording and producing our material alongside the veteran producer and engineer, Jamie Riotto. This is our chance to make sure the entire production process goes smoothly for us to only work on the music. These donations would help us immensely with preparing this upcoming EP for all of you to hear!

It’s an exciting time for us at the moment and are very stoked to release the new tunes this fall so stay tuned for updates on the first single. 

Thanks! We’re so glad you took the time to come over here.

Cheers,

YOURS

story:
Short Summary

Really, an Oligopoly? Ohio?, R.O. Ohio, a public service of 2and2is4.com wants to help Ohio citizens resist the corporate overlords trying to create a pot Cartel in Ohio. We therefore are organizing an Anti-Cartel Song Contest. We are trying to raise $500 to promote the contest and entries. 

If we meet our goal, we may consider figuring out if it would be possible to create prizes for submissions. Until we can afford sufficient legal advice concerning how to do this with our corporate structure, and it is not clear that participation is sufficient to consider extra incentives to increase participation, beyond the winning entry receiving the original buckeye guitar as pictured below. As such the "Song Contest"'s prizes, beyond the winner, are purely psychic benefits (as they should be this isn't Canda, you win or you don't, aint no participation rewards); that submittors solely get free promotion on the website but nothing else. 

Please help us prevent the pot cartel. It was only earlier in 2015 that results of the 2014 General Social Survey, one of the best recurring survey on American attitudes, found that a majority of Americans now supported legalizing marijuana. Let's delay gratification and get a better deal for Ohioans that doesn't continue to put pot in the hands of our children and send our fellow citizens to jail over a plant. 


The Marijuana Policy of Ohio Taskforce intentionally plans the cartel to have a residual black market of 16% (p. 177) with an optimal price to the consumer of $9.93 per gram (p. 171)

Using government supported Think Tank Rand Corp's 2010 report (p. 10, 16) , cartel weed is estimated to cost between 1000% and 180,000% the amount it will cost to create the pot.

Additionally using RO's MPOTF's own numbers, more than 3,000 continuing drug dealers across the State of Ohio will be incentivized by $50,000 per year to continue the blackmarket for weed which gives actual minors and RO minors (18-20 year olds old enough to go die in Afghanistan but not toke to Ian James) selling weed at $1 less per gram than cartel weed. Under RO's plan there will be around 88 black market drug dealers per county or 1 per 360 actual minors.

RO is designed to continue Ohio as a prison state and continue to put pot in the hands of our kids.

Vote Yes on Issue 2; No on Issue 3!!!

http://www.washingtonpost.com/news/wonkblog/wp/2015/03/04/majority-of-americans-favor-marijuana-legalization-for-first-time-according-to-the-nations-most-authoritative-survey/

http://mpotf.org/wp-content/uploads/2015/06/MPOTwhitebook.pdf

http://www.rand.org/content/dam/rand/pubs/working_papers/2010/RAND_WR764.pdf

What We Need & What You Get

We need to meet our first goal of $500 to advertise the contest and analyze the efficiency of this approach to our end game of preventing a corrupt cartel from hijacking the state of Ohio against its citizens. You get the psychic benefits of spending money, and potentially get to help maintain state legitimacy as treating all citizens equally, not valuing rich patricians who can write themselves a cartel above the plebians who have little ballot access due to the artificially high transaction costs in 2015.

story:
This is my new collection of original tunes and a couple of standards - featuring guitar. I recorded at The Bunker (NYC) with some of my good buddies from my days in New York, Omer Avital (bass), Duane Eubanks (trumpet), Vince Ector (drums), and Asaf Yuria (tenor sax)! 
After the past three disks, which featured the oud, I felt the need to go back to the guitar - back to the beginning of my love affair with jazz! YOUR donation will help to get BACK TO THE CITY out there by funding the high costs of printing and PR.  

Another way to help:

If you can't make a financial contribution - you can help me by spreading the word.  Share my videos and soundcips on your facebook pages and blogs, write review, tell your local club or festival - "Hey, you've got to bring this amazing guitarist to play here!".

story:
ONCE THIS CAMPAIGN HAS CLOSED YOU CAN CONTINUE TO SUPPORT INTERSECTION AT:

http://www.intersectionmusic.org/advocacy.html


About Intersection

Intersection was born from Kelly Corcoran’s desire to bring a professional contemporary music ensemble to Nashville. Over the past year, that vision has become reality.  We have expanded the musical language of Nashville by focusing on repertoire from the 20th and 21st centuries for both adult and family audiences. As a non-profit organization, we rely on the generosity of our community to help make this vision a reality, and we cannot do so without your help. A donation to Intersection is a contribution to the thriving contemporary music scene growing in Nashville, and helping fund our upcoming year will help create a vibrant season you won’t want to miss.

The time is now for Nashville.  Nashville is clearly growing and considered a music center, compared to New York, Los Angeles and London.  While our music scene is diverse and thriving, Nashville is lacking an eco-system dedicated to the performance, creation and cultivation of contemporary classical music.  Intersection is the first professional ensemble in Nashville presenting this new music in a non-traditional way, truly breaking down boundaries with explorative, avant-garde contemporary music programming geared for audiences of varying ages.   Contemporary music is a vital piece of a truly diverse, thriving music city.  

What We Need & What You Get

We aim to raise $15,000 to compensate our musicians and artists for our October performance - Sea of Tonality.    This program includes 19 musicians.    The $15,000 covers their compensation for all rehearsals and the performance as well as support to bring Julia Wolfe, Pulitzer Prize winning composer, here to Nashville for the performance and rehearsals.   

We have some fabulous perks including access to OPEN REHEARSALS, SOUND EXPLORATION, SEATING WITHIN THE ENSEMBLE, CONTEMPORARY MUSIC CRASH COURSE and more. 

If we don't reach our goal…. 

Intersection will need to determine an alternative plan.   This may delay the launch of our October concert and our second season.   No matter what - the funds raised will go towards our mission to bring contemporary classical music to Nashville.   We  have 3 programs planned for the season and have secured a grant to partially fund our January Mariachi program. 

If we go beyond our goal…

That is fantastic!   Our budget this season is $110,000 and we are hoping to raise $42,000 from Individual supporters like you!    Any funds gained through this campaign beyond our goal will go towards our budget  for season 2. 

The Impact

A donation to Intersection will help keep contemporary music at the forefront of Nashville’s music conversation, and our first season is a material example of our work in action. These performances provided a speaker box for 20th and 21st century composers as well as others in the local arts community. Collaborating with groups including New Dialect and Zeitgeist Gallery, Intersection took the best in local dance and visual art to magnify the importance of all contemporary art.  Nashville Scene, The Tennessean, Nashville Arts and WPLN, among others, all praised intersection’s dive into unfamiliar territories, further proving Nashville’s readiness to embrace such an ensemble.

We will also dedicate half of our programming to families and younger audiences.  We are passionate about introducing children to contemporary music and are dedicated to building a robust eco-system for contemporary classical music in Nashville and beyond. 

Risks & Challenges

We need you to share the message that contemporary classical music has value and that we need Intersection in Nashville.    We must accurately compensate musicians, artists, composers and collaborators for their expertise and as a result we do have a sizable amount of funds to raise.   Intersection aims to be presenting art and performance of value and intention.    We hope you will join us on this journey.   Without financial support, Intersection will not be able to fulfill it's mission.    We are actively pursuing all sources of income and are hitting the streets talking to many about Intersection, but we cannot move forward presenting programs until we have our funds secured.   

Other Ways You Can Help

Although we hope you will donate to Intersection and our second season, there are many ways to help other than financial support. If you know people who may be interested in Intersection’s mission, please share this page with them. Word of mouth is still one of the most effective tools for promotion, and we cannot succeed in showing this campaign to everyone without your help! Indiegogo has created very effective sharing tools that can be found on this page, and we hope you will take a moment to use them to spread the word to those in your life who also understand the importance of contemporary music in Nashville.

Explore our website at www.intersectionmusic.org

Buy tickets and view complete Season 2 details at www.intersectionmusic.org

If you are interested in volunteering or supporting Intersection in some other way,  please contact us at intersection@intersectionmusic.org

Thank you!

VISION STATEMENT

The vision of Intersection is to expand and shift the perspectives of audiences and musicians of all ages, through the creation, cultivation and performance of contemporary music, a vital, thriving and inspiring form of art. 

MISSION STATEMENT

Intersection is a flexible contemporary music ensemble dedicated to challenging the traditional concert experience, exploring music of the 20th and 21st centuries, supporting living composers, presenting programs for younger audiences, embracing collaboration, technology and the avant-garde, while expanding, respecting and embracing the musical and cultural diversity of Nashville.   

Visit us here:  www.intersectionmusic.org
story_txt:
ONCE THIS CAMPAIGN HAS CLOSED YOU CAN CONTINUE TO SUPPORT INTERSECTION AT: 
http://www.intersectionmusic.org/advocacy.htmlAbout Intersection
Intersection was born from Kelly Corcoran’s desire to bring a professional contemporary music ensemble to Nashville. Over the past year, that vision has become reality.  We have expanded the musical language of Nashville by focusing on repertoire from the 20th and 21st centuries for both adult and family audiences. As a non-profit organization, we rely on the generosity of our community to help make this vision a reality, and we cannot do so without your help. A donation to Intersection is a contribution to the thriving contemporary music scene growing in Nashville, and helping fund our upcoming year will help create a vibrant season you won’t want to miss.
The time is now for Nashville.  Nashville is clearly growing and considered a music center, compared to New York, Los Angeles and London.  While our music scene is diverse and thriving, Nashville is lacking an eco-system dedicated to the performance, creation and cultivation of contemporary classical music.  Intersection is the first professional ensemble in Nashville presenting this new music in a non-traditional way, truly breaking down boundaries with explorative, avant-garde contemporary music programming geared for audiences of varying ages.   Contemporary music is a vital piece of a truly diverse, thriving music city.  

What We Need & What You Get
We aim to raise $15,000 to compensate our musicians and artists for our October performance - Sea of Tonality.    This program includes 19 musicians.    The $15,000 covers their compensation for all rehearsals and the performance as well as support to bring Julia Wolfe, Pulitzer Prize winning composer, here to Nashville for the performance and rehearsals.   
We have some fabulous perks including access to OPEN REHEARSALS, SOUND EXPLORATION, SEATING WITHIN THE ENSEMBLE, CONTEMPORARY MUSIC CRASH COURSE and more. 
If we don't reach our goal…. 
Intersection will need to determine an alternative plan.   This may delay the launch of our October concert and our second season.   No matter what - the funds raised will go towards our mission to bring contemporary classical music to Nashville.   We  have 3 programs planned for the season and have secured a grant to partially fund our January Mariachi program. 
If we go beyond our goal…
That is fantastic!   Our budget this season is $110,000 and we are hoping to raise $42,000 from Individual supporters like you!    Any funds gained through this campaign beyond our goal will go towards our budget  for season 2. 

The Impact
A donation to Intersection will help keep contemporary music at the forefront of Nashville’s music conversation, and our first season is a material example of our work in action. These performances provided a speaker box for 20th and 21st century composers as well as others in the local arts community. Collaborating with groups including New Dialect and Zeitgeist Gallery, Intersection took the best in local dance and visual art to magnify the importance of all contemporary art.  Nashville Scene, The Tennessean, Nashville Arts and WPLN, among others, all praised intersection’s dive into unfamiliar territories, further proving Nashville’s readiness to embrace such an ensemble.We will also dedicate half of our programming to families and younger audiences.  We are passionate about introducing children to contemporary music and are dedicated to building a robust eco-system for contemporary classical music in Nashville and beyond. 
Risks & Challenges
We need you to share the message that contemporary classical music has value and that we need Intersection in Nashville.    We must accurately compensate musicians, artists, composers and collaborators for their expertise and as a result we do have a sizable amount of funds to raise.   Intersection aims to be presenting art and performance of value and intention.    We hope you will join us on this journey.   Without financial support, Intersection will not be able to fulfill it's mission.    We are actively pursuing all sources of income and are hitting the streets talking to many about Intersection, but we cannot move forward presenting programs until we have our funds secured.   

Other Ways You Can Help
Although we hope you will donate to Intersection and our second season, there are many ways to help other than financial support. If you know people who may be interested in Intersection’s mission, please share this page with them. Word of mouth is still one of the most effective tools for promotion, and we cannot succeed in showing this campaign to everyone without your help! Indiegogo has created very effective sharing tools that can be found on this page, and we hope you will take a moment to use them to spread the word to those in your life who also understand the importance of contemporary music in Nashville.Explore our website at www.intersectionmusic.org
Buy tickets and view complete Season 2 details at www.intersectionmusic.org
If you are interested in volunteering or supporting Intersection in some other way,  please contact us at intersection@intersectionmusic.org
Thank you!VISION STATEMENTThe vision of Intersection is to expand and shift the perspectives of audiences and musicians of all ages, through the creation, cultivation and performance of contemporary music, a vital, thriving and inspiring form of art. MISSION STATEMENTIntersection is a flexible contemporary music ensemble dedicated to challenging the traditional concert experience, exploring music of the 20th and 21st centuries, supporting living composers, presenting programs for younger audiences, embracing collaboration, technology and the avant-garde, while expanding, respecting and embracing the musical and cultural diversity of Nashville.   Visit us here:  www.intersectionmusic.org

story:
(NEW: I will donate 10% of what is coming in to the Syrian refugees in Denmark)

Hi! I am Flemming Borby, a Danish musical artist living in Berlin, Germany.

I have been doing music for 30 years, but till now, not yet released an album in own name.
But here it is! 
I am very proud of this album, recorded with great musicians in Austin, Texas and  in Berlin, Germany.
My big dream is to release this album on vinyl.
To make that dream come through, the goal is to raise 2500$. 
It will cover the expenses at the press plant, and bring out 500 copies. 
The rest of the LP's not preordered here, I will sell online, and at concerts.
You can support this idea by pledging 15$ or more.
You will get a copy of the album, if you pledge 25$ or more.
I will ship it to the whole world.
If you want to know more about me and my music, be welcome to visit my website www.flemmingborby.net and the video for the title song "Somebody Wrong", recorded in Funkhaus, Berlin can be watched right here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=agfaQJrD1Lg
Thanks!
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Album info:

Flemming Borby -"Somebody Wrong"

Flemming Borby – vocals, acoustic and electric guitars

Jon Sanchez – electric guitars, hammond organ, moog

Andrew Pressman – bass

Mike Meadows – drums, percussion

Martin Wenk – trumpet, horn arrangements

Jenifer Jackson - vocals

Vanessa Lively – vocals

Angela Cory – vocals, harmonica

Jo Ambros – pedal steel

Rich Millin – drums on ”It Hurt Me So” -”I Heard The Wind Blow”- ”Me And You And The Moon”

Sven Mühlbradt bass on ”It Hurt Me So”- ”I Heard The Wind Blow”- ”Me And You And The Moon”

Kullen Fuchs – hammond organ on ”It Hurt Me So”

Johnny Stage – slide guitar on ”Somebody Wrong”, ”Its Alright”

Le Thanh Ho – vocal on ”Me And You And The Moon”

Recorded at the Sounds Outrageous Studio, Austin, Texas engineered by Lars Goransson

Additional recordings at the P1 Studio, Funkhaus Berlin, Germany, engineered by Marco Birkner

Mixed in Copenhagen, Denmark by Johnny Stage

Mastered in Berlin by Stefan Noltemeyer

All tracks written and produced by Flemming Borby

1. Somebody Wrong

2. It Hurt Me So

3. I Heard The Wind Blow

4. Ended Over Nothing

5. Its Alright

6. Me And You And The Moon

7. The Famous Part

8. Mud And Mould

story:
SILVIA QUERCI live

E' il momento. Bisogna fermare la voce di Silvia per sempre. 

  • Silvia Querci per chi non la conoscesse, riducendo al minimo, è Nutrice nel musical Romeo e Giulietta (ama e cambia il mondo vedi video ndr)
  • 4 musicisti insieme a Silvia per una registrazione tutta di un fiato
  • il pubblico, limitato, partecipe di questo evento

A tutti gli amici che ci aiuteranno in questo progetto, non importa quanto, sarà data la possibilità di partecipare alla serata di presentazione del disco.

LA MUSICA

  • Silvia canterà brani legati da un unico filo conduttore: la vita di Silvia. 
  • Una esclusiva: la registrazione di un inedito scritto per lei da Roberta Faccani e Giordano Tittarelli
  • PERCHE'

Perché Silvia ha condiviso questa sua idea e per festeggiare i nostri 20 anni di amicizia mi sembra il minimo che possa fare.

Perché per realizzarlo ci sono sforzi personali che tutti facciamo con piacere, ma nessuno è un ricco ereditiere (speriamo nella prossima vita).

TUTTO CHIARO

A chi condividerà questo progetto verrà inviato un resoconto finale di quanto raccolto. E per ringraziarvi:

  • la partecipazione dal vivo alla serata di presentazione del disco in una location eccezionale che vi verrà comunicata a tempo debito
  • ricevere in regalo un brano registrato durante la serata

UN ALTRO MODO PER ESSERE DEI NOSTRI

Per realizzare un progetto del genere non servono solo soldi:
  • Vogliamo fare delle riprese e realizzare anche il video: operatori professionisti, patiti del filmato rubato, grandi fotografi sconosciuti, geni di instagram fatevi avanti
  • Se vi viene in mente come aiutarci, accettiamo proposte

Questo per adesso è tutto. Grazie, comunque!

story:
Hi friends and fans!

Thanks so much for taking the time to watch my campaign video! I sincerely hope that it moves you.  I also hope that you'd like to be part of this journey with me!

The purpose of this campaign is to raise money needed to record my Nashville album.

The Campaign Pitch

Hi there,

The purpose of this campaign is to gain your support for helping me record my new songs.  I truly hope that you will consider in joining me for a musical adventure ride that is bound to inspire, excite and provide you with real life experience of the music industry, through my journey!  

My songs are written and just waiting to come to life in the studio, with your support.  Initial recordings of my new songs are already getting airplay - with very positive comments on the CBC and BBC (who were embarrassingly glowing in their review.)  

It would be so amazing if you would participate in this quest, and help me produce and release this new collection of my reflective and uplifting original songs.  If you enjoy some of the attached pieces and believe in Indie Artists, do come on board!  .

A little bit about me

My name is Annie. I am a singer, songwriter, vocal coach, performer and occasional spiritual guide (or so I've been told). My father is a musician, my mother, a music teacher.  I was so fortunate to be part of a musical family of seven children. I was singing before I could talk, playing the piano since I was six years old.  I wrote my first song at the age of eight. 

I perform live around the beautiful city of Toronto with some of the most lovely and talented people in town.  I am very grateful to have to have the opportunity to perform my songs every week at a wonderful venue in downtown Toronto (120 Diner), in addition to other professional gigs around the city.  I also compose music for film as well as jingles for commercials.

I know that I am SO blessed that I get to do what I love through music, through voice and through serving others.  

Music brings me so much joy and, at times, it has brought a lot of pain too. Rediscovery of many aspects of one’s self can be found in a song, a poem and a melody. I want share the message of hope, love and kindness that come my way through music. 

 

What I'm trying to achieve

I was extremely fortunate to have met an amazing producer while in Nashville recently. His name is Fred Mollin.  Fred has tremendous success developing and recording artists such as Billie Joel, Dan Hill and many more.   We met for a coffee while I was there – after which, I insisted on singing Fred five original songs – all in the parking lot of the coffee shop!  Now, Fred is willing to take a chance on me and has agreed to produce and record my music.   However, I do have to pay for studio time an orchestra, arranger, cd's, art, engineers etc for this to happen - I sincerely hope that you will take a chance on me too!   

While my main goal is to record an album in Nashville with Fred, I am also currently completing an album that I had already started.  As well, when that is completed, I have so many songs written and ready for production I want to record one more album. 

I know that this is ambitious but I know with all my heart that my sole purpose in life is to create music that will inspire others.  Music that will encourage and empower you to feel deeply, to honor and respect all people, so that we all may live in harmony.

The story behind my music

Tragedy struck my family on three occasions. By the age of 14, I had lost three brothers. The aftermath basically paved my path for me. My parents did the best that they could and although I lived in their shadow of darkness and pain for much of my life, I was a seemingly happy person, yet I carried with me an underlying sadness and the worry that the worst can happen at any time. Growing up I poured my soul into music, but I found myself floundering and felt like I was floating through life.  At that time, the music I was writing was intense and based on loss (sometimes it still is).   

Four years ago, I pulled out an old song, written years before. It was a cry for help. A prayer and a plea. At 3AM one morning, I sat at my piano with tears streaming down my face, begging to be heard. I was desperate to feel again, for God or the universe or whatever is out there that is bigger than us, to help me. 

I felt like, somehow, my prayers were answered.  I looked for, and found the signs that I was ready for my life to change.  I started to notice some crazy things in my physical reality, this was constant and I felt like I was in the twilight zone. One of my students urged me to open myself up to new possibilities, to meditate and awaken myself to new experiences and insights and open myself to a new spiritual reality.  This has become profoundly true for me - I had reached the darkest stage of my life - only once I had given up, surrendered myself, did I start to wake up. (Side note: I will try to keep this short and will be creating a video blog at some point to explain further.) 

Ever since this started happening, my perspective has changed.  Wonderful things have been happening. I discovered meditation and how to heal from the past and escape the thoughts.  The music I am now writing feels as though it is divinely inspired at times. I have big dreams to share this music that I hope many will enjoy and find helpful.  There is a clear message about love and kindness. With every part of me, I know that my sole purpose is to inspire others with this music and hopefully encourage people to appreciate those around them.    

Please know that your contribution will go towards something good - something pure - and that you will be helping to seed a positive message that can help a lot of people.

The album costs

I have to raise $26,835 for the Nashville album plus an additional $10,000 to help me with my other two albums.  I'd also love to get some records of my very recent release of 'Be Careful What You Wish For'   I know I have a huge goal but I have dreams to help inspire others with music and I'm hoping that you may want to help too! I have no idea if I'm capable of raising that much money but I'm going to try! Hopefully with your help.  

If I exceed my goal, this would give me a larger budget to work.  I would use this money to go towards marketing and the production of the albums and hopefully vinyl records too.

What you get in return 

There are some great perks available to contributors.   

1. The chance to be a part of something very special and inspirational.

2. We can write a song together, well... you come up with the poem or lyrical content and I turn it into song. What a great gift for a loved one or just for yourself!  

3. Handwritten lyrics

4. Singing lessons with me

5. The chance to join me on stage at one of my intimate shows! (I'd have to help you prepare for it of course)

6. House Concerts (within Toronto and if you're willing to pay for travel and accommodation, then outside of Toronto is doable too!)

7. An invite to Nashville to come to the studio and sit in on a tracking session with Fred Mollin and I.

8. Skype Singing Lessons and meet and greets

9. Signed CDs of my first album "Shades of Red" and 2nd album 'Be Careful What You Wish For'

10. Autographed A4 size head shot

11.  A credit on the album

12.  A VIP newsletter from week-to-week to keep you up-to-date on the progress!

13. Skype meet and greets

14. Autographed Album Art T-Shirt 

 

Other ways you can help

Some people aren't able to contribute, but that doesn't mean that they can't help:

Share the link! Help me make some noise about this. Tell your friends and help spread the word.  

If you are able, come and see me play! I am grateful to get to live my purpose and would love for you to be a part of it.

Suggest a perk you'd like to see me offer! The campaign is a morphing, collective effort, just like the music.

Where will the money go?

1. Making a record in Nashville requires a lot of help. Fred will have a musical arranger on the project. The money will also go towards paying an orchestra and some of the best musicians in Nashville. Produced by Fred Mollin. Mixing/Mastering.

2.  Production of CD's.

3.  The two albums I'm currently working on. I have started one but there is so much more recording and mixing to be done. This has very much been a DIY project which has taken SO long.  It would be wonderful to be able to book an engineer and not have to worry about how I'm going to pay for it. Once again, there would be mastering costs, musician costs, engineering costs, production of CDs, marketing.  

I do have some stretch goals which, at the moment, seem impossible but... I'm going to go for it anyway. If I happen to make the goal, I may keep this campaign open a little longer in order to try to achieve bigger budget for all three projects. While I would also love to be able to put the music onto a physical record, this is more expensive than producing a CD. I also hope to engage press and other PR channels to get my music out to be heard.  Hopefully I would even be able to go out on the road and bring this music to you wherever you are!   

Risks and challenges

Of course, there are risks involved in this. I really hope you decide to take a chance and come along for the ride. I am strong, I am determined.  I will keep working my butt off to get this music out there. Let's do this together!

The risks and challenges are few.  Distribution of Vinyl takes time, but offering downloads of the albums and individual songs is both quick and efficient.  By offering these two channels - vinyl and downloads only - we can both save on costs and stay on schedule.  The songs are done and already sound so great – As mentioned the advance tracks I've sent in have been getting attention and airplay from CBC in addition to BBC. It’s now time to get these records done.

Your help with this final push gives you gives us the ability to put it all out expediently, to strike while the iron is hot, so to speak.  You will also then have the ‘bragging rights” that you helped to bring these songs into the world. 

And finally, thank you.

This record needs you and I need you too! Your donation, link sharing, word of mouth, as well as your love and support all go into making this a collective effort to put the songs where they belong - in your ears and out in the world! Thank you in advance for your support! 

The way music makes it out into the world is changing. The landscape is shifting as we speak. Crowdfunding is a powerful and important tool for independent artists of all mediums. Your support is a thumbs-up contribution to a movement as well as a stake in a record that would not be possible without a community. Thank you for joining that loving and supportive community.

Hopefully with your help.  If I exceed my goal, this would give me a larger budget to work.  I would use this money to go towards marketing and the production of the albums and hopefully vinyl records too.What you get in return There are some great perks available to contributors.   1. The chance to be a part of something very special and inspirational.2. We can write a song together, well... you come up with the poem or lyrical content and I turn it into song. What a great gift for a loved one or just for yourself!  3. Handwritten lyrics4. Singing lessons with me5. The chance to join me on stage at one of my intimate shows! (I'd have to help you prepare for it of course)6. House Concerts (within Toronto and if you're willing to pay for travel and accommodation, then outside of Toronto is doable too!)7. An invite to Nashville to come to the studio and sit in on a tracking session with Fred Mollin and I.8. Skype Singing Lessons and meet and greets9. Signed CDs of my first album "Shades of Red" and 2nd album 'Be Careful What You Wish For'10. Autographed A4 size head shot11.  A credit on the album12.  A VIP newsletter from week-to-week to keep you up-to-date on the progress!13. Skype meet and greets14. Autographed Album Art T-Shirt  Other ways you can helpSome people aren't able to contribute, but that doesn't mean that they can't help:Share the link! Help me make some noise about this. Tell your friends and help spread the word.  If you are able, come and see me play! I am grateful to get to live my purpose and would love for you to be a part of it.Suggest a perk you'd like to see me offer! The campaign is a morphing, collective effort, just like the music.Where will the money go?1. Making a record in Nashville requires a lot of help. Fred will have a musical arranger on the project. The money will also go towards paying an orchestra and some of the best musicians in Nashville. Produced by Fred Mollin. Mixing/Mastering.2.  Production of CD's.3.  The two albums I'm currently working on. I have started one but there is so much more recording and mixing to be done. This has very much been a DIY project which has taken SO long.  It would be wonderful to be able to book an engineer and not have to worry about how I'm going to pay for it. Once again, there would be mastering costs, musician costs, engineering costs, production of CDs, marketing.  I do have some stretch goals which, at the moment, seem impossible but... I'm going to go for it anyway. If I happen to make the goal, I may keep this campaign open a little longer in order to try to achieve bigger budget for all three projects. While I would also love to be able to put the music onto a physical record, this is more expensive than producing a CD. I also hope to engage press and other PR channels to get my music out to be heard.  Hopefully I would even be able to go out on the road and bring this music to you wherever you are!   Risks and challengesOf course, there are risks involved in this. I really hope you decide to take a chance and come along for the ride. I am strong, I am determined.  I will keep working my butt off to get this music out there. Let's do this together!The risks and challenges are few.  Distribution of Vinyl takes time, but offering downloads of the albums and individual songs is both quick and efficient.  By offering these two channels - vinyl and downloads only - we can both save on costs and stay on schedule.  The songs are done and already sound so great – As mentioned the advance tracks I've sent in have been getting attention and airplay from CBC in addition to BBC. It’s now time to get these records done.Your help with this final push gives you gives us the ability to put it all out expediently, to strike while the iron is hot, so to speak.  You will also then have the ‘bragging rights” that you helped to bring these songs into the world. And finally, thank you.This record needs you and I need you too! Your donation, link sharing, word of mouth, as well as your love and support all go into making this a collective effort to put the songs where they belong - in your ears and out in the world! Thank you in advance for your support! The way music makes it out into the world is changing. The landscape is shifting as we speak. Crowdfunding is a powerful and important tool for independent artists of all mediums. Your support is a thumbs-up contribution to a movement as well as a stake in a record that would not be possible without a community. Thank you for joining that loving and supportive community.

story: Hi!!  My name is Debbie Pascarella, I am an award-winning Nashville songwriter.  "I write strong, uptempo female attitude songs that any woman can relate to, and no strong man would feel threatened by".  I write songs about everyday experiences of the everyday woman.  People tell me I say things most women "don't say out loud".  Somebody has to say them!!  I think we need more songs women can relate to!!  I have wanted to "make a record" since I was 10 years old.  I even had a dream when I was a little girl that I was a woman and I won a grammy.   If I am successful, I will defeat some of the odds and challenges of the music Industry...I am looking forward to making this dream come true and to pave the way for other female Artist/Performing Songwriters...with your help I can!

story:
Short Summary

Hey guys! Years ago I started writing original music, and about 6 months ago I started working on what I was going to be an EP, but then snowballed into a 7-track album which was released online a few weeks ago. I've gotten a lot of good feedback about the album, and I really wanted to get it out to the bigger streaming/download services, and onto hardcopy CD's. Getting it to the bigger digital retailers will allow you guys to listen to it however you like, and getting it stamped onto hard-copy CD's will help me a lot in booking shows at bigger venues, and getting air-time on local radio. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • $753 dollars and ten cents will get 100 posters, 300 CD's in custom jackets, and digital distribution. WHO NEEDS A RECORD LABEL, RIGHT?
  • The perks? Well, posters, CD's, digital downloads, private shows, T-shirts, all that Jazz. 
  • If we don't make it to my goal, then I'll try to make up the difference by playing shows and selling CD's, T-shirts, and posters.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Can't afford to contribute? No worries, if you wanna help, just share the campaign or the album with your friends or on social media.

    Other Ways You Can Help  Can't afford to contribute? No worries, if you wanna help, just share the campaign or the album with your friends or on social media.

story:
Hello, and thank you for stumbling upon this page.

Regardless of whether you're here intentionally or by complete happenstance, welcome! I am Ryne Meadow, a twenty-two year old dream pop singer/songwriter from rural North Georgia. 

This year has been huge for me so far! For starters, I packed up everything I owned and moved across the country to the NYC area with the intention of finding my place in the music industry. Somewhere in the midst of packing up my old family home and playing several farewell gigs with all of my new gear, I finished thirteen demos, sent them off to twenty or so labels, and hoped for the best. I told myself "Ryne, if you don't hear back from anyone in the next three months, you're gonna have to suck it up and do this on your own." 

  ... and that, dear reader, is how we got to this little campaign.

Let's backtrack a little, though, so you can fully understand the importance of this album to me. To be completely honest, these songs are not "new." All of them were written a good four to five years ago in my little bedroom, with only a teddy frog and a cat for an audience. They hold the biggest place in my heart, because they're not the same songs they were five years ago. They've grown so much, twisting and shaping into entities that I never imagined possible, much like the man I've become. That's so beautiful to me. Each song captures a specific moment(s) in my life and I'm instantly taken aback every time I hear/play/share them. This isn't just an album to me, it's a story, a work of art.

By opening up your heart and donating to my album, you'll be helping me share with the world the tale I've been dying to tell.

What I Need From You & What You'll Get From Me

Although I'm doing this record on my own, creatively speaking, it doesn't come without a cost. In order to fully fund the making of this record, I'm asking for $5,000. Almost half of this budget will go towards mixing and mastering of the tracks themselves. 

Mixing will be done by the incredible Matt Tamisan at Japanski Studios in Athens, Ga. Basically, I record each song in my bedroom at home. I then bring the parts to Matt in the studio. We'll scrap the fake piano I've tracked and record live piano using the upright on site. We add vocals and little tid-bits here and there, but we mainly focus on mixing. 

The rest of the budget will cover the cost of making merchandise (i.e. CD Production, Screenprinting T-Shirts, Shipping your perks, etc.).

Speaking of Perks, let me tell you about some of the goodies I have to offer you! Aside from the typical things like physical cd's and screen printed t-shirts, I've come up with some unique things that make you feel more connected to me. 

  • Starting off simple, you can get exclusive instrumentals of each song on the album. These will ONLY be available through this campaign and they are limited.
  • I'll be teaming up with friend and amazingly talented fashion designer Laria NYC to make a limited number of custom, hand embroidered t-shirts for your wearing pleasures.
  • If you know me personally (some of you may not and that's SO okay), you know that I needle felt, because I'm an old cat lady. Needle Felted Brooches and Bags are up for grabs!
  • Want your own private concert? I am offering house shows/webcam shows to very generous donors! 
  • If you're in the Athens, Ga. area in the time of finishing the record, you could spend a day in the studio with Matt and I.
  • Are you musically inclined and love to perform on stage? You could have the chance to come onstage with me!
... and the list goes on! You'll also receive written/video updates from me on the regular. You'll be the first to see exclusive studio diaries, album progress updates, and receive important information (album title, artwork, show schedules, perk production, etc.). 

Now, of course, I'm running the risk of not fully meeting my goal. That's scary and makes me a bit anxious, of course. If that's to happen, I may have to hold back on some of the merchandise. For example, I may have to limit the amount of t-shirts or posters I have printed. However, we're going to remain positive. If something of that nature happens, we'll deal with it together and I'll think of other prizes to make up for the things being sacrificed. Regardless of whether the goal is met or not, I WILL be making this album! 

The Impact

This campaign will last a total of 60 days, which seems like a long time. During those two months, I will be working to finalize each song prepare it for mixing. As of right now, two songs have been mixed, seven have been finalized, and four require more work. It may not seem like a lot of work, but it definitely is.

If you're to contribute to my campaign, it would give me the push that I need to finish everything before I enter the studio again in November. Though I'm doing the record to share my story, it always helps to know that people are listening. It's always made me nervous to be vulnerable, but having your support would be incredibly humbling and inspire me to be transparent. These are the rawest emotions that I'll be sharing with you. It already feels like a weight is being lifted off of my shoulders just by writing this. 

This album, to me, is like no other. It takes a step in a different direction than what's so popular in music today. I wanted to create something uniquely my own, but, also, something incredibly relatable. I whole-heartedly believe that I've done that.

Risks & Challenges

I've already faced some challenges with making this record. The number one challenge, of course, was getting out of the mindset of "you can fund this on your own, you don't need help." Realistically, I can't fund this album on my own in the timeframe I have, which was hard for me to accept. I'm a very independent person and it took quite a long while for me to be comfortable with asking for help.

More recently, however, I've ran into traveling issues. Since I'm making the record back in Georgia, I have to travel from New Jersey to meet with Matt in the studio. As you all know, traveling isn't cheap and I've come to realize that my trip to Georgia in September simply cannot happen as of right now. It made me a bit upset when I realized this, but it also pushed me to work harder at making this happen. I WILL be returning to the studio in November. If the record isn't finished in that trip, it will be finished soon after. The album will be out NO LATER than March of 2016!

Other Ways You Can Help

There are so many ways you can help me with this! Funding is vital, of course, but word of mouth is just as important.

Please take a moment to use the Indiegogo share tools to spread my little campaign all over social media. The more noise we make, the more buzz we'll get! Let's make some noise!

If you have any questions regarding this campaign, please contact me!

And if you've read this whole spiel, I love you. It means so much that you've taken time out of your day to devote to my art.

Thank you guys.

Let's make this happen!

-ryne <3
