mixing, vocals
Miene Costa – tap dance,
vocals
Szilvia Csaranko - grand
piano
Christian Dawid - clarinet,
saxophone, vocals
Davide Casali Eschmann - vocals
Hansjörg Gehring - trombone, vocals
Anja Günther - clarinet
Alex Haas - double bass, vocals
Hermann Haertel jun. - violin, vocals

Evi Heigl - violin, vocals
Loni Kuisle – vocals
Guy Schalom - drums, percussion,
palmas
Ilya Shneyveys - accordion, ukulele, glockenspiel, vocals
Lorin Sklamberg – vocals
Michel Watzinger – dulcimer
Stofferl Well - trumpet, harp


What next?

As on our first Alpen Klezmer CD, I’m not just concerned with the musical aspect of combining two great folk traditions. Four years ago, it became extremely important to me to make people aware of the roots that Yiddish and Bavarian folk music have in common and to show that we are all connected at a deep human level. It was almost by chance and quite unexpectedly that this new genre came into being. I was fortunate enough to be awarded the Munich prize for cultural innovation in 2012, and then in 2014 my musical partner Ilya Shneyveys and I received the German Prize for World Music. I had never expected this kind of recognition and am overwhelmed by the success of the project! I’m absolutely thrilled to have won these awards!
The Alpen Klezmer To the Sea! project takes everything a step further. The fusion of the micro and macro levels of both styles, both linguistically and musically, has made it possible to develop a unique artistic language, and To the Sea! is a vital stage in this new journey. The support of all my colleagues, not least that of Alan Bern, and also your enthusiastic response to concerts, mean such a lot. They give me the strength to speak out against hatred, envy and resentment and to do all I can to contribute to a peaceful world. That might sound a bit cheesy, but it really is incredibly important to me.
I am firmly convinced that we can create a more peace-loving world if we open ourselves to other cultures with a spirit of curiosity, and a desire to share the beautiful things which each of us has to offer. Only in this way can we find ourselves mirrored in the eyes of others and learn to identify with what at first can perhaps seem alienating and threatening.
I hope that my work can inspire you to have the courage to stand up against marginalization, and to speak out for those who don’t have a voice of their own. And of course there will also be an enormous amount of fabulous music which will touch both hearts and minds, and get everyone up on the dance floor as well!

What you can give us, and what we can give you in
return
In order to cover all the costs involved, I need €10,000 for the studio,
the mixing and mastering, the musicians‘ fees, press material and our
promotional clip. That’s a lot of money.
What I can offer in return includes a free copy of our CD, I can bake for you, Grammy-winner and truely gifted chef Lorin Sklamberg will cook a whole dinner for you, or I can show you
the traces of Jewish life on a tour of the historic city of Munich. I can come to your parties and yodel
for you and your guests. I can offer you singing lessons, or two tickets to our
CD release event. There’s a lot to choose from – just tell me what I can do for
you!

Risks and challenges
I want to make it clear that I myself will
accept no fees for this CD and that all funds will go exclusively towards
production costs. 

The production of a CD is not only an
artistic adventure for an independent artist such as myself – it also involves
considerable financial challenges. Galileo MC, who are bringing this CD out in
November 2016, will cover certain costs but there is still a lot for me to
finance out of my own pocket. To help me come out of the project relatively
financially unscathed, I urgently need your support! I hope to collect €5,000
in the first “round”, and if I manage that, then I’ll go on collecting until
hopefully all costs have been covered through the crowdfunding campaign.
Other
ways you can help
If you aren’t able to support the
project financially at the moment, there are other ways to help. Tell other
people about this extraordinary CD, or add a link to your social media
networks, or add one here on Indiegogo. Thanks a million!

story:
The Concert without Borders/Concierto sin Fronteras unites people through the power of performing music together. We are musicians from the Arizona/Sonora Borderlands who present a concert at the border wall every spring to break down barriers of fear and mistrust that sometimes might divide us. We sing out for unity and everyone’s right to live and work and love where they please.

The Concert is a project of the Binational Arts Institute, whose mission is the strengthening of our community through binational arts education, performance, and exchange. We partner with a wide range of cultural, educational, and international entities to develop programs in collaboration with actors on both sides. Concert sponsors include the Mexican Consulate of Douglas, the Casa de Cultura in Agua Prieta, Cochise College, Galiano's Cafe, Cafe Justo, KBRP, and the Sister Cities of Douglas and Agua Prieta. This year’s performers include guitarist Dieter Hennings, Agua Prieta’s Orquesta Municipal, the Binational Chorus, the Bisbee band Essential Elements, the Orlando Suárez Blues Band, members of the Orquesta Sinfónica  of Hermosillo, a children’s chorus, and many others. This year we will perform together: instruments, singers, dancers, and children on both sides of the wall. Our repertoire will explore our theme Artists for Peace.  Our joint works include  Little Birds by Eric Whitacre; Portones Abiertos by Paul Basler; Chichester Psalms, 3rd Movement by Leonard Bernstein; Los Ninos Queremos la Paz and Color Esperanza.  We will have art projects for kids during the concert in conjunction with Galiano's Cafe.  We are excited about getting even more of you involved through this campaign.  

We need to raise $3,500.00 for this year’s Concert. The money will go for travel expenses and modest payments to string players from the Hermosillo Symphony, musicians from Agua Prieta, the sound system, and the construction of symmetrical stages on both sides of the wall.  We are confident we will reach our entire funding goal. If we do not, we will go ahead, making cuts in our budget across the board.

This is our fourth year presenting a unique and important event, free and open to the public. Many people return every year, as performers and audience, and can testify to the doors we open to friendship and trust through the Concert without Borders. We have overcome a series of technical challenges since the first year; this year we will use one sound system on both stages! Help us break down barriers! Spread the word through your social networks and use the indiegogo share tools!

This year's Concert will be Saturday, April 16 from 6 to 9 p.m. just west of the Douglas/Agua Prieta port-of-entry.

story:
Everyone, I'm working on a new cd project called No More Darkness.  It is my 3rd CD.  My first cd cost about $5000 and so did my second.  I need at least that to make this 3rd CD.  Could you please help?

Here is the list of songs I plan to record:

I've Been to the Well
For Me
Victory In Jesus
Pray for the Fish
Sons and Daughters
Long Black Train
I Saw the Light
Be My Peace
Sinner's Prayer
Here is Love
How Great Thou Art


Thank you all,

Mark Umfleet

story:
Click Here for English


Nominada al grammy latino 2014 en la categoría "mejor álbum instrumental", por su segunda producción "Esferas de Creación", la cantautora colombiana Mónica Fuquen inicia su tercer trabajo musical titulado "Volver al Amor", con la participación especial de Abdy Electriciteh y la producción de Pablo Tedeschi.

Te invitamos a participar para que este proyecto se haga realidad. Haz parte del cambio. Apoya esta producción para seguir tocando corazones.

¿Cómo vincularte al proyecto?

Hemos creado 8 categorías basadas en diferentes rangos de donación a través de los cuáles te puedes unir a esta causa. En ellos encontrarás importantes beneficios  que "Mónica Fuquen - Sonido del Alma" te brindará por tu aporte.

Estas son nuestras categorías:








¿Hasta cuando puedes vincularte?

Hemos iniciado esta campaña entre la comunidad formada alrededor de "Mónica Fuquen - Sonido del Alma" desde el 2 de noviembre de 2015 y la duración prevista para la misma será hasta el 2 de enero de 2016.

¿Cómo puedo donar?

Puedes hacerlo por los montos establecidos en los paquetes de donación a través de Tarjeta de Crédito o débito a través de esta página, siguiendo las instrucciones en el capítulo "financiamiento".

¿Cómo puedo enterarme sobre como va la campaña?

En la página web www.monicafuquen.com y en los canales de "Mónica Fuquen - Sonido del Alma" en Facebook, Twitter, Instagram y Youtube estaremos informando acerca del progreso de este camino compartido que nos llevará a hacer posible que "Volver al Amor", tercera producción de Mónica Fuquen, nazca al mundo.

English

"Return to Love" The New Album by Mónica Fuquen

2014 Latin Grammy Nominee on the “Best Instrumental Album” category for her second production  “Spheres of Creation”, the colombian autor and Singer Monica Fuquen starts her third musical production called “Return to Love”, with the special participation of Abdy Electriciteh and Pablo Tedeschi.

We invite you to join us in this Project, so this could be for real.  Be part of the change by support this production so we all can keep on touching peoples hearts.

How to support this new musical production?

We have created 8 different cathegories based on their respective donation amounts through which you can join this cause. On those perks you will find atractive benefits that "Mónica Fuquen - Sound of the Soul" will bring you for your donation.

This are our perks:








For how long this campaign will last?

We have started this campaign with "Mónica Fuquen - Sound of the Soul" community, since november 2nd 2015, and its expected duration is through January 2nd - 2016.

How can I support the project?

You can donate as indicated on the established amounts of the perks packages using your credit or debit card through this webpage, following the instructions on the finance chapter.

How can I be updated about the campaign evolving?

through Monica Fuquen's web page - www.monicafuquen.com (click on english version), as well as in her social networks channels on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and Youtube, we will be informing the communitty about the progress of this shared path with the Community in time. Path that will allow all of us to permit that "Retur to Love" the thrid musical production of "Mónica Fuquen", could be born to the world.

story:
Hey Everyone,

Thank you so much for visiting my page and taking an interest in what I am doing with my music. Your time and friendship is valued and appreciated immensely.

The 'LOVE LIKE THIS' Album has been in the pipeline for a long time now, and is finally ready to take to the world. I'm so excited that I can get my music into the homes of people and am looking forward to the release of my new album.

My strong influences of Pop, Rock & Country music over the last 20 years have been meshed together for what is something that is slightly edgy and very refreshing.

I look forward to enjoying this journey along with you, the fans.

God Bless,

Brock

story:
Short Summary

We're an Italian Rock'n'Roll-Blues band. We started playing Bruce Springsteen, Rolling Stones, The Who etc, but now we're playing original songs.
In Italy it's quite hard to get a production for your own music, so we're trying to do it by ourselves. We want our songs to be heard by as much people as possible.

What We Need & What You Get

The funds will make us able to record our songs and print at least 1000 CDs. We need this money also for the mastering of the songs and the graphics of the CDs.

The Impact

We think that one of the most important principles is that you must be free to express your opinion. Music is our way to express ourselves, our thoughts, our emotions. It's our way to comunicate. We think that everyone needs a chance to be heard. This could be our chance.

Risks & Challenges

We think that this campaign has few risks. If we get less money than we expected, we'll print less copies if it's possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please share, share, share. Tell your friends, your family, everyone!
Thank you

story:
I'm Sara Hackney, and I'm starting a journey that I want you to experience right alongside me. Music has been such a giant influence on my life, and while I just recently released my first EP, Rebelle, I'm ready to start working on my next album, Broken Doll; which is slated to have 12-15 songs. You can find Rebelle on my website (www.sarabehackney.com). 

I grew up in Greensburg, IN (a very country town), but my heart has always been turned to rock n' roll. I'm inspired by the likes of Pat Benatar, Tori Kelly, Grace Potter and the Nocturnals, and Alanis Morissette. The music I write is very pop/rock with some influences of r&b and indie on certain songs; which is what you can expect on this album as well. For me, music has always been an escape, a love and passion. I want to provide that escapism and projection of feelings for others to hear.

What this money will do, will allow you to be a part of my journey. By donating, you get a little piece of my soul back. I didn't want to sell my EP album, Rebelle, for any money so that I could just get my music out there to the fans. However, if you would like to donate to this album so I can order more copies, this is the place to do so!! I have a lot of great packages, and you will be the first to hear my new music and rock my new merch. 

What I need for the album:

$1,000 for producing, mixing, and duplicating

  • This includes burning 500 more albums  to be handed out.

$400  for mastering 5 songs

$150 for 500 digital download cards

$20 for a UPC barcode for distribution in stores

$89 to sell on Amazon, iTunes, Facebook, GooglePlay etc.

$99 for 300 11" x 17" posters

If I don't reach my goal?

I'll start at the top of the list and get as far as I can with it.  Either way, I will put all of my heart and passion into this project, but in order for it to really get out there and get heard, I need the full amount at a minimum. 

What if I go above my goal?

I will be able to put that into publicity like sponsored Facebook ads, advertising, creative marketing campaign materials and targeted marketing to support my CD Release.

The Impact

Your contribution will truly make a difference:

  • In a world of high powered record labels, there is a demand for independent music across the country.

  • Many community, public, and local radio stations are growing in numbers and strength because people like me want to hear original music with a heart.

  • I want to use this music to inspire other "little guys" to follow their dreams, open their hearts and follow their passion.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute right now, there are still lots of ways to help:

  • Spread the word about my campaign on Facebook, twitter, and email.
  • Let people know why you think I am worthy of their support
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools.
  • Share my website www.sarabehackney.com  with friends!

My goal with this campaign is to raise enough money to have more copies of the Rebelle album made. I would love to have professional mastering done on the next round of copies made. I also really want to give you guys the option of having digital downloads for your computer or phone. If I get over my goal, I would love to get this album out in stores and places like iTunes as well as have more posters made up for contest prizes and the like. 

For anyone even taking the time to read this, I want to thank you from the bottom of my heart. I look forward to raising this money so I can record and play my music for you.

XO- Sara

story:
Who We Are

We are The Battle, a northeast Ohio rock band founded by brothers Donne and Ron Copenhaver. The Battle emerged after their prior project (The Real California) dissolved in 2014. Insisting that the music continue, the brothers teamed up with guitarist Chris Shaheen, singer Cory Smith, and bassist Tom Nemo. After nearly a year of writing, the band is ready to complete and release its first album.

The songs will come in the form of a concept album. This won't be just a collection of songs or singles, but an exploration of themes that range from addiction to epiphany, telling a story of risky love, addiction, and loss. While each song is strong enough to stand on its own, the value of the album will come from the experience of listening to it from start to finish. We feel like this is an important aspect of music that has been lost over the years. We think it's the perfect way to tell a story, and we want you to hear it!

Your contribution will help us finish the recordings, but it will also help us with the behind-the-scenes stuff like the long hours of mixing, mastering, artwork and graphic design, pressing, and of course the contribution perks.

We are a local independent rock band. As such, we value supporting local businesses in helping us make our music. With funds raised, we will call on local graphic artists, sound engineers, and CD manufacturers to help us create the album. This contributes to the local economy and taps local talent. It's an investment in us, but also an investment in the local scene from musicians to designers.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's exactly what we need and why:

Studio time: $600 This is a great rate which will get us about 10-12 hours of recording time.

Mixing: $500 We will need a studio, engineer, and equipment that we don't have in order to mix the album properly. This is where each song gets its own sound and feel and, we believe, is an extension of the musical creation process.

Mastering: $1000 Mastering is what happens after everything is recorded and mixed. To make an analogy, it's the difference between watching a DVD (mixed songs) and watching a Blu-Ray (mastered songs). Everything is brighter, clearer, louder, more dimensional. This is the difference between something sounding merely good versus sounding professional. And we want professional.

Manufacturing: $500 This includes CD replication, graphic design, packaging.

Perks: $400 This money will provide us the funds to make the t-shirts, posters, and other perks. We have some unique perks and opportunities lined up for contributors, so we can't wait to get these going for you. 

The Impact

 Your impact can't be overstated. Simply put, without you the album won't be the best version of itself. We feel like we are making relevant rock music, that we are contributing to the canon in more authentic ways than big mainstream rock bands. Music is our passion, and we want to share our music with you! The biggest advantage there is about supporting this project--aside from the album itself--is that you can trust our track record. While this will be The Battle's first release, Ron and Donne have recorded and released 5 albums and 1 EP on their own, and have recorded on several other artist's and band's albums. We are well versed in this process and know exactly what it takes to do it right.  

Risks & Challenges

 With any recording project, there's a lot that can go wrong. And you can bet there will be some challenges. The biggest problem we face is anything that delays the progress of releasing an album. This could be anything from booked up studio time to manufacturing problems. The last time we  released an album under a different band, we had problems with the "master" CD being replicated that delayed the replication by several days (which was bad because we'd already planned a CD release show--and you can't have a release show without the CDs!). After many phone calls and a few trips to a Columbus studio for assistance, all was fixed and everything was fine. This is an example of what can go wrong, and how we worked a solution to the problem without delaying the release of the album.

Given that we've done this process several times, our experience and connections with great people who know what they are doing really make the difference and will ensure that even in spite of challenges, we will work quickly to adjust and reach the goal.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone will be able to contribute. If you can't, that's totally okay! If you can't contribute financially but still want to support us, you can help us by mentioning the band and this campaign to others. You can mention our website www.thebattle.us or tell them to go to the IndieGoGo site and find us there. Just because you are not contributing money doesn't mean you aren't help us out. We appreciate it all!
story_txt:
Who We Are We are The Battle, a northeast Ohio rock band founded by brothers Donne and Ron Copenhaver. The Battle emerged after their prior project (The Real California) dissolved in 2014. Insisting that the music continue, the brothers teamed up with guitarist Chris Shaheen, singer Cory Smith, and bassist Tom Nemo. After nearly a year of writing, the band is ready to complete and release its first album.
The songs will come in the form of a concept album. This won't be just a collection of songs or singles, but an exploration of themes that range from addiction to epiphany, telling a story of risky love, addiction, and loss. While each song is strong enough to stand on its own, the value of the album will come from the experience of listening to it from start to finish. We feel like this is an important aspect of music that has been lost over the years. We think it's the perfect way to tell a story, and we want you to hear it!
Your contribution will help us finish the recordings, but it will also help us with the behind-the-scenes stuff like the long hours of mixing, mastering, artwork and graphic design, pressing, and of course the contribution perks.We are a local independent rock band. As such, we value supporting local businesses in helping us make our music. With funds raised, we will call on local graphic artists, sound engineers, and CD manufacturers to help us create the album. This contributes to the local economy and taps local talent. It's an investment in us, but also an investment in the local scene from musicians to designers.    What We Need & What You Get Here's exactly what we need and why:
Studio time: $600 This is a great rate which will get us about 10-12 hours of recording time.
Mixing: $500 We will need a studio, engineer, and equipment that we don't have in order to mix the album properly. This is where each song gets its own sound and feel and, we believe, is an extension of the musical creation process.
Mastering: $1000 Mastering is what happens after everything is recorded and mixed. To make an analogy, it's the difference between watching a DVD (mixed songs) and watching a Blu-Ray (mastered songs). Everything is brighter, clearer, louder, more dimensional. This is the difference between something sounding merely good versus sounding professional. And we want professional. 
Manufacturing: $500 This includes CD replication, graphic design, packaging.
Perks: $400 This money will provide us the funds to make the t-shirts, posters, and other perks. We have some unique perks and opportunities lined up for contributors, so we can't wait to get these going for you. 

The Impact

 Your impact can't be overstated. Simply put, without you the album won't be the best version of itself. We feel like we are making relevant rock music, that we are contributing to the canon in more authentic ways than big mainstream rock bands. Music is our passion, and we want to share our music with you! The biggest advantage there is about supporting this project--aside from the album itself--is that you can trust our track record. While this will be The Battle's first release, Ron and Donne have recorded and released 5 albums and 1 EP on their own, and have recorded on several other artist's and band's albums. We are well versed in this process and know exactly what it takes to do it right.     Risks & Challenges  With any recording project, there's a lot that can go wrong. And you can bet there will be some challenges. The biggest problem we face is anything that delays the progress of releasing an album. This could be anything from booked up studio time to manufacturing problems. The last time we  released an album under a different band, we had problems with the "master" CD being replicated that delayed the replication by several days (which was bad because we'd already planned a CD release show--and you can't have a release show without the CDs!). After many phone calls and a few trips to a Columbus studio for assistance, all was fixed and everything was fine. This is an example of what can go wrong, and how we worked a solution to the problem without delaying the release of the album.
Given that we've done this process several times, our experience and connections with great people who know what they are doing really make the difference and will ensure that even in spite of challenges, we will work quickly to adjust and reach the goal.
  Other Ways You Can Help We know that not everyone will be able to contribute. If you can't, that's totally okay! If you can't contribute financially but still want to support us, you can help us by mentioning the band and this campaign to others. You can mention our website www.thebattle.us or tell them to go to the IndieGoGo site and find us there. Just because you are not contributing money doesn't mean you aren't help us out. We appreciate it all!

story:
Hello !!

Nous sollicitons votre participation pour le financement de notre prochain vidéo clip "Rise" ainsi que de sa promotion.

Le prochain vidéo clip annoncera la sortie de l'album qui est prévu pour Mars 2016.


We are asking for your help for the financing of our next video clip as well as its promotion!

The next video clip "Rise" will announce the release of the album due early March 2016.

---

Budget :

Shooting 1 500 $ (50,00 % du budget)

Post-prod  1 000 $ (33,33 %)

Location Matériel 500 $ (16,67 %)

---

Total : 3 000 $

Si l'objectif est atteint le surplus récolté servira pour assurer la promotion de l'album. Merci pour votre aide!


If the goal is reached will the harvested surplus for the promotin of the album. thanks for your help!

story:
The main project

This album is inspired by true events regarding various acts of heroism throughout history. Each song is a chapter of a different moment or a story that we believe is worthy of being glorified and told. In this case the album represents our interpretations of all these different events.

At the moment we have finished recording all of the songs at MM Production Studio in Kumanovo, Macedonia. At the same time we have been working on the artwork for the album. We also started a collaboration with French filmmaker Felix Brassier with whom we are shooting a music video and composing a featured upcoming documentary soundtrack. 


As a young band we are trying to grow and at the same time trying to share our music with a wider audience. Give them a glimpse of our evolving universe and mutual emotions that shaped this music project. Unfortunately our budget only scraped the surface of our idea, so in order to reach our goal, we will need some additional funding.



Why we need funding?

The fundings we are looking for will be used for the following expenses

1. Mastering the album which will cost 615$.

2. Printing hard copies (CD's) which will cost 450$.

3. Merchandise (T-shirts, posters, stickers) in the amount of 280$.

We would be grateful to all music lovers who are willing to help us achieve our goals,

to cross this very important stepping stone in our musical development.

story:
My name is Andrew Longaker and I am seeking support to facilitate a 4 month project in which I will be traveling south through Latin America on a musical journey. My travels will begin in July in Puerto Escondido, Mexico and will culminate on the island of Florianapolis in Brazil. My work will include the recording of a solo guitar album, and the production of surf films featuring music from my previous releases. I am looking for $7,000 in funding. This will cover travel, food and lodging, filming and recording equipment. 

This project will explore how jazz music can bring us into deeper contact with other cultures, ourselves and the planet. Some sub- themes I will connect in my art are: the healing and destructive power of water and the connection between music and the flow of water. I will post content (recordings and videos) regularly to youtube, and additionally to instagram so that supporters and viewers may follow the journey as it unfolds.

My experience and development as a musician has been informed not only by personal study, but also by my adventures in distant lands surfing. The upcoming project will help people relate my music to the distant shores which have inspired it. It will also bring the high art of jazz music to people and places which may not be exposed to it otherwise. The music I will create will reflect the magic and character of these distant places. The filmed scenes will provide the audience with footage of day-to- day life, people, discoveries and surfing. I will be featured surfing in these films. 

The work on this project will be done as I travel. I will be able to cover most of the production on my computer. This will include video editing and audio recording. I will post musical content to youtube every 2- 3 weeks and content on instagram. By the end of the trip, I will have the new album recorded and filming complete. The tentative itinerary will be as follows; Los Angeles to Puerto Escondido, Mexico. From Mexico I will travel to Montanita, Ecuador and Nicaragua. From there I will go to Brazil.

story:
Exciting News!

We are thrilled to announce special guest artists Al Di Meola and Stanley Clarke will be featured on the new album Casbah! We are so excited to be featuring such legendary, talented musicians on this project, and we have secured dates in the studio in December and January! Stay posted for more news, and announcements.

 

Who we are...

Hello!  We are Room of Voices, a dynamic duo,  Mingo Lewis and Karissa "Sound Sapien."  The universe brought us together about 6 years ago when Mingo was crafting a new kind of music, and Karissa was traveling, and ended on Mingo's porch through a mutual friend and overheard some sounds coming from within. And long story short, that was the beginning of the magic of Room of Voices. The two of us starting working together at a recording studio in Northern California, and began crafting our sound together. We travelled, toured and moved across the country, and now are working on our newest album "Casbah." A combination of shockingly electric funk, with worldly ethnic sounds.
 
Mingo's incredible experience performing with artists such as Santana, Chick Corea, The Tubes, Todd Rundgren and many others, along with Karissa's imaginative ideas inspired by the music of the 80's, 90's hip-hip and electronic, has created a new direction and a very powerful sound that is unique to Room of Voices. 
 
We have done several albums already, and this new album, "Casbah," will be our fourth album. Our intention with this album is to record the music in a way that really takes our listeners on a journey, just like the way it is at a live show. We have had countless fans tell us that our music is so amazing and powerful when experienced in person, and our last several albums didn't have that effect because we used programed drums rather than acoustic drums.  So this will be our very first album capturing our whole live sound with live drums, and on vinyl! 
 
We love the quality of vinyl, and we will also be releasing digital downloads of the album.  And to give you the visual experience that you enjoy at our shows, we are going to produce two live music videos, which will feature the expressive performance of Karissa's new instrument, the Theremin, along with video imagery projection and the power of Mingo's live drums. 
 
We invite you to join us on this journey, to produce Room of Voices most influential album yet.... "Casbah!"
 

 

What We Need & What You Get

    We are so proud to be an independent band, with our own unique underground sound, however there are challenges that come along with being independent. The biggest challenge being the initial investment needed to create high quality music and video productions, along with the resources needed to promote and spread the word about our project. And this is where we need your help.

    As much as we love recording in our basement :) And still many of our ideas will always be formed there, having your help to really do this the right way, and record in a professional studio with state of the art equipment, engineers, and mastering will really help us to bring our music to the next level. We really hope you will engage with us and become part of the creation of our next album by contributing and helping us spread the word. And in return we have some pretty amazing rewards for you. 

    We've got Room of Voices HOODIES! Oh yess.. who doesn't need another good hoddie as we head into the fall/winter. :)

    And of course we will have Casbah on Vinyl, for all of you music collectors out there, we know you know that Vinyl just sounds better than digital, and this will be the first ever Room of Voices album with live drums! And we've also got digital copies of Casbah available to everyone to download and add to your playlist. 

    We've even got some super special one of a kind drum sticks.. bucky beavers, I call them, once Mingo uses a pair of sticks for more than a few songs... it almost looks like some kind of construction zone around his drum set, with wood chips all around, so get a piece of the action with a pair of Mingo's sticks used to record the album.

     

    The Impact

      Through this project we will get to experience recording our music in a professional studio environment which will enable us to capture the full and true Room of Voices sound, the way that you hear it at our live shows! Having the support we need will allow us to be the most creative we can, to execute our art in best and most quality way.
       
      And you get the satisfaction of knowing that you were a part of the creation of our art, as well as getting exclusive access to our music release before everyone else does.  You hold a special place in our hearts, because we truly couldn't do this without the support and love of our fans, like you.  So thank you!  We will continue extending our gratitude to you for getting involved, you will get access to sneak peak videos and previews of us in the studio, and production facility (access that only you will get by being part of our Indiegogo).
       
      The impact that this album will have on our music career is unprecedented. So many fans have asked us to record with live drums, and this is why we are approaching our next stage in our career to give our fans what they want, and to give you what you want to hear! Which is the live, real experience of our music, what you get when you are at a concert, now you will be able to take with you wherever you go. 
       

      Risks & Challenges

      The challenges we face with this project, is really getting it out there to a larger audience.   And in the past, this is where we went wrong, we just didn't have a solid plan to advertise. But now that we have realized the impact that advertising and promotion really has, we know what it takes to make our album a success.  
       
      We have put together a plan of action which includes a fantastic promotion strategy to leverage our music and grow our audience.  We have already invested in the education to learn about the tools and strategies needed to best promote and leverage our music, both on the internet and through other means.
       
      The risks we face with our project is not raising the funds needed, which will effect the level of quality that we can produce our music at, and the level of success that we can achieve with the final product. However, this is not our first crowd-funder and we have been successful before, and we know the work that is takes, and with your help we can achieve even more than we may know. 
       
      Our last fundraiser we ended up being able to donate extra proceeds to the Water Project, to help people who live with a shortage of water, and we plan to do the same thing with this fundraiser if we raise funding beyond our goal, every dollar will go to help those less fortunate. And the cool thing about the Water Project, which is our charity of choice, is that they will send video and photo updates of where the money has gone, and which communities and lives the donations have impacted (which we will send to you)! How cool to be able to serve a bigger purpose here. 
       
      Other Ways You Can Help
       

      We hope that you will contribute to the project, and we know that not everybody can contribute financially, but that doesn't mean that you can't contribute. There are many of ways of helping support the project. To list a few:

      • Share our crowdfunder on your social media! FB, Twitter, Instagram
      • Send out an email to friends who might be interested.
      • Volunteer to help us with the work involved in producing the album.
      • Volunteer to be part of our street team to promote the album upon release!
      • Volunteer ideas! We are always open to hear your thoughts. 

      We are so grateful for you! Without YOU, our music would simply be some vibrations passing through the air, it is YOU, our fans that make our music magic by appreciating and feeling that joy that we find in the music. We love you very much, and can't wait to get started, so we can start sharing the creative process and results with you!

      Check out our amazing perks, and stay in touch with us and share your ideas and thoughts. 

      THANKS SO MUCH FOR CHECKING OUT OUR INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN! :)

story:
Short Summary

We are a rock trio out of Wisconsin. Yep. Wisconsin. We all have "real" jobs, but what we'd really love is to make it big; or at LEAST get our music out there on a REAL LIVE ALBUM! We have been established since 2010. We have played at dive bars, grad parties, someones backyard, someones basement, motorcycle clubs, summer festivals, and even opened for The Offspring.  Check us out on our webpage, www.TheUntamedBand.com . We put ourselves out there so you can hear us -- So you can feel the music. This campaign is SO IMPORTANT to us. We have been promising music to you forever. We find ways of getting it to you but the quality of the recording is lacking to really sound like us. Every time we save close to enough money, we end up spending it on equipment repairs, and truck and/or trailer breakdowns (both recently!). Not only can you help us over this hurdle, but you're also helping us reach our dreams and even getting cool stuff for helping us out! 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal for our campaign is $4,500.  This money will go toward expenditures associated with recording a full studio album.  This money will help us afford studio time, mixing and mastering. We have many perks you can find on this page! If we are not able to reach our goal, we will STILL DO AN ALBUM however, there is a drawback. We are planning on recording as soon as we can, but if we don't reach our goal we will have to wait longer to record our album, so we can save more money up.

The Impact

You donating or sharing our campaign is SO SO SO valuable to us. We thank you a million times! The music isn't just about writing songs and making money. Each song has a bit of our hearts in it. We put ourselves out there --- to relate to you! Our songs are all different. Kurt has written some. Melissa has written some. We've written some collectively and we are starting to write more that way. This music is a piece of us. We are unlike anyone else. If we can touch 1 person in the world and make them feel like they are not alone in this, it was all worth it.

We have always found a way to get our music to you whether it was a crappy phone video, a show, a recording in someones basement, or we invited you to a practice. We WANT you to hear us. We have done our best at the time and now we want to step up our game and give you something you can listen to when you work, when you run, at your leisure, in the car, or WHEREVER YOU WANT! 

We want to give you the REAL DEAL! 

Risks & Challenges

As a band we face many challenges heading in to our campaign to create an album. Some of the problems we have to be aware of.... What if people don't donate? What if they may not be interested? What if we have more equipment failure or breakdowns? What if we are not prioritizing our time correctly? What if we don't create material that will make heads perk up? A person in a band can go crazy with worry if they let it get to them. No show is guaranteed even if we have a contract, pay isn't even guaranteed when you're in a band. There are shows where the payment is considered "Good Exposure" to a crowd of people, but as we all know, that doesn't quite pay for gas or even electric on our practice space.  

There are a lot of unknown factors as we charge into this campaign, but as a band we have a combined total of over 20 years of experience with in the industry. This includes being self-taught, taking music lessons, being in a school band or choir, and/or joining a band. With our following, our friends, and our family, we believe we have the resources to overcome these hurdles. As it's always been, we've worked TOGETHER as a band to overcome any situations thrown at us and had help from great friends and family as well. We are experienced and we do our best to achieve every goal we set. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people can't contribute.... But that doesn't mean you can't help!!! Remember to share our indiegogo campaign with your friends and family.  Your support will help us succeed in accomplishing our dreams.
story_txt:
Short Summary We are a rock trio out of Wisconsin. Yep. Wisconsin. We all have "real" jobs, but what we'd really love is to make it big; or at LEAST get our music out there on a REAL LIVE ALBUM! We have been established since 2010. We have played at dive bars, grad parties, someones backyard, someones basement, motorcycle clubs, summer festivals, and even opened for The Offspring.  Check us out on our webpage, www.TheUntamedBand.com . We put ourselves out there so you can hear us -- So you can feel the music. This campaign is SO IMPORTANT to us. We have been promising music to you forever. We find ways of getting it to you but the quality of the recording is lacking to really sound like us. Every time we save close to enough money, we end up spending it on equipment repairs, and truck and/or trailer breakdowns (both recently!). Not only can you help us over this hurdle, but you're also helping us reach our dreams and even getting cool stuff for helping us out!    What We Need & What You Get 
Our goal for our campaign is $4,500.  This money will go toward expenditures associated with recording a full studio album.  This money will help us afford studio time, mixing and mastering. We have many perks you can find on this page! If we are not able to reach our goal, we will STILL DO AN ALBUM however, there is a drawback. We are planning on recording as soon as we can, but if we don't reach our goal we will have to wait longer to record our album, so we can save more money up.
    The Impact You donating or sharing our campaign is SO SO SO valuable to us. We thank you a million times! The music isn't just about writing songs and making money. Each song has a bit of our hearts in it. We put ourselves out there --- to relate to you! Our songs are all different. Kurt has written some. Melissa has written some. We've written some collectively and we are starting to write more that way. This music is a piece of us. We are unlike anyone else. If we can touch 1 person in the world and make them feel like they are not alone in this, it was all worth it.
We have always found a way to get our music to you whether it was a crappy phone video, a show, a recording in someones basement, or we invited you to a practice. We WANT you to hear us. We have done our best at the time and now we want to step up our game and give you something you can listen to when you work, when you run, at your leisure, in the car, or WHEREVER YOU WANT! 
We want to give you the REAL DEAL!    Risks & Challenges  
As a band we face many challenges heading in to our campaign to create an album. Some of the problems we have to be aware of.... What if people don't donate? What if they may not be interested? What if we have more equipment failure or breakdowns? What if we are not prioritizing our time correctly? What if we don't create material that will make heads perk up? A person in a band can go crazy with worry if they let it get to them. No show is guaranteed even if we have a contract, pay isn't even guaranteed when you're in a band. There are shows where the payment is considered "Good Exposure" to a crowd of people, but as we all know, that doesn't quite pay for gas or even electric on our practice space.  
There are a lot of unknown factors as we charge into this campaign, but as a band we have a combined total of over 20 years of experience with in the industry. This includes being self-taught, taking music lessons, being in a school band or choir, and/or joining a band. With our following, our friends, and our family, we believe we have the resources to overcome these hurdles. As it's always been, we've worked TOGETHER as a band to overcome any situations thrown at us and had help from great friends and family as well. We are experienced and we do our best to achieve every goal we set.    Other Ways You Can Help Some people can't contribute.... But that doesn't mean you can't help!!! Remember to share our indiegogo campaign with your friends and family.  Your support will help us succeed in accomplishing our dreams.

story:
HELLO WORLD!  My name is Ginny Wilder, a singer/songwriter/priest in the Episcopal Church living and serving in Wilmington, Delaware.

Thank you for taking the time to check out my page.  This dream is only possible through partners like you.  These songs were written with you in mind and with a dream of collaborating with you as midwives in this beautiful and strange process of recording a new CD.  

I was a singer/songwriter long before I was a priest and I was wonderfully and marvelously made member of the LGBTQQ community long before I was a singer/songwriter.  But, in reflecting on my life journey up to this point, God was present all throughout this beautiful and strange trek.

Why am I doing this project??  Good question.  I have been writing music since the age of 12, and as I have grown and stretched out in my skin, my songs have also grown and stretched out and this latest batch is shining the light into my current life- and they reflect the beautiful messiness of doubt and belief, wonder and joy, hope and concern that comes with following God's call upon our lives.  

This CD is a culmination of finally feeling comfortable in my own skin and singing from a place that holds the tension of being both beloved and wary- it can be scary, mystifying, beautiful, but always worth the struggle.

Fran McKendree will be sitting in the producer's seat at Teerivane Studios as we weave together these songs into a beautiful tapestry that we can wrap ourselves in and listen as each story unfolds.  Fran and I have worked together on several projects over the course of the past 15 years and it was his guidance and encouragement that made my 3rd CD, "Lessons in Life and Love" such a life changing experience for me and for many people who have sung along with me in their cars, gyms, trails, and commutes.

I pray that for those who sponsor this project and those that benefit from your support are able to hear God in these songs and remember that there is nothing, nothing, absolutely nothing, we can do that will ever make God stop loving us.

There just aren't that many LGBTQQ Christian Singer/Songwriters in the world and our voice is a voice for all those who are on a spiritual journey with doubt and questions as traveling companions.  This album of songs will help shine light in the darkness, rekindle hope in the hopeless and offer peace to those who may have been at war with the world, with themselves or even with God.  Love, Death, Life, Birth, Rebirth, Forgiveness, Freedom, Grace- this album covers all of that and there is someone, right now, in your life who could really, really benefit from hearing a song or two on this CD.  Maybe that person is you.  

Many people have faced and continue to face so much hurt and shame at the hands of people who call themselves Christians.  For their own safety and security, they leave behind communities of faith for their own preservation.  Many wander in that wilderness believing what they have been told- that they are an abomination, they are unloved and unwanted, they are shameful creatures and they are unworthy of love.  Oh my friends, my sweet, sweet, friends.  I want desperately to sing to them about the God that loves each of us, completely, wholly, just as we are and without any hesitation.  Your support, your encouragement, your sharing in this with me will help make that possible.  


Just the facts, ma'am.

$12,000.00 bucks will get us:
Pre-production: This is an important preliminary step standard in any commercial recording project. Fran McKendree and I are already listening to the demos and talking about arrangements,  structure, and dreaming about ideas that will add layers, textures and colors to the songs.  This part is basically putting the bones together that we will build on in the studio. 

Musicians & Recording: Next, Fran and I will hire local musicians to play a multitude of different instruments to help breathe life int these songs: drums and percussion, electric and acoustic bass and guitar, piano and strings (your donation will not only be helping me, but will support lots of working musicians!)  
Mixing & Mastering: Each track will be mixed to make the composition come to life, with lots of contrast in volume, color and texture. As a final step, the album will be mastered from beginning to end, so the listening experience is cohesive and carefully choreographed from start to finish.
Production/Pressing- The CDs don't make themselves so your kind and generous donation will make sure the the CDs are pressed and come in a really beautiful package.  Album liner notes are not antiquated, they have been raised to a new level of appreciation.  Your donation will help me tell more of the story behind this CD through the CD jacket and artwork.
Travel: I live in Delaware.  Fran lives in North Carolina.  It is a great deal easier for me to go to Fran and his studio than it is to bring Fran and his studio to Delaware.  

I wish I could give you the world, but alas, that is not mine to give.  I do have some ideas, though, to help show you some love for the love you have shown this project.  There is a whole list of donating options and gifts to the right of this box but just to highlight a few: Download of the new album, Signed copy of the new Album, Hand written lyrics to the song of your choice complete with a thank you note, Release Party Meet and Greet, Dinner and a show at our house in Wilmington, Delaware,  I will marry you (and your beloved) here in Delaware, Your own private concert at your house or church,  thank yous and shout outs and some other fun stuff.

Risks & Challenges

The first risk is that I will receive a whole mess of hate mail from people who cannot make it add up in their hearts that I do, indeed, believe that even as a gay person, that God loves me.  

Another risk is that believing in God has become grounds to be dismissed as weak or ignorant or be seen as a lemming.  I will go ahead and say that as a person who has fought tooth and nail to be an openly gay married priest, I am not weak, ignorant or a lemming.  I am brave, strong, wise and a pretty damn good leader.

Challenges- I have a very short window to get the recording done.  It will be a challenge but Fran and I believe that even though it will be challenging, it will add to the stories we will tell each other for years to come.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word, share this page, pray for me, love your neighbor as yourself, offer kindness when you can and be good to yourself.
Thanks for hanging in this with me.  Your presence is a gift.  Peace and love, Ginny.

story:
I am happy to announce that my new album Open Kimono has been completed.

It's my first full length solo record and it showcases about ten years of music made with an amazing list of very talented musicians, engineers and mixers. It took over 1,000 hours of studio time to bring it to life and now I am really excited to share it with you.

Here's a sneak peek video with audio from all of the tracks on the album!

I hope you enjoy it!

Pierre


Autopsy of a Dead Duck

This song was started in April 2009 when I was doing an artist residency at Ucross in Wyoming. I was living in the midst of the most breathtaking scenery in the American west and spending every day in a beautiful studio with a grand piano. This was my first attempt to write a song entirely on piano. The lyrics are an exploration of depression and redemption, with some Chinese food puns thrown in, and a little Beatles homage. I finished the song in my studio in Dumbo, adding drums, guitars, backwards drums, keyboards, and a trumpet solo that I’m very proud of, which repeats itself in reverse.

Eat What You Kill

This was written in about 2006 while I was composing music for the film Dr. Bronner’s Magic Soapbox. It started as a little folk guitar riff inspired by an open E minor tuning but never made the film. It was after my band Sea Foxx broke up and before my band The Snow was created, but it never made it to the Snow’s repertoire, though Hilary Downes did sing on it. It’s part of a long list of songs imploring people to be better citizens of the earth.

Lepidoptera

This song goes way back to about 2005. The intro crooning is from a talented gentleman I recorded on the subway who was wooing all the ladies on the platform, and which dovetails nicely with the content and tone. The drum fills were analog drums recorded on a first generation iPod with an amazing compression/limiting effect happening by accident. The wobbly guitars were made with an ebow and blasted through a little Rickenbacker amp with fantastic built-in vibrato and distortion. Same with the synths. Vocals were recorded in one sleepy take through a little radio mic I found in the garage of a deceased man in San Diego that I was hired to clean out. The subject matter is one very weird and wonderful night in the East Village in another life.

NRA-hole

I believe in standing up for what I believe and speaking out, or in this case, singing out. I had fun making this song with two overlapping drum beats and various percussion instruments, as well as layers of divergent guitars and horns. And it’s fun to sing really angry, passionate lyrics in really hushed, close harmonies.

Stay Calm

Life in New York City can really stress you out. This is my mantra to attempt to chill out when the day to day becomes too much. It started as three syncopated bass lines weaved together over drums. I then added some very improvisational, accidental synths, organ and piano that became the main riffs, then I added the guitars, and then the lyrics came like a package delivered to the wrong address, fully formed. I wanted the groove to channel Steely Dan’s Showbiz Kids. Gerald Menke came with his genius pedal steel for the finishing touch.

Two By Two

Written for my twins when they were two years old. Going for a really open, happy, California vibe. Started with some chords and a piano riff and grew from there.

Follow the Drone

Built around a two-chord progression on the Rhodes, then layered with piles of sludge guitars. The end is a vacuum cleaner, a fan, and some helicopter sounds. Devin Greenwood really dialed it in with some added sounds. The drone is an impersonal observer floating above the earth, watching all the beautiful and awful things we humans do to each other, and occasionally dropping bombs. This could be considered a companion song to The Snow’s Silent Parade.

Top of the Food Chain

Inspired by a book I read that explores all of humanity’s foibles through the lens of simple natural selection. We are the strongest therefore we dominate and destroy. But our large brain might also be the solution. This was recorded many years ago and features Dorit Chrysler on theremin, Hilary Downes on vocals, Frank Heer on chromatic harmonica, and Quentin Jennings on harpsichord.

story:
So why the 'Mr E'?


"Man is least himself when he talks in his own person. Give him a mask, and he will tell you the truth." - Oscar Wilde


I have worked for many years as a professional lyricist, singer and writer of cultural commentary. Regular followers of my work will be aware that I am also a survivor of abuse.

Even though I refrained from speaking openly about this issue, it always found its way into my life and my work. I told myself to get over it, stop whinging and move on. That never happened, so I became the life and soul of the party and made some terrible life choices. I found myself reliving toxic habits with other broken souls and, funnily enough, this all turned out to be a rather bad idea. Everything changed five years ago when I became the victim of particularly horrific assault.

This is not a 'poor me' pity party. This is a project of authentic acquiescence. 

I did what any other aging, sober, Rock'n'Roll drama queen would do with a ridiculous midlife crisis and a head full of lyrics. I bought an electric ukulele, put on a cheap, theatrical mask and became anonymous - a mystery. I began turning up at open mic events around the world and singing the songs I had written about abusive relationships.

And you know what?

People got it.

Who knew?


On my travels, I have been overwhelmed by the number of people who have approached me asking to buy my songs. If I'm being completely honest, this began as a cathartic process that I needed to do; however, it has evolved and has gradually become a bit of a thing.


Now I am invited to perform my songs in art galleries, dive-bars and cabarets across Europe and Asia. The act works best in intimate environments where people can really engage with the subject matter. I am busy working with various musicians, producers and performance artists to produce a promo clip and an album of my music.


There are many complex issues for male survivors of abuse. I am fortunate to have a strong support network of friends, other people aren't so lucky. It is my hope that sharing an authentic narrative that acknowledges all the negativity, while encouraging a positive outlook with just a touch of dark humour, can help to challenge many of the preconceived perceptions of abuse.

To Do This I Need...

  • To film a promo video clip for the demo track, "Better Off Dead."
  • To record session musicians.
  • To Pay for producers.
  • To Pay for professional mastering.
On 28/04/2016, I will be filming a promo for the demo track, "Better Off Dead," (Listen Here). It has always been my philosophy to pay everyone involved in my projects. I have spent many years doing things for 'the experience' and this is always shit. I would rather cut back on props and costumes in order to make sure that everyone gets something for their time. We work with what we have. So the promo will cost:
  • Director/Cameraman/editor - 500 GBP
  • Makeup artist - 150 GBP
  • Venues for shoot, The Rag Factory, London - 100 GBP
  • 3 x Drag performers -450 GBP
  • Props and costumes - 50 GBP

Total for the promo clip: 1250 GBP.


I have already recorded vocal tracks and basic arrangements for a further 12 songs. The sound I am looking for on the album is obviously much richer than my solo performances; however, I am still looking to maintain the gritty, unpolished aesthetic.

Think Lou Reed on Crystal Meth meets John Grant on speed.

At times it has the feel of 70's glam 'dad' rock (if your dad happened to be a trashy old queen), other times it can be quite synth driven, but who knows what might happen! Several studios and producers in Bristol, London and Berlin are interested in working on the recordings, mixing and mastering. The prices quoted to me range from 200 GBP a day to 700 GBP a day, depending on the studio, the producer or the musicians involved.

I am very keen to keep costs to a minimum and complete as much of the project as possible within a week.

I am aiming to produce 10 tracks in total in the UK. I can work quite fast. The target is an average of 3 tracks a day, with the mastering, I am looking at 5 days in the studio at an average of 500 GBP.

Total for 10 tracks: 2500 GBP.

In total, this whole project will cost me just 3750 GBP.


Is this just another vanity project?


Not at all. It is true that there is a huge amount of creative content being made by professional performers and artists all around the world. However, the subject matter I deal with is often considered inappropriate by the mainstream creative industries. For example, the book I have written, "A Year in Shorts," was banned in SE Asia where it was originally published. This is still such a difficult subject and even well educated people, such as Stephen Fry (Fry on The Ruben Report), have a tendency to emasculate male survivors of sexual abuse and rape.


I have extensive experience writing and singing my songs and the feedback I get is very positive. I feel the mask puts me in a position to talk openly about certain aspects of male sexuality and abuse in an engaging and entertaining way.

By doing this, I am making myself incredibly vulnerable. I have already weathered the obligatory onslaught of social media abuse, but I truly believe in what I am doing. I have been developing a strong body of work that is darkly comedic and does not profess to be artificially or academically objective; indeed, it is composed purely of subjective impressions. It has an authenticity that definitely resonates with some people. I do not pretend to speak for everyone, these are my experiences and I hope that this project has value and encourages debate.

I now have a simple website and platform on which to sell my music including itunes. Any profit that I make from this project will be invested in future creative endeavours. That's what I do. I am in the process of writing another book, as well as more songs. I'm even sketching a piece of musical theatre. Who knows where it will all end? I have already achieved so much more than I ever thought possible.

I thank everyone who has supported this project and offered creative input, constructive feedback and advice.

I thank everyone in the indiegogo community for making me feel that I can submit this proposal for your consideration.

I welcome all feedback and I am looking to put my work out to a much wider audience.

Even though I refrained from speaking openly about this issue, it always found its way into my life and my work. I told myself to get over it, stop whinging and move on. That never happened, so I became the life and soul of the party and made some terrible life choices. I found myself reliving toxic habits with other broken souls and, funnily enough, this all turned out to be a rather bad idea. Everything changed five years ago when I became the victim of particularly horrific assault. This is not a 'poor me' pity party. This is a project of authentic acquiescence.  
I did what any other aging, sober, Rock'n'Roll drama queen would do with a ridiculous midlife crisis and a head full of lyrics. I bought an electric ukulele, put on a cheap, theatrical mask and became anonymous - a mystery. I began turning up at open mic events around the world and singing the songs I had written about abusive relationships. And you know what? People got it. Who knew? 
On my travels, I have been overwhelmed by the number of people who have approached me asking to buy my songs. If I'm being completely honest, this began as a cathartic process that I needed to do; however, it has evolved and has gradually become a bit of a thing. 
Now I am invited to perform my songs in art galleries, dive-bars and cabarets across Europe and Asia. The act works best in intimate environments where people can really engage with the subject matter. I am busy working with various musicians, producers and
 performance artists to produce a promo clip and an album of my music. 
There are many complex issues for male survivors of abuse. I am fortunate to have a strong support network of friends, other people aren't so lucky. It is my hope that sharing an authentic narrative that acknowledges all the negativity, while encouraging a positive outlook with just a touch of dark humour, can help to challenge many of the preconceived perceptions of abuse. 
  To Do This I Need...


To film a promo video clip for the demo track, "Better Off Dead."
To record session musicians.
To Pay for producers.
To Pay for professional mastering. 
On 28/04/2016, I will be filming a promo for the demo track, "Better Off Dead," (Listen Here). It has always been my philosophy to pay everyone involved in my projects. I have spent many years doing things for 'the experience' and this is always shit. I would rather cut back on props and costumes in order to make sure that everyone gets something for their time. We work with what we have. So the promo will cost: 

Director/Cameraman/editor - 500 GBP
Makeup artist - 150 GBP
Venues for shoot, The Rag Factory, London - 100 GBP
3 x Drag performers -450 GBP
Props and costumes - 50 GBP

Total for the promo clip: 1250 GBP.




I have already recorded vocal tracks and basic arrangements for a further 12 songs. The sound I am looking for on the album is obviously much richer than my solo performances; however, I am still looking to maintain the gritty, unpolished aesthetic. 
Think Lou Reed on Crystal Meth meets John Grant on speed. 
At times it has the feel of 70's glam 'dad' rock (if your dad happened to be a trashy old queen), other times it can be quite synth driven, but who knows what might happen! Several studios and producers in Bristol, London and Berlin are interested in working on the recordings, mixing and mastering. The prices quoted to me range from 200 GBP a day to 700 GBP a day, depending on the studio, the producer or the musicians involved. 
I am very keen to keep costs to a minimum and complete as much of the project as possible within a week. 
I am aiming to produce 10 tracks in total in the UK. I can work quite fast. The target is an average of 3 tracks a day, with
 the mastering, I am looking at 5 days in the studio at an average of 500 GBP.
Total for 10 tracks: 2500 GBP.
In total, this whole project will cost me just 3750 GBP.


Is this just another vanity project?

Not at all. It is true that there is a huge amount of creative content being made by professional performers and artists all around the world. However, the subject matter I deal with is often considered inappropriate by the mainstream creative industries. For example, the book I have written, "A Year in Shorts," was banned in SE Asia where it was originally published. This is still such a difficult subject and even well educated people, such as Stephen Fry (Fry on The Ruben Report), have a tendency to emasculate male survivors of sexual abuse and rape. 


I have extensive experience writing and singing my songs and the feedback I get is very positive. I feel the mask puts me in a position to talk openly about certain aspects of male sexuality and abuse in an engaging and entertaining way. 


By doing this, I am making myself incredibly vulnerable. I have already weathered the obligatory onslaught of social media abuse, but I truly believe in what I am doing. I have been developing a strong body of work that is darkly comedic and does not profess to be artificially or academically objective; indeed, it is composed purely of subjective impressions. It has an authenticity that definitely resonates with some people. I do not pretend to speak for everyone, these are my experiences and I hope that this project has value and encourages debate.I now have a simple website and platform on which to sell my music including itunes. Any profit that I make from this project will be invested in future creative endeavours. That's what I do. I am in the process of writing another book, as well as more songs. I'm even sketching a piece of musical theatre. Who knows where it will all end? I have already achieved so much more than I ever thought possible. I thank everyone who has supported this project and offered creative input, constructive feedback and advice.I thank everyone in the indiegogo community for making me feel that I can submit this proposal for your consideration. I welcome all feedback and I am looking to put my work out to a much wider audience.

story:
Hello! My name is Preston Baker I am live in Warren Michigan. I Have been in love with music ever since I was born. I started off as a singer but eventually when I got a little older I started getting more into Hip Hop. For the past few years I have been following the group Team Backpack which is a platform for aspiring artist to get exposure some of the greatest up and coming artist have featured on these cyphers such as Hopsin, Dizzy Wright and the rest of the label Funk Volume, and even one of the artist from the group SlaughterHouse signed by Shady Records Joell Ortiz has featured on a cypher. I’m an artist on the rise looking for any exposure and I believe Team Backpack is an amazing community that could help get the spotlight on me me as a young musican. Back in 2014 I recored a live audition and was too late. 2015 hits I audition again, but never got the e-mail, on April 21st, 2016 at 11:20pm after 3 years finally got the e-mail from team backpack stating that I had gotten a Offical Invitation to Live Auditions at Misson Underground New York. It cost $150 to secure a spot into these auditons and to be provided Brooklyns finest food for the Weekend. 7% of all the money they make will be donated togenerosity.orgto aid in ending the world water crisis and to build 5 water wells in different villages around the world. I am trying to raise this money to

1.  Secure my spot into this cypher.

2.  A flight there and back.

3.  And a place to stay for the weekend.

This is just a round two audition, Im not guarenteed a record deal and a million dollars but it would get me one step closer and give me an amazing expierience.

Any sort of donation is super appricitated more than any of you could know, I understand not everyone can donate but even if you just spread the word that I need the help is more than enough. Thank You.

                                                                                                                          

                                                                                                                           -Preston Baker

story:
LoCoFest  is taking place August 12, 2016. We have two stages filled with 25+ bands and no more room for the other 30+ bands who have asked us to be part of the festival. This is your chance to contribute to the festival and give these bands a chance to play the inaugural LoCoFest!

All fan contributions will receive various memorabilia in return for your contributions. We have different levels of merchandise available based on your contribution. 

Help us give these bands a chance to play! Contribute, share and score some sweet merch!

Third stage lineup will be determined through a battle of the bands to take place through June and July leading up to the festival. Any band wanting to play will have an opportunity to earn a spot. The top 10 bands will play the festival's third stage.

story:
WHO ARE WE

For those looking for professional quality original background music and sound fx for your film, radio, Youtube, and other multimedia projects, we exist for you. 

By way of our state of the art online platform, you can quickly and legally access sound files that give your project that all-important heartbeat. 

                            "We are Unlimited Commercial Royalty Free music!"

At www.audioloopy.com, we make this task easy for people, providing royalty-free music and sound effects to users via a sleek, intuitive interface. We have been in the sound and music business for a while now, and we know what we’re doing.

 Ready to expand our business model, we want to make it simple and affordable for people to produce top-notch video projects and visual presentations that implement clear, enviable audio materials at a fraction of the price that other vendors are charging.


How You Can Help

Right now, we are turning to you, Indiegogo, for help raising at least $5000 to cover the basics. 

This initial operating capital will cover:

  • Cloud Server Upgrade (Allow for More Downloads and Traffic) ($2000)
  • Advance Programming for Better Experience ($1500)
  • App Development (Android and IOS) ($1490)
  • Coffee for late night productions ($10)
  • Other things that may come up (The More Funds the More Awesomeness)

Your contributions will allow us to keep our targeted super low price for our royalty free background music and sound fx for unlimited commercial usage!


How Our Clients Benefit

It doesn’t matter what type of project you’re working on: a commercial, an art film, something for school, a presentation for work. If you want to make a real, lasting impression, you need two things first and foremost: 

1. High-Quality Background Music 

2. Premium Sound FX 

These things provide atmosphere, character, and professionalism to any project, giving audiences them impression that they are watching not just something that you care about but something that they should care about too. 

This is of the utmost importance to delivering your message effectively, because if you don’t seem to be taking yourself seriously, other people are not going to take you seriously either.

How To Use Audio Loopy:

Unlimited Commercial Usage! Never Pay Royalties! Use On:
  • YouTube Background Music
  • Vimeo
  • Podcast
  • Short Films
  • Documentaries
  • Radio Commercials
  • Tutorials
  • Explainer Videos
  • Video Games
  • Apps
  • Television 
  • Presentations
  • Cinema
  • Plus more..(Any Multimedia Outlet)
  "Our Royalty Free Music and Sound FX comes in High Quality .mp3 and .wav format via zip file. No Download Links! You can Access your Files via  Free Account at any time!"

Dynamic Strings Collection

Urban Powers Collection



Perks

Our Digital Download Perks are truly amazing and will benefit you in so many ways. Our point system will allow contributors to use points at anytime on www.audioloopy.com. Points will not expire and can be used to download productions and sound fx instantly from any device.

The average price for a commercial licence is about $500. Most  commercial licence require you to pay royalties and restricts the amount of usage!
Audio Loopy's target is only $49.95 for unlimited commercial usage without paying us NO Royalties! Take advantage of the Perks! 

How Perks Work

  • 1 Point = 1 Production or Sound fx (Ex. 5 Points= 5 Productions or Sound Fx)
  • Select and Purchase Perk
  • Create an account at www.audioloopy.com
  • Or Staff will load your "Digital Download Points" to your account
  • Listen to our awesomeness and add productions to cart
  • Click "Shopping Cart" and select "Use Digital Download Rewards Points"
  • Click "Apply" and "Check Out"
  • On Payment Gateway select "Free Checkout" and Click "Confirm Order"
  • Instant Download Bliss!!!

$1 -Simple But Nice - We will email you a "Thank You" note.

$2 -Cup of Coffee -Donations for our super late hours! Will send you a "Happy Thank you Email"

$5- Official Thank You Supporter - We will add your name and information on our website "Thank You Page"

$15- 1 Digital Download -You will receive 1 "Digital Download Reward Point" on the Audio Loopy Website Platform. (Use any time on www.audioloopy.com)

$25- 2 Digital Downloads -You will receive 2 "Digital Download Reward Points" on the Audio Loopy Website Platform. (Use any time on www.audioloopy.com)

$50- 5 Digital Downloads -You will receive 5 "Digital Download Reward Points" on the Audio Loopy Website Platform. (Use any time on www.audioloopy.com)

$75- 8 Digital Downloads -You will receive 8 "Digital Download Reward Points" on the Audio Loopy Website Platform. (Use any time on www.audioloopy.com)

$100- 12 Digital Downloads -You will receive 12 "Digital Download Reward Points" on the Audio Loopy Website Platform. (Use any time on www.audioloopy.com)

$150- 18 Digital Downloads -You will receive 18 "Digital Download Reward Points" on the Audio Loopy Website Platform. (Use any time on www.audioloopy.com)

$200- 26 Digital Downloads -You will receive 26 "Digital Download Reward Points" on the Audio Loopy Website Platform. (Use any time on www.audioloopy.com)

$500- 60 Digital Downloads -You will receive 60 "Digital Download Reward Points" on the Audio Loopy Website Platform. (Use any time on www.audioloopy.com)

$1000- 150 Digital Downloads -You will receive 150 "Digital Download Reward Points" on the Audio Loopy Website Platform. (Use any time on www.audioloopy.com)
