story:
(English below)
Le Projet ITs Ok, c'est quoi?

Bonjour, je m'appelle Valerie Whissell et je suis l'humain derrière le Projet ITs Ok.    

Mon aventure ITs Ok a commencé il y a quelques années alors que je souffrais de dépression. Pendant cette période où j’avais de la difficulté à passer à travers mes journées, j’écrivais « ITs Ok » sur mon bras pour demeurer dans un état d’esprit positif. En route vers la santé et une meilleure acceptation de moi, ces deux mots m’ont toujours suivie.

Depuis 2013, j’explore des manières de propager des messages positifs et inspirants dans la vie des gens en utilisant l’art et les produits dérivés pour les rejoindre. Cela a mené à la naissance du projet ITs Ok en 2014. J’ai par la suite participé à plusieurs festivals d’art et collaboré avec des organismes sans but lucratif québécois.

Cet hiver, je ressens le besoin d’aller propager la vibe ITs Ok en Europe!

Les Messages ITs Ok

ITs OK d’être soi-même. 

ITs OK de vivre tes rêves. 

ITs OK d’être ton propre héros. 

Trop de gens souffrent de dépression, d’anxiété, de dépendances et de faible estime de soi. Avec les bons outils et entourés de personnes qui célèbrent le héros en nous, il est possible de retrouver la paix intérieure et d'apprendre à s’aimer. Selon moi, le chemin vers la paix dans le monde s’ouvre ainsi, puisque c’est en acceptant qui nous sommes et en nous permettant de réaliser nos rêves que nous pourrons offrir le meilleur de soi et créer un meilleur futur pour les gens autour.

Lors de mon passage en Europe, je souhaite rappeler aux gens à quel point l’acceptation de soi et un état d’esprit positif sont essentiels à l'épanouissement collectif. Dans cette optique, je vais entre autres concevoir des pochoirs ITs Ok en français et en allemand inspirés des personnes et des villes que je croiserai sur ma route. Ces pochoirs serviront à laisser des traces des messages ITs Ok un peu partout en Europe.

Mais… en quoi consiste donc cette aventure en Europe?

La quête ITs Ok en Europe

Vivons-nous entièrement et véritablement? Est-il possible que nous transformions nos peurs en embrassant directement l’incertitude qu’elles nous font ressentir? Comment pouvons-nous mieux écouter notre guide intérieur? Pouvons-nous nous ouvrir aux connexions humaines en dépit de la violence et de la destruction qui se produisent dans le monde?

30 jours. 3 pays. 1 but. 

En février, alors que je visiterai la France, la Belgique et l’Allemagne pour partager la vibe ITs Ok, je me lancerai dans une quête de réponses à ces grandes questions de la vie. Lorsque je pense aux récents débats en lien avec le mariage homosexuel en France ainsi qu’aux attaques terroristes de novembre dernier, je sens un puissant besoin d’aller planter des graines d’amour en Europe. À ma façon, je souhaite ainsi tenter de faire de notre monde un meilleur endroit où vivre.

Grâce aux produits ITs Ok (autocollants, tatouages temporaires, aimants, etc.), à l’art urbain et aux rencontres que je ferai, je propagerai l’énergie ITs Ok et la dirigerai vers ceux qui en ont le plus besoin! D’ailleurs, j’essaie présentement de bâtir un canal de collaboration avec un organisme sans but lucratif européen travaillant avec et pour les communautés LGBTQ (lesbiennes, gaies, bisexuelles, trans et queers). Je veux partager mon histoire pour aider ceux qui ont de la difficulté à s’accepter tels qu’ils sont et, du même coup, les inspirer à s'exprimer par l'entremise de l'art.

J’apporterai une caméra afin de capter mes rencontres en images et de rapporter l’expérience du projet ITs Ok en Europe au Québec à mon retour, entre autres pour diffuser le contenu dans des écoles et des organismes. Pendant mon séjour, je mettrai également des vidéos hebdomadairement en ligne pour que vous puissiez vivre les moments ITs Ok avec moi.

À travers ce voyage, j’aimerais développer une meilleure compréhension de la peur qui construit et influence les sociétés que nous connaissons et les valeurs étroites qui guident bien souvent nos comportements.

La magie des rencontres

Lors de mes voyages aux États-Unis et de mes participations à différents festivals d’art avec le projet ITs Ok, j’ai eu la chance de parler des obstacles de la vie et d’acceptation de soi avec plusieurs personnes inspirantes. J’ai envie de vivre ce genre de moments humains en France, en Belgique et en Allemagne. J’ai vu à quel point la vibe ITs Ok et des moments de partage véritables pouvaient éclairer la vie des gens et les ouvrir à l’inconnu. Je le sais parce que je le vis moi aussi lors de ces rencontres.

À de nombreuses reprises, des gens m’ont écrit pour me dire que les autocollants ITs Ok les aidaient à garder espoir dans des moments plus difficiles de leur vie. C’est pourquoi je veux maintenant explorer le potentiel des messages ITs Ok en Europe et voir l’impact qu’ils auront sur les gens avec qui je ferai connaissance.

Afin de connecter avec des Français, des Belges et des Allemands et d’ajouter un peu d’énergie ITs Ok à leur quotidien, je ferai du couchsurfing et j’utiliserai autant que possible le covoiturage pour me déplacer. Mes billets d’avion sont achetés et certains de mes arrêts sont déjà déterminés, mais je vais aussi me laisser guider par le moment présent et les rencontres qui composeront ma visite en continent européen.

Les détails du budget

Grâce à l’incroyable soutien dont j’ai bénéficié lors de ma participation à différents marchés de Noël au Québec, j’ai pu payer mes billets d’avion pour l’Europe. Cependant, j’ai besoin de plus de fonds pour couvrir mes dépenses de voyage sur le terrain et me permettre d’apporter du matériel audiovisuel, des fournitures d’art et des produits ITs OK. Je compte mettre plus de 1000 produits ITs Ok dans mes bagages (autocollants, tatouages temporaires, aimants, etc.) afin de les distribuer tout au long de mon voyage, ainsi que 50 mini-toiles à créer et à partager sur la route. Pour accomplir tout cela, j’ai besoin d’un minimum de 2000 $.

De plus, j’ai encore à ce stade-ci le rêve de partir avec un vidéaste professionnel pour transformer l’aventure en documentaire. Si, ensemble, nous atteignons 3500$, ce rêve est accessible! Nous pouvons y arriver! Bien sûr, sans vidéaste, je ferai tout en mon pouvoir pour capter des images du voyage inspirantes à partager avec vous pendant mon passage en Europe et à mon retour.

Peu importe ce qu’il adviendra, je serai plus que reconnaissante de la générosité et du soutien que vous démontrez envers le projet ITs Ok en Europe.

Partageons la vibe ITs Ok ensemble!

La beauté de cette campagne de financement est que non seulement vous m’encouragez dans mon projet en Europe, mais que vous aussi, grâce aux récompenses offertes, participez à la diffusion des messages encourageants du projet ITs Ok. C’est ensemble, un ITs Ok à la fois, que nous ferons une différence dans le monde!

Les Récompenses et comment ça fonctionne?

 Les récompenses ''Perks'' sont là pour vous remercier de me supporter dans ce projet. En m'aidant à propager la vibe ITs Ok en Europe, vous aussi recevrez un peu de la vibe ITs Ok! 

* Pour les produits porteurs de la ''vibe ITs Ok'', la livraison est estimée en Mai. 

* Pour les présentations dans les écoles et les ateliers la date sera à déterminer ensemble. 

*Des frais de livraison sont à tenir compte lorsque mentionné et peuvent varier selon les produits. 

Voici ce que j'aimerais vous offrir:

1) ITs Ok MOMENT DE RECONNAISSANCE

Votre support est grandement apprécié. En guise de reconnaissance, vous recevrez une lettre de remerciement par courriel électronique accompagnée d'une photo d'un moment ITs Ok prise en Europe! 

2) ITs Ok POUR TOI ET UN(E) AMI(E) 

 

Vous allez recevoir 2 collants ITs Ok, 2 collants Be Your Own Hero et 2 tattoos temporaires. En plus d'aider à propager la vibe ITs Ok en Europe, ceci vous permettra de partager la vibe ITs Ok avec un(e) ami(e). 

3) LES CARTES DE SOUHAITS ''BE YOUR OWN HERO''

 

En plus de mes sincères salutations, vous allez recevoir les 2 modèles de cartes de souhait ''Be Your Own Hero'' que vous allez pouvoir garder ou offrir à un(e) ami(e). 

4) LES RAPPELS ITs Ok AIMANTÉS 

  

Vous allez recevoir la collection complète d'aimants ITs Ok! Ce qui veut dire que vous allez avoir 12 aimants porteurs de messages d'amour et d'espoir que vous pouvez garder ou aimanter en cachette sur les refrégirateurs de vos ami(e)s. 

5) LE T-SHIRT ''BE YOUR OWN HERO'' ou LE T-SHIRT ''ITs OK''

 

Vous allez pouvoir porter et propager la vibe ITs Ok autour de vous! Vous recevrez le T-shirt ''ITs Ok'' ou ''Be Your Own Hero'' imprimé à la sérigraphie avec amour sur du coton biologique par des artists d'ici. Les T-shirts seront prêts juste à temps pour l'été! Veuillez mentionner la taille désirée ainsi que le style (homme ou femme) en commentaire lors de votre transaction.

6) LA TROUSSE DE SURVIE ''ITs OK''

Vous allez être submergé d'énergie positive avec l'ensemble complet porteur de la vibe ITs Ok! Vous allez recevoir le T-shirt ''ITs Ok'' + 3 aimants + 2 maccarons + 1 collant + 1 tattoo temporaire. Veuillez mentionner la taille désirée du T-shirt ainsi que le style (homme ou femme) en commentaire lors de votre transaction. 

7) LA TROUSSE DE SURVIE ''BE YOUR OWN HERO''

Peut contenir des traces de courage! Vous allez recevoir l'ensemble complet ''Be Your Own Hero'' incluant le T-shirt BYOH + 1 tasse + 1 aimant + 1 collant + 2 maccarons + 2 cartes de souhaits. Veuillez mentionner la taille désirée du T-shirt ainsi que le style (homme ou femme) en commentaire lors de votre transaction. 

8) LA TROUSSE PROFESSIONNELLE ITs OK

Vous allez pouvoir partager la vibe ITs Ok à votre école, dans votre organisme, ou au bureau! Vous recevrez 100 tattoos temporaires ITs Ok ou collants. Il est possible de mélanger tattoos et collants pour une totalité de 100. 

9) LE PROJET ITs Ok À VOTRE ÉCOLE

Ce sera un grand plaisir pour moi de venir partager la vibe ITs Ok et parler de mon expérience du Projet ITs Ok en Europe dans votre classe afin d'inspirer vos jeunes à aller au bouts de leur rêves eux aussi! Si vous êtes à l'extérieur de la région de l'Estrie, Montréal ou Québec et ses environs, ITs Ok, mais des frais supplémentaires pour le transport sera à prévoir et à discuter ensemble.

10) ITs Ok ATELIER D'ART

Il me fera un plaisir de venir passer une demi-journée dans votre classe pour donner un atelier de fabrication de stencil avec votre groupe. Si vous êtes à l'extérieur de la région de l'Estrie, Montréal ou Québec et ses environs, ITs Ok, mais des frais supplémentaires pour le transport sera à prévoir et à discuter ensemble.

*NEW PERKS*: THE ITs Ok HOODIE

Vous recevrez le 'Hoodie' ITs Ok  avec la vibe dans le dos et le zip en avant imprimé à la sérigraphie sur du coton biologique par des artists d'ici. Le hoodie est à la fois un moyen de porter et propager la vibe ITs Ok! Sans oublier qu'il est réconfortant! 

*Ajoutez 5$ pour la livraison au Canada

D'autres façons d'aider

Si vous ne pouvez pas soutenir financièrement le projet, ne vous en faites pas, c’est OK! Vous pouvez tout de même m’aider à partager la vibe ITs Ok en diffusant cette campagne de financement dans vos réseaux et vos communautés et avec ceux qui auraient besoin de rappels ITs Ok dans leur vie!

Les contacts de membres de votre famille ou de vos amies et amis qui vivent en France, en Belgique et en Allemagne sont les bienvenus! Si certains sont intéressés à m’héberger ou à aller prendre un thé avec moi, vous pouvez m’écrire au info@itsokproject.com.

Merci de votre soutien! Merci pour vos encouragements! Merci, surtout, de propager la vibe ITs Ok à votre façon!

Pour plus de renseignements sur le projet ITs Ok, visitez le www.itsokproject.com (en anglais seulement) ou la page Facebook du projet.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

(English)

The ITs Ok Project

Hi, my name is Valerie Whissell and I'm the founder of the ITs Ok Project. My ITs Ok journey all started a few years ago as i was struggling with depression. During that period when I was having a rough time getting through the day I would write ITs Ok on my arm to keep myself focused on a positive state of mind. Along my way to recovery & through my journey of self acceptance, these two words never left me. Since 2013, I've been exploring ways to spread positive & empowering messages in people's lives by using art & products as my way to reach out to people. This gave birth to the ITs Ok project in 2014. Since then i've participated in different art festivals & collaborated with several non profit organizations. This winter, I feel the need to spread the ITs Ok vibe in Europe!

The ITs Ok Quest in Europe. 

Are we living fully & with authenticity? Is it possible for us to follow our fears by embracing uncertainty & listening to our inner guidance? Can we open ourselves to human connections despite all the violence & destructive events happening in our world? 

 30 Days. 3 countries. 1 Goal.

This February I'm on a quest to answer life's big questions as I will be off to spread the ITs Ok vibe in Europe. I will be visiting France, Belgium & Germany. With marriage equality that brought up a lot of commotion in France the past few years & in response to the recent terrorist attacks, I feel called to plant seeds of love in Europe and try to make this world a better place in my own way. With the help of the ITs Ok products (stickers, temporary tattoos & magnets) and through street art interventions & human connections, I will be spreading the ITs Ok vibe with those who might need it! I'm also currently seeking to collaborate with a non profit organization related to the LGBT community & share my story to help those who are struggling with self acceptance. All in all, I want to have a better understanding of the fear that we are constantly cultivating in our society & in our personal limiting beliefs. I'm bringing a camera along so I can capture & bring the ITs Ok in Europe experience back home in schools & non profit organizations. I will also be doing a weekly video blog as I journey through Europe to share my ITs OK Moments with you. 

The Messages

ITs Ok to be yourself. ITs Ok To live your dreams. ITs Ok to Be Your Own Hero. Too many people are suffering with depression, anxiety, addiction & lack of self worth. With the right tools & by surrounding ourselves with people who celebrate our truth, it is possible to find peace within & to learn to love ourselves. I believe the road to world peace starts by embracing who we are & allowing ourselves to live our dreams. May we become the Heros of our lives by allowing ourselves to speak our truth.

During my stay in Europe, I want to remind people of the importance of self acceptance & cultivating a positive state of mind. With this intention, I will be creating ITs OK stencil messages in French & in German inspired by the beautiful encounters & the cities i will be visiting. 

The empowering effect of Human Connection

During my past travels in the United States & experiences in art festivals with The ITs Ok Project, I got to have beautiful human conversations with people about life, struggles, self acceptance & living more consciously. I want to bring forth these human to human conversations in France, Belgium & Germany this February. I have seen how the ITs Ok vibe & these shared moments had a powerful enlighting effect on people. On me too. I also have had several people writing to let me know that the ITs Ok stickers were helping them cultivate hope & light during life struggles. I'm curious to see how the ITs Ok vibe will be received in Europe!

With this sole intention to connect with Europeens & spread the ITs Ok vibe directly in people's lives, i will be couch surfing my way & traveling using ride-sharing organizations. Though my plane tickets are booked & i do have a few places mapped out. I want to go with the flow of living the present moment & let the beautiful encounters lead me through this ITs Ok journey of life in Europe. 

To spread the ITs Ok vibe together

The beauty of this campaign is that not only are you helping me go to Europe to spread the ITs Ok vibe, but with the rewards you also get to share it your way. For i believe that it's together that we can truly make a difference in this world one ITs Ok at a time! To top it all, when i come back to Canada I also intend to visit schools  & non profits organizations to share my experience of the ITs OK Project in Europe. 

The Details

30 days. 3 countries (France, Belgium & Germany). 1 goal. 

The plane ticket has already been taken care of thanks to the incredible support the ITs Ok Project received during the Christmas markets! But I still need your help to raise a minimum of 2000$ to help cover the cost of traveling in Europe, camera equipement, the art supplies & the ITs Ok merchandise. I'm bringing along over 1000 ITs Ok reminders (stickers, temporary tattoos, pins & magnets) to give out and 50 mini stencilled paintings that I will be creating & spreading around Europe.

My ultimate dream & goal is to bring a professional film maker with me to capture the ITs Ok vibe & Moments in Europe so we can make a documentary. If we do reach 3500$, we will be able to make it happen! If not, ITs Ok! I will do my best to capture the ITs Ok vibe myself! In any case, I will be more than grateful for your generosity & your incredible support! 

Perks and How They Work

The perks are a way of giving back to you in thanks for your support. By helping me spread the ITs Ok vibe in Europe, you also get to have the ITs Ok vibe in your home too! 

* Estimated delivery for the products: May 

*For School presentations & workshops, we shall look to set a day together.

*Shipping fees to be considered when listed.

Here's what I'd like to offer you… 

1) ITs Ok MOMENT & GRATITUDE

Your support means a lot. I will send you a thank you letter by e-mail along with an ITs Ok moment photo taken in Europe. 

2) ITs Ok FOR YOU & A FRIEND

You get to share the ITs Ok vibe with a friend! You will recieve 2 ITs OK Stickers + 2 Be Your Own Hero stickers & 2 temporary tattoos. *Add 2$ for delivery Outside of Canada.

3) THE BE YOUR OWN HERO GREETING CARDS

  

As well as my sincere gratitude for your support, you will get 2 different Be Your Own Hero Greeting cards to keep or to share with a friend. *Add 2$ for delivery Outside of Canada.

4) ITs Ok MAGNETIC REMINDERS

You will receive the complete collection of the ITs Ok vibe magnets! Which means you'll get 12 magnets with empowering messages to keep or to put on your friends' refrigerators! *Add 5$ for delivery Outside of Canada.

5) BE YOUR OWN HERO T-SHIRTor ITs OK T-SHIRT 

You get to wear & spread the ITs Ok vibe! You will recieve the ITs Ok or Be Your Own Hero t-shirt screen printed with love on organic cotton by some local artist. They will be ready just in time for summer! Please mention your size & style (women or men) preference! *Add 5$ for delivery in Canada or 10$ Outside of Canada. Possibility of picking up the T-shirts at ArtFocus in Sherbrooke when they will be ready.

6) ITs Ok SURVIVAL KIT

You get the complete ITs Ok vibe bundle! You will receive the ITs Ok T-shirt + 3 Magnets + 2 pins + 1 sticker + 1 temporary tattoo. *Please mention your size & style (women or men) preference for the T-shirt! *Add 5$ for delivery in Canada or 15$ Outside of Canada.

7) BE YOUR OWN HERO SURVIVAL KIT

Expect to be brainwashed with courage! You will receive the ultimate Be Your Own Hero survival kit which includes the BYOH T-shirt + 1 Mug + 1 Magnet + 2 Pins + 1 sticker + 2 greeting cards. Please mention your size & style preference for the T-shirt. *Add 5$ for delivery in Canada or 15$ Outside of Canada.

8) THE PROFESSIONAL ITs OK KIT

You get to spread the ITs Ok vibe widely at your school, in your social organisation or at your office! You will receive 100 ITs Ok Temporary Tattoos OR Stickers. *You can also choose to mix tattoos & stickers for a total of 100. *Add 5$ for delivery Outside of Canada.

9) ITs Ok PROJECT IN YOUR SCHOOL

I will come to your class room or organization to spread the ITs Ok vibe & share the ITs Ok Project in Europe experience with your students hoping it can inspire them to Be The Hero Of their Own lives! If you are outside of Montreal, Quebec or the Eastern Townships regions & area around, ITs Ok but additional travel fees will need to be covered and discussed.

10) ITs Ok ART WORKSHOP

I will come give a half day stencil making work shop in your class room or organization. If you are outside of Montreal, Quebec or the Eastern Townships regions, ITs Ok but additional travel fees will need to be covered and discussed. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't financially support  the ITs Ok Project in Europe, ITs Ok! You can still help spread the vibe by sharing the campaign within your community & with those who might need an ITs Ok reminder!

Invitations from your family & friends who are currently living in France, Belgium or Germany are more than welcome! If interested in hosting me or if you want to meet up for tea you can write to me at: info@itsokproject.com

Thanks for your support and helping spread the ITs Ok vibe in your own way! 

The ITs Ok Project: itsokproject.com
story_txt:
(English below)

Le Projet ITs Ok, c'est quoi?






Bonjour, je m'appelle Valerie Whissell et je suis l'humain derrière le Projet ITs Ok.     
Mon aventure ITs Ok a commencé il y a quelques années alors que je souffrais de dépression. Pendant cette période où j’avais de la difficulté à passer à travers mes journées, j’écrivais « ITs Ok » sur mon bras pour demeurer dans un état d’esprit positif. En route vers la santé et une meilleure acceptation de moi, ces deux mots m’ont toujours suivie.
Depuis 2013, j’explore des manières de propager des messages positifs et inspirants dans la vie des gens en utilisant l’art et les produits dérivés pour les rejoindre. Cela a mené à la naissance du projet ITs Ok en 2014. J’ai par la suite participé à plusieurs festivals d’art et collaboré avec des organismes sans but lucratif québécois.
Cet hiver, je ressens le besoin d’aller propager la vibe ITs Ok en Europe!
Les Messages ITs Ok
ITs OK d’être soi-même. 
ITs OK de vivre tes rêves. 
ITs OK d’être ton propre héros. 
Trop de gens souffrent de dépression, d’anxiété, de dépendances et de faible estime de soi. Avec les bons outils et entourés de personnes qui célèbrent le héros en nous, il est possible de retrouver la paix intérieure et d'apprendre à s’aimer. Selon moi, le chemin vers la paix dans le monde s’ouvre ainsi, puisque c’est en acceptant qui nous sommes et en nous permettant de réaliser nos rêves que nous pourrons offrir le meilleur de soi et créer un meilleur futur pour les gens autour.
Lors de mon passage en Europe, je souhaite rappeler aux gens à quel point l’acceptation de soi et un état d’esprit positif sont essentiels à l'épanouissement collectif. Dans cette optique, je vais entre autres concevoir des pochoirs ITs Ok en français et en allemand inspirés des personnes et des villes que je croiserai sur ma route. Ces pochoirs serviront à laisser des traces des messages ITs Ok un peu partout en Europe.
Mais… en quoi consiste donc cette aventure en Europe?
La quête ITs Ok en Europe
Vivons-nous entièrement et véritablement? Est-il possible que nous transformions nos peurs en embrassant directement l’incertitude qu’elles nous font ressentir? Comment pouvons-nous mieux écouter notre guide intérieur? Pouvons-nous nous ouvrir aux connexions humaines en dépit de la violence et de la destruction qui se produisent dans le monde?
30 jours. 3 pays. 1 but. 
En février, alors que je visiterai la France, la Belgique et l’Allemagne pour partager la vibe ITs Ok, je me lancerai dans une quête de réponses à ces grandes questions de la vie. Lorsque je pense aux récents débats en lien avec le mariage homosexuel en France ainsi qu’aux attaques terroristes de novembre dernier, je sens un puissant besoin d’aller planter des graines d’amour en Europe. À ma façon, je souhaite ainsi tenter de faire de notre monde un meilleur endroit où vivre.
Grâce aux produits ITs Ok (autocollants, tatouages temporaires, aimants, etc.), à l’art urbain et aux rencontres que je ferai, je propagerai l’énergie ITs Ok et la dirigerai vers ceux qui en ont le plus besoin! D’ailleurs, j’essaie présentement de bâtir un canal de collaboration avec un organisme sans but lucratif européen travaillant avec et pour les communautés LGBTQ (lesbiennes, gaies, bisexuelles, trans et queers). Je veux partager mon histoire pour aider ceux qui ont de la difficulté à s’accepter tels qu’ils sont et, du même coup, les inspirer à s'exprimer par l'entremise de l'art.
J’apporterai une caméra afin de capter mes rencontres en images et de rapporter l’expérience du projet ITs Ok en Europe au Québec à mon retour, entre autres pour diffuser le contenu dans des écoles et des organismes. Pendant mon séjour, je mettrai également des vidéos hebdomadairement en ligne pour que vous puissiez vivre les moments ITs Ok avec moi.
À travers ce voyage, j’aimerais développer une meilleure compréhension de la peur qui construit et influence les sociétés que nous connaissons et les valeurs étroites qui guident bien souvent nos comportements.
La magie des rencontres
Lors de mes voyages aux États-Unis et de mes participations à différents festivals d’art avec le projet ITs Ok, j’ai eu la chance de parler des obstacles de la vie et d’acceptation de soi avec plusieurs personnes inspirantes. J’ai envie de vivre ce genre de moments humains en France, en Belgique et en Allemagne. J’ai vu à quel point la vibe ITs Ok et des moments de partage véritables pouvaient éclairer la vie des gens et les ouvrir à l’inconnu. Je le sais parce que je le vis moi aussi lors de ces rencontres.
À de nombreuses reprises, des gens m’ont écrit pour me dire que les autocollants ITs Ok les aidaient à garder espoir dans des moments plus difficiles de leur vie. C’est pourquoi je veux maintenant explorer le potentiel des messages ITs Ok en Europe et voir l’impact qu’ils auront sur les gens avec qui je ferai connaissance.
Afin de connecter avec des Français, des Belges et des Allemands et d’ajouter un peu d’énergie ITs Ok à leur quotidien, je ferai du couchsurfing et j’utiliserai autant que possible le covoiturage pour me déplacer. Mes billets d’avion sont achetés et certains de mes arrêts sont déjà déterminés, mais je vais aussi me laisser guider par le moment présent et les rencontres qui composeront ma visite en continent européen.
Les détails du budgetGrâce à l’incroyable soutien dont j’ai bénéficié lors de ma participation à différents marchés de Noël au Québec, j’ai pu payer mes billets d’avion pour l’Europe. Cependant, j’ai besoin de plus de fonds pour couvrir mes dépenses de voyage sur le terrain et me permettre d’apporter du matériel audiovisuel, des fournitures d’art et des produits ITs OK. Je compte mettre plus de 1000 produits ITs Ok dans mes bagages (autocollants, tatouages temporaires, aimants, etc.) afin de les distribuer tout au long de mon voyage, ainsi que 50 mini-toiles à créer et à partager sur la route. Pour accomplir tout cela, j’ai besoin d’un minimum de 2000 $.
De plus, j’ai encore à ce stade-ci le rêve de partir avec un vidéaste professionnel pour transformer l’aventure en documentaire. Si, ensemble, nous atteignons 3500$, ce rêve est accessible! Nous pouvons y arriver! Bien sûr, sans vidéaste, je ferai tout en mon pouvoir pour capter des images du voyage inspirantes à partager avec vous pendant mon passage en Europe et à mon retour.
Peu importe ce qu’il adviendra, je serai plus que reconnaissante de la générosité et du soutien que vous démontrez envers le projet ITs Ok en Europe.
Partageons la vibe ITs Ok ensemble!
La beauté de cette campagne de financement est que non seulement vous m’encouragez dans mon projet en Europe, mais que vous aussi, grâce aux récompenses offertes, participez à la diffusion des messages encourageants du projet ITs Ok. C’est ensemble, un ITs Ok à la fois, que nous ferons une différence dans le monde!
Les Récompenses et comment ça fonctionne?

 Les récompenses ''Perks'' sont là pour vous remercier de me supporter dans ce projet. En m'aidant à propager la vibe ITs Ok en Europe, vous aussi recevrez un peu de la vibe ITs Ok! 
* Pour les produits porteurs de la ''vibe ITs Ok'', la livraison est estimée en Mai. 
* Pour les présentations dans les écoles et les ateliers la date sera à déterminer ensemble. 
*Des frais de livraison sont à tenir compte lorsque mentionné et peuvent varier selon les produits. Voici ce que j'aimerais vous offrir:
1) ITs Ok MOMENT DE RECONNAISSANCE
Votre support est grandement apprécié. En guise de reconnaissance, vous recevrez une lettre de remerciement par courriel électronique accompagnée d'une photo d'un moment ITs Ok prise en Europe! 

2) ITs Ok POUR TOI ET UN(E) AMI(E)  
Vous allez recevoir 2 collants ITs Ok, 2 collants Be Your Own Hero et 2 tattoos temporaires. En plus d'aider à propager la vibe ITs Ok en Europe, ceci vous permettra de partager la vibe ITs Ok avec un(e) ami(e). 
3) LES CARTES DE SOUHAITS ''BE YOUR OWN HERO''
 
En plus de mes sincères salutations, vous allez recevoir les 2 modèles de cartes de souhait ''Be Your Own Hero'' que vous allez pouvoir garder ou offrir à un(e) ami(e). 
4) LES RAPPELS ITs Ok AIMANTÉS 
  
Vous allez recevoir la collection complète d'aimants ITs Ok! Ce qui veut dire que vous allez avoir 12 aimants porteurs de messages d'amour et d'espoir que vous pouvez garder ou aimanter en cachette sur les refrégirateurs de vos ami(e)s. 
5) LE T-SHIRT ''BE YOUR OWN HERO'' ou LE T-SHIRT ''ITs OK''
 
Vous allez pouvoir porter et propager la vibe ITs Ok autour de vous! Vous recevrez le T-shirt ''ITs Ok'' ou ''Be Your Own Hero'' imprimé à la sérigraphie avec amour sur du coton biologique par des artists d'ici. Les T-shirts seront prêts juste à temps pour l'été! Veuillez mentionner la taille désirée ainsi que le style (homme ou femme) en commentaire lors de votre transaction.
6) LA TROUSSE DE SURVIE ''ITs OK''
Vous allez être submergé d'énergie positive avec l'ensemble complet porteur de la vibe ITs Ok! Vous allez recevoir le T-shirt ''ITs Ok'' + 3 aimants + 2 maccarons + 1 collant + 1 tattoo temporaire. Veuillez mentionner la taille désirée du T-shirt ainsi que le style (homme ou femme) en commentaire lors de votre transaction. 

7) LA TROUSSE DE SURVIE ''BE YOUR OWN HERO''
Peut contenir des traces de courage! Vous allez recevoir l'ensemble complet ''Be Your Own Hero'' incluant le T-shirt BYOH + 1 tasse + 1 aimant + 1 collant + 2 maccarons + 2 cartes de souhaits. Veuillez mentionner la taille désirée du T-shirt ainsi que le style (homme ou femme) en commentaire lors de votre transaction. 


8) LA TROUSSE PROFESSIONNELLE ITs OK
Vous allez pouvoir partager la vibe ITs Ok à votre école, dans votre organisme, ou au bureau! Vous recevrez 100 tattoos temporaires ITs Ok ou collants. Il est possible de mélanger tattoos et collants pour une totalité de 100. 
9) LE PROJET ITs Ok À VOTRE ÉCOLE

Ce sera un grand plaisir pour moi de venir partager la vibe ITs Ok et parler de mon expérience du Projet ITs Ok en Europe dans votre classe afin d'inspirer vos jeunes à aller au bouts de leur rêves eux aussi! Si vous êtes à l'extérieur de la région de l'Estrie, Montréal ou Québec et ses environs, ITs Ok, mais des frais supplémentaires pour le transport sera à prévoir et à discuter ensemble.
10) ITs Ok ATELIER D'ART
Il me fera un plaisir de venir passer une demi-journée dans votre classe pour donner un atelier de fabrication de stencil avec votre groupe. Si vous êtes à l'extérieur de la région de l'Estrie, Montréal ou Québec et ses environs, ITs Ok, mais des frais supplémentaires pour le transport sera à prévoir et à discuter ensemble.
*NEW PERKS*: THE ITs Ok HOODIE

Vous recevrez le 'Hoodie' ITs Ok  avec la vibe dans le dos et le zip en avant imprimé à la sérigraphie sur du coton biologique par des artists d'ici. Le hoodie est à la fois un moyen de porter et propager la vibe ITs Ok! Sans oublier qu'il est réconfortant! 
*Ajoutez 5$ pour la livraison au Canada




D'autres façons d'aider
Si vous ne pouvez pas soutenir financièrement le projet, ne vous en faites pas, c’est OK! Vous pouvez tout de même m’aider à partager la vibe ITs Ok en diffusant cette campagne de financement dans vos réseaux et vos communautés et avec ceux qui auraient besoin de rappels ITs Ok dans leur vie!
Les contacts de membres de votre famille ou de vos amies et amis qui vivent en France, en Belgique et en Allemagne sont les bienvenus! Si certains sont intéressés à m’héberger ou à aller prendre un thé avec moi, vous pouvez m’écrire au info@itsokproject.com.
Merci de votre soutien! Merci pour vos encouragements! Merci, surtout, de propager la vibe ITs Ok à votre façon!
Pour plus de renseignements sur le projet ITs Ok, visitez le www.itsokproject.com (en anglais seulement) ou la page Facebook du projet.

Possibility of picking up the T-shirts at ArtFocus in Sherbrooke when they will be ready.

6) ITs Ok SURVIVAL KIT
You get the complete ITs Ok vibe bundle! You will receive the ITs Ok T-shirt + 3 Magnets + 2 pins + 1 sticker + 1 temporary tattoo. *Please mention your size & style (women or men) preference for the T-shirt! *Add 5$ for delivery in Canada or 15$ Outside of Canada.


7) BE YOUR OWN HERO SURVIVAL KIT


Expect to be brainwashed with courage! You will receive the ultimate Be Your Own Hero survival kit which includes the BYOH T-shirt + 1 Mug + 1 Magnet + 2 Pins + 1 sticker + 2 greeting cards. Please mention your size & style preference for the T-shirt. *Add 5$ for delivery in Canada or 15$ Outside of Canada.





8) THE PROFESSIONAL ITs OK KIT
You get to spread the ITs Ok vibe widely at your school, in your social organisation or at your office! You will receive 100 ITs Ok Temporary Tattoos OR Stickers. *You can also choose to mix tattoos & stickers for a total of 100. *Add 5$ for delivery Outside of Canada.

9) ITs Ok PROJECT IN YOUR SCHOOL

I will come to your class room or organization to spread the ITs Ok vibe & share the ITs Ok Project in Europe experience with your students hoping it can inspire them to Be The Hero Of their Own lives! If you are outside of Montreal, Quebec or the Eastern Townships regions & area around, ITs Ok but additional travel fees will need to be covered and discussed.


10) ITs Ok ART WORKSHOP
I will come give a half day stencil making work shop in your class room or organization. If you are outside of Montreal, Quebec or the Eastern Townships regions, ITs Ok but additional travel fees will need to be covered and discussed. 
  Other Ways You Can Help If you can't financially support  the ITs Ok Project in Europe, ITs Ok! You can still help spread the vibe by sharing the campaign within your community & with those who might need an ITs Ok reminder!
Invitations from your family & friends who are currently living in France, Belgium or Germany are more than welcome! If interested in hosting me or if you want to meet up for tea you can write to me at: info@itsokproject.com
Thanks for your support and helping spread the ITs Ok vibe in your own way! 
The ITs Ok Project: itsokproject.com

story:
Strumsy - Supporting Live Music

Update 3/25/2016: 

We're excited to announce some cool new updates to our software:

  1. Multi-date gig entry--just enter the time and select as many dates for that time as you have!
  2. Use Poster images for Gigs--they will show up on the home page with their correct aspect ratio.
  3. Improved show entry workflow--much faster interface.
  4. Improved location services for faster response time.


strumsy.com

Live music. It’s what we love. How about you? The energy, the passion, the feeling we get when the right chords come together in just "that" way invoking feelings and memories like nothing else. The way the beat of a drum can accelerate the beat of our hearts energizing us with a rush of euphoria. Certain notes singers hit in songs can bring goosebumps and tears. We want to make this happen for everyone.

Overview:

Strumsy is a great platform to bring together Bands, Fans and Venues that support live music

We’re asking for your support to make strumsy.com a more powerful tool for the synergistic trinity of Bands, Fans and Venues.

To make it the best possible experience, much work remains:

There is software we need to develop for each group

  • Venues
  • Bands
  • Fans

And other performance optimizations!

For your part, you get to know that you helped support the art of live music, and, of course, check out our perks.

At Strumsy we want to make it better for venues, bands and fans. Easier for fans to find bands they’ll like, easier for them to explore music that they haven’t listened to, easier for everyone to get what they love out of a night’s live music, easier for venues who support live music to be the choice destination for people on their nights out.

Our goal has been to DO something. We can't play a lick of music, but we realized that we COULD do something to promote live music, and make it better for everyone involved; from venues to buskers, local solo acts to bigger, nationwide performing acts. Supporting LIVE music, and especially live music by a local talent right down the street; was our foundational goal.

So, we started Strumsy to achieve those goals, and have produced the premier platform for gigging bands to build followers, be found, and distribute their show schedule to the widest audience with the fewest steps.

  • We have implemented the first dynamic request/tipping platform using new software engines so that the bands know real-time what their fans want to hear.
  • We have state-of-the-art geolocation features, so fans can dynamically locate shows near them, and get to the details of the show.
  • We have deployed both Android and iOS applications designed for the Bands to monitor incoming requests.

The feature list goes on, and the platform is fully functioning. So, you may ask, why crowdfunding?

What work remains?

  • We need to develop Strumsy to include all the functionality that bands and venues need to make it the ONE PLACE that they can go and cover all their promotional bases, and fans can get the most information about local live acts. Bands don't want to do administrative work, they want to make music, so we need to support that goal, by minimizing the "clerical" work of promoting shows. We also want to optimize the work that venues do to market their locations.
You know the classic chicken and the egg issues:
  • For Strumsy to be the place to go for live music info, the bands and venues have to be on board to give the fans results.
  • Initially, we will need to provide comprehensive coverage of all performances in major cities - this takes hours of labor. For this to be self-sustaining, Strumsy needs to be the place where venues and bands go to promote their live music shows.

But, what we're asking for your help to do is develop the platform...

Software We Need to Develop

We've already come so far, and as with any software there are many ways to make it work better toward the ultimate goal. You can help to make live music a viable option for venues and musicians and support a struggling art form.

For Bands this includes:
  • Ease of Use Refinements (making the flow super simple).
  • Maximize the platform-included promotional APIs so that the greatest number of people will hear about a show, and anybody who is looking for it, can find it.
  • We want to be the center of the spokes; enter the show on Strumsy and it will be visible on as many platforms as possible on which the band would otherwise painstakingly have to spend time entering details over and over.
  • Interactive buttons for fans to express what they like and what they don't like about what a band is doing. We don't plan on publicly displaying this information, but bands, and to some extent venues will be able get their fingers on the pulse of their audiences, and can tailor the shows (bands) or talent (venues) to best meet their demographic goals.
  • We want to minimize the fees attached to tips for the bands. To do this, we will need to build our own payment platform. Initially, Strumsy has not been involved in that transaction, but for artists to receive the greatest percentage of the tips possible, we will have to "build" the engine to allow that.
  • We want to allow a band to promote their own music in a non-greedy manner.
For Venues this includes:
  • Minimizing administration of promoting and entering show schedules.
  • Making available key metrics to tailor shows to their desired customers so they can bring in the bands that will bring in more customers or, keep those customers longer.
  • Leveraging our online-promotion tools so that people can easily find their location and see who's playing.
  • Integrate promotions or incentives the venues make available to enhance marketing efforts and ensure the longevity of Strumsy as a platform.
  • We want to refine the definitive "live music" venue database. If you host live music at your place, we want you to be listed on our site.
For Fans this includes:
  • Providing mobile apps that streamline the live music experience; from finding the shows to requesting songs (if a band takes requests), to tipping the band with a simple-to-use interface, assured that the artist is getting the lion's share of the tip.
  • Allowing other feedback, to give meaningful information the artists can use to refine their shows.
  • Refining the search tools for locating the bands they want to hear; cover bands or original bands. Ensuring that genres are accurate for an artist.
  • A better notification engine. Timely, relevant notifications of bands that are playing nearby. We can already allow notifications of bands that a fan follows, but also, a real recommendation system based on key metrics that can be invoked to get the most options.
Optimizations:
  • Enterprise level relational database functionality - some of the interactions (although not seen in typical use) can be optimized so that the platform operates faster and can handle a larger server load.
  • Build and standardize song related processes, and show-data entry flow - we can make it easier and faster for the person who enters show dates to process them en masse.
  • Image processing engine - we need to make it easier for bands to use the pictures they have on hand to load captivating band "brand" images without being experts in Photoshop. 
  • Build mobile "Fan" applications, making it as fun and easy as possible for a fan to find a cool show. These need to be customized for a truly gratifying mobile experience.

What You Get

  • By supporting Strumsy, you get to support an art form you love by giving thousands the tools they need to make it viable to continue creating the music that touches us.
  • Since we built our platform based on the live music trinity of fans, bands and venues, we offer different perks for each while putting forth the plea to those who love live music as much as we do.
Bands
  • Custom Band Image Composition - We'll compose an image that works in all of Strumsy's image areas to get you the most exposure for your shows.
  • Song List Processing -  Get your list of songs on the web; this is especially valuable for cover bands that take requests.
  • If you have a Word document or Excel spreadsheet of your shows, we'll construct a Strumsy friendly CSV document and upload shows that you provide us.
Venues
  • Custom Venue Image Composition - We'll compose an image that works in all of Strumsy's image areas to get you the most exposure for "spot".
  • Website style work - we'll customize the styling of our embedded gigs so that it works with the look and feel of your website.
  • Subscribe for Premium and Elite Venue pages - These provide links to your website, but can stand alone to bring in customers who may have never located your venue. We are going to bring your spot to the attention of organic visitors.
Fans
  • Strumsy T-Shirts
  • Strumsy Coffee Cups
Live Music Lovers

If perks do not apply to you, this project can use all the support for music lovers we can get. Help us to help artists increase their viability.

Your Empowerment

You will help propel live music. We all want new generations of great musical artists. You can support the grinders so that the future of music is full of new talent on par with the great artists that have come before.

We started this project in August of 2014, and it has truly been a labor of love. You will make it so the entire experience is something that enriches peoples' ability to enjoy live music.

Hurdles we've overcome

It's been a long road to get where we are, but our perseverance has built a great platform.  Along the way we had to take steps to make sure that "things just worked". We want to make them more than "just work", we want to make them hum.

  • With your support, we can implement the software design as it was engineered utilizing more talented programmers. This means a faster, sleeker user experience.
  • Working with our new protocols for communication and qualification of the type of world class programming and database solutions, we will be able to deliver a superior platform.

Other Ways You Can Help

We could really leverage some grass roots projects to bring to light all the gigging bands and live music venues in cities all across the US.  This might easily involve some research into shows and bands in areas that the media attention is lacking for performers and venues. Our goal is to have Strumsy be the site a person visits wherever they land in their travels to enjoy a moving show of live music:

We also have modular work that needs to be performed in PHP; anybody with high level programming skills in that language or versatility in database performance enhancements would always be welcomed.

Lastly, tell everybody you know that enjoys live music, is a gigging musician or busker (street performer), that there is a tool that can make their lives easier and make live music accessible to more people.

story:
About the artist and project

Velleitie is a solo ambient project over two years in the making by Cleveland resident Sean Kase. Many earlier recordings leaned towards a darker ambient sound, combining guitar swells, electric cello, and MIDI instruments to create relatively short productions. After a year of experimentation, the Eye Level With the Gleam EP was released with a shift in the original sound of the project to a more blissful and optimistic theme. Unblurred Variants was recorded in the fall of 2015 as a further extension of this, all the while maintaining the original melancholic attributes that defined Velleitie from the onset.

Being able to press the album onto a physical medium is considered a celebratory notion of discovering this new sound. Unblurred Variants is about 45 minutes of material that will be produced on vinyl in 100 copies and otherwise distributed digitally.

What we need

This is a self-release and is otherwise dependent on the artist's finances in order to put into production. Your donation helps front the cost. Funds are also needed to pay the very talented designers that are responsible for the album artwork and button designs as outlined in the perks. A brief rundown of the artist's costs:

- $800 upfront cost to produce the album on vinyl

- $56.00 to produce 10 copies of the album on transparent vinyl

- $53.50 to produce 5 copies of the album on white vinyl

- Shipping charges (may vary)

- Paying the designers a decent wage--the more contributions, the more they can get

What you get

A donation of any kind gets this button designed by Rumi Whipple:

$1 - Handwritten Thank You letter from the artist & button

$2 - Handwritten Thank You letter from the artist, button, & digital copy of Unblurred Variants two weeks prior to the official release date

$15 - Handwritten Thank You letter from the artist, button, digital copy of Unblurred Variants two weeks prior to the official release date, & Unblurred Variants on black vinyl

$20 - Handwritten Thank You letter from the artist, button, digital copy of Unblurred Variants two weeks prior to the official release date, & Unblurred Variants on transparent vinyl - UPDATE - SOLD OUT

$25 - Handwritten Thank You letter from the artist, button, digital copy of Unblurred Variants two weeks prior to the official release date, & Unblurred Variants on white vinyl - UPDATE - SOLD OUT

The album artwork is designed by Jan van der Kleijn.

Challenges & other items of note

The release date is tentative but absolutely slated for the fall of 2016. A test pressing should be available to the artist by August.

If you can't afford to donate, you have the ability to listen to and/or download the artist's never-ending stream via SoundCloud, and always for free:

https://soundcloud.com/velleitie_velleitie

Thank you for your interest in this project.

story:
Who We Are

The Royal Pitches is an All-Female A Cappella group from The University at Buffalo. 15 incredibly talented girls who come together to do what they love: sing. In the past we've sang for President Barack Obama, former Senator Hillary Clinton, and amazing singer, John Legend! The Royal Pitches have been around since 1996, and our most recent album, "Nobody's Pitch", came out in 2013. The Pitches have come a long way in just three years, and we'd like to show the world our amazing new sound! We work so hard just to do what we love-- putting on concerts and performing for charities are just some of the ways in which we reach out to our community! To be able to put forth our new album "Natural Women", we not only get to eternalize all our hard work, but we get to share it with you! We get to share it with all the young girls who deserve to do what they love, just like us. So please donate! Give us a chance to show you what we're made of! 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We're an independently run group and we work as hard as we can to get our own funding!
    • Our goal for this campaign is to reach $6,000! To reach this goal would be an amazing feat!
    • We have amazing perks for you if you donate! Copies of our CD's, t-shirts, tickets to our show, and much more!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, you can still help! Spread the word about our campaign! Any support we can get would be amazing.

story:
S&J is a Hip Hop/ Rhythm&Soul/ Afrobeat and POP band that originated in Dublin, Ireland. S&J's writing and musical influences include Nas, Lauren Hill, Fela Kuti, Emeli Sande, Jesus and Bob Marley.

The founders are siblings from a Nigerian royal family and are dedicated to using music as a tool to uplift people through the poetic words in their songs.

S&J rocked the 'The Word Stage' at ‘Mindfield Arena’ as well as the 'Natasha's Living Food Stage' at 'Body&Soul Arena' this year at Electric Picnic Festival in Ireland.

To mark the occasion the band exclusively released a single “Stand” which was produced by Jerome Rimson (former Thin Lizzy band member) in anticipation to their album release in Europe and Asia later in the year.

S&J have shared stage with International acts including Rihanna, Akon, Michael Bublé, N’Dubz, Sinead O’Connor, 2Face and PSquare. S&J were Ambassadors for Dance4Life Ireland and performed at the international event which was broadcasted in Europe, USA and across Africa.

S&J became a group after Stone's rap crew split-up and Jezreel had moved to Ireland. After helping Stone with a hook on a song they realized they had a sound too good to be ignored, and the combination of Jezreel's soulful melodic voice and Stone's poetic rap style led to the duo teaming-up to create their own style and sound.

S&J are managed by MCM Global Team which makes them part their select roster of artists and projects. From Zenland in Los Angeles to BLOF in Holland to John Paul Ivan in Indonesia and many more.

S&J work closely with Motown man Jerome Rimson, a much sought-after and well respected producer in the Soul/Jazz/Blues genre. With credits of Real Thing, Bee Gees, Al Jarreau, Van Morrison and many more they are in good hands and together shape the unique S&J sound.

S&J independently released several singles inclusive of video-clips with the first one ‘Tales’ being a notable success. The follow up singles ‘Dis Kain Love’, ‘ONE’ featuring Faysoff were well received internationally.

The next single in line “Janji/The Promise”, is a collaboration with Indonesian singer Ayuni. This track is recorded in Jakarta and Dublin and mixed in Amsterdam. The single and video will be released later in the year in Europe and Asia.

The latest independent release ‘Even If’ is just out and already attracting the attention from all levels in the music industry.

While promoting this latest single S&J and the management team are negotiating a global recording deal and it is expected that album release in Europe and Asia later in the year no later than 2016 we will see a full album release.

Now you can be part of the family and help Stone&Jezreel's journey!!! 

Support good music!

S&J's writing and musical influences include Nas, Lauren Hill, Fela Kuti, Emeli Sande, Jesus and Bob Marley.The founders are siblings from a Nigerian royal family and are dedicated to using music as a tool to uplift people through the poetic words in their songs.S&J rocked the 'The Word Stage' at ‘Mindfield Arena’ as well as the 'Natasha's Living Food Stage' at 'Body&Soul Arena' this year at Electric Picnic Festival in Ireland.To mark the occasion the band exclusively released a single “Stand” which was produced by Jerome Rimson (former Thin Lizzy band member) in anticipation to their album release in Europe and Asia later in the year.S&J have shared stage with International acts including Rihanna, Akon, Michael Bublé, N’Dubz, Sinead O’Connor, 2Face and PSquare. story:
TO MAKE A LONG STORY SHORT 


In 2012, I was approaching my 40th birthday and feeling like I'd hit a concrete wall. So, my restless spirit and I mustered up enough courage to begin living a more authentic life (or at least I was on the hunt to find out what that meant to me). I sold and gave away most of my possessions and began a life of full-time travel. Travelling over the unplanned course of 3 ½  years, living like a local in parts of the U.S., Mexico, Canada, Ecuador, Costa Rica, Scotland and Portugal, I experienced a deeper understanding of people, culture, nature and our world. 

And it's the ultimate cliché, but I truly did find much of myself through travelling thanks to endless opportunities to practice the vulnerable art of letting go. I've learned how simplicity brings the most happiness into my life (beyond having all belongings fit into one backpack). And the bigger part of the journey has been embracing the pattern we all identify with as humans of stumble, learn, grow and repeat. 

From these travels came poems, songs, ideas for songs and a desire to create a music/art project that brings the collection together. The more money contributed through album pre-sales, the more songs will be included on the EP, the more musicians I can hire to breathe new life into the demos and the more time I can spend with my producer in Montréal to create something I hope you truly connect with and enjoy.

SO, WHAT ARE THE COSTS?

 



IMPORTANT INFO ABOUT HOW TO ORDER YOUR PERKS 

*Be sure to hover over the perk of your choice and click "GET THIS PERK"

THE RISKS & CHALLENGES OF THE PROJECT
Like any project, challenges and unexpected things will most likely appear, but with flexibility and planning most things can be overcome. This project is something I've thought about creating for a long time. I found a good producer that shares my vision, we've started recording demos and many of the pieces are falling beautifully into place.  
There is the risk of not hitting my financial goal, but if that happens I will still record and release the EP.  It may take a little longer, have less songs on it and narrow down some creativity options... but no matter what something will be created.  
And there is a big risk with asking for help (and as a New Yorker it feels a bit uncomfortable). But travel has taught me to take these kinds of risks even when it feels uncomfortable, so, I'm going for it! 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Are you not in a financial position to donate right now? I totally understand--you can greatly contribute by helping me get the word out!

  • If EVERYONE SHARES THIS CAMPAIGN it will make a tremendous impact! Use the share tools at the top of the page to simply click & share to your social network and email 5-10 of your contacts.

       Thank You, Thank You, Thank You!!!!



(Click 'GALLERY' above to see more pics & listen to a demo sample)

**Campaign photo by © ImageSails.com

**Video by Current Sessions Productions

story:
By contributing to this campaign, you are helping me to fulfill a life-long dream. After taking a much needed five-year creative hiatus, I am excited to announce my return. Not only am I returning to the road but I am also returning with songs written while in my hibernation, songs for the human condition, hard ships, love, loss, and lust. Everything feels different this time and I am learning every day to stop and smell the roses that life has to offer with each and every journey.  When you support my efforts here, I get share with you some really cool stuff like: fun updates on the project, sneak peaks, behind the scenes exclusives, hand made perks, a major life milestone, and more.

There are many details below, take a gander and please contribute if you can!

I thank you kindly for your support.

 

THE GOAL

GOAL $6,000: This covers the production, session musicians, mixing, mastering, lunch in the studio, and pressing of my album. 

EXCEEDING THE GOAL:

$ 7,200 – Publicity Campaign and Radio Promotion for the new album

$ 8,500 – My First Music Video, PR & Radio Promotion

$10,000 – Touring with a small band. This would help supplement payment to some fellow musicians to accompany me on the road. As well as pay for all the aforementioned.

 

WHY I CREATE

"It’s funny how a song can soothe your soul, pick you 
up when you are broken and make you whole."
- From Sometimes by Lorie Jo

Art connects us with each other. It allows us to share grief, love, loss, rage, comedy, passion, and healing across a multitude of platforms. Creativity drives improvements and changes in our society not only socially but also mechanically, technologically, philanthropically, and otherwise. The creative process has a domino effect of positivity with those surrounded by it. It tends to spread like a wildfire. Those fragile coals must be tended in order to remain aglow. I am fortunate enough to have been given the support, encouragement, and freedom of character to be an artist, something that humbles me every day.

With your support, we can continue to fuel the connection and sharing of music with the throngs of beautiful humans that occupy this amazing planet. I have resigned myself to a humble life so I can create. So I can be close to our creator. So I can connect and hopefully bring some relief and understanding to all of us facing the human condition.

 

GO GETTER

For those of you who know me well, you know that the project at hand is the most important one on my plate. I have always set out to explore new avenues and improve the world with music. With your support I can continue to do that.

In my past adventures, I have created some great space for music. I founded and ran the S40 Roots Festival for 5 years, with the help of loads of volunteers, of course. While financially the festival was not successful, the memories, community building, and friendships made in the process are priceless.

When I first began playing guitar, it was in a matter of six months that I had already started booking venues for original material and a few covers. I immediately started working with the seasoned musicians in my town and started a band and released an album with that group later known as Bridges.

Wanting to grow musically, I transplanted myself from Topeka, Kansas to Springfield, Missouri, where there was a more developed Americana music scene. Two years later I moved to Nashville, Tennessee. I didn’t know a soul. I managed to get a band together: noTVmotel. We released the Gadget (2009) and Bootleg (2010) albums, which are comprised of my original material.

Five years ago, I made one of the most difficult and painful choices in my life. I put the music down. I was overwhelmed with the industry, the rat race, the loads of empty advice about who I was or what I should be as an artist. I had lost my connection with the muses that had once comforted me on my loneliest days. I had lost my connection with my inner child, my artist, myself. I was feeling a vast void and was unable to offer my voice to others. I was working a miserable job. I was unhappy. Although it was the last thing I wanted, I know you can’t force love when it isn’t there. It ended up being the healthiest thing I have ever done. It boiled down to listening to the call from the stillness within. And if you love something, you should set it free...


GIVING GETS

 In January of 2016, I had a light-bulb moment. The extreme challenge over the last years, my long stent of unemployment, getting through college in my thirties, some considerable health costs, and being on the verge of having to sell everything and move home feeling failure as my only companion, had opened a whole new world to me. Not only had the struggles slowly refilled my coiffeur with songs of struggle, love, admiration, and humility. Without me even knowing it, those battles changed my circumstance. It taught me how to make ends meet in unconventional ways. I started an Airbnb, created an LLC to offer affordable PT marketing to private practice physicians, joined the team at DittyTV as a VJ host of #TheCurve, and I welcomed a musical roommate in from St. Louis. The culmination of these hardships and creative recoveries have put me in a position to work from anywhere in the world. They have afforded me the opportunity to tour full-time and still be able to make a living through these supplemental incomes.

As I try to keep still enough to hear the pull of my life-path, I know now is the time to seize my lifelong dream of being a singer, a songwriter, a performing artist, a creator, and a connector of people. By funding this campaign, you are giving me the encouragement and support, not just the finances, to dive in face first into this musical journey that has been molding my character since birth.

 

NO MONEY • NO PROBLEM

I know many of you live hand to mouth and that sometimes it is simply not affordable to donate any amount to someone else’s cause. But you can still help by spreading the word, sharing my campaign on social media, connecting with me on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter, by letting me know about cool venues in your town that I should come play, or even by offering a couch to crash on during the tour. All support is needed and I am eternally grateful for all of you that have taken the time to explore my dreams.

story:
What We Need & What You Get

I am looking for $5000 in funding.  This amount will pay for the promotion of my new Christmas album, "Down Home Christmas".  This includes radio promotion and radio tour expenses.

Since it is a Christmas album, and the name of the album is "Down Home Christmas", we have a lot of exciting perks, such as:  house concerts, Christmas party performances, great merchandise that can be used as Christmas gifts, personalized gifts for you or someone you love and a few handmade goodies.

Short Summary

My name is Cody Joe Hodges.  I am a Texas based country recording artist.  You might know me from my recent radio releases, "Getting Back to Country", "One More Drink" and "Hellbent On Loving You".  This past year I was named the 2016 Male Rising Star from the Country Music Association of Texas.

For those that don't know me, I started playing music at an early age, but it wasn’t until my senior year in high school that I became serious about my art.  Impassioned by country greats from the 70's and 80's, I wrote my first song, “Daddy’s Dream”, my freshman year in the dorms at Texas A&M University. 

Not long after graduating from A&M in 2006, I decided to take off for Nashville without a job, place to stay or even a friend.  As luck would have it, I ended up renting a place to stay with Jay Andrews, the steel guitar player for Johnny Paycheck.  After a short stay in Nashville, I decided to move back to Texas, take a break from music, and joined the Army.

While in the Army, (duty station, Fort Carson), I was playing music with a homeless man on a street corner in Colorado Springs, and was approached by someone out of the crowd.  I was then asked to audition for one of the Army's music groups, "Harmony in Motion," a vocal ensemble based out of Fort Carson, Colorado.  After auditioning with "The National Anthem" and an original tune, "Daddy's Dream", they extended an offer for me to join them.  I then began traveling across America playing for large entertainment venues and private military events.  

Upon discharge, Dad had a talk with me about a career in the power line business (as a lineman). This sounded like something exciting and also a great opportunity to draw upon for songwriting, so I joined the energy field in 2010.

In the spring of 2013, I decided to exit out of the power line business and focus energy on my music as a solo artist, putting faith in whatever plans God had for me.  So far it has been a blessing, with my first recording contract signed in Dec. ’13 (Tate Music Group - Oklahoma).  I released "The Good Stuff" album in November 2014, in which 6 songs I co-wrote with my wife, Jamie.

In 2014, I teamed up with Lamon Records, a Sony independent label out of Nashville, to record my next project, a four song EP entitled "One More Drink".  The EP was released May 5, 2015, along with  the EP's titled single, "One More Drink" (co-written with Jamie) and a music video. 

For those that know me, God and family are most important to me, and what better way to honor them both than with a Christmas album?  I have always dreamed of recording a Christmas album, and I finally was offered the opportunity to make this happen.  This album is very special to me.  Not only does it contain several of my favorite Christmas songs growing up, but it also contains three original songs written by my wife, Jamie, and myself.

As some of you know, recording, producing, distributing and marketing an album of any sort takes a lot of time and resources.  I am also aware that in this day and age, releasing a Christmas album might not be the "cool" or most "PC" thing to do, but this is what I am about - God, family and country.  I am honored to have the opportunity to share this album with you, and for you to take an active role in it's success.  Thanks so much for your support and God bless.

 

The Impact

If you are like me, I love Christmas music.  Whenever I hear the first Christmas song of the year, I immediately feel nostalgic, reflecting on Christmas' of the past.  Christmas to me is so special - a time for friends, family and praise.  It is also a time for generosity and appreciation for all mankind.  I love hearing stories of people "paying it forward" during the holidays.

Of course, Christmas is not possible without Christ.  So I am eternally grateful for all He has provided.  My first radio release, "Getting Back to Country" hit the Top 25 of the Texas charts, #12 on the International charts and #1 on the Fan-Voted Chart (the first Texas artist to reach #1 since the charts inception in 1998).  My second release, "One More Drink", hit #1 on the International charts and also won the Country Single and Country Video by the Akademia Awards.  My most recent single, "Hellbent On Loving You" is still currently climbing the Music Row charts (6 weeks in the top 75) and Texas charts.

 

 

Risks & Challenges

Of course, this is our second "go" at crowdfunding.  My first attempt was prior to the release of my first album, "The Good Stuff", my EP, "One More Drink", and the release of any of the radio singles.  Now that I have a broader fan base, and more people who are (hopefully) familiar with my music, I think we can make this campaign a huge success.  I appreciate your help in making it a success, and think it will offer some great items that you can keep for yourself or, since it is the "season of giving", give to your family and friends.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thanks again for your support and encouragement!  Please help us spread the word about our upcoming album, "Down Home Christmas", this campaign and definitely try out the Indiegogo share tools.

Of course, this is our second "go" at crowdfunding.  My first attempt was prior to the release of my first album, "The Good Stuff", my EP, "One More Drink", and the release of any of the radio singles.  Now that I have a broader fan base, and more people who are (hopefully) familiar with my music, I think we can make this campaign a huge success.  I appreciate your help in making it a success, and think it will offer some great items that you can keep for yourself or, since it is the "season of giving", give to your family and friends.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Thanks again for your support and encouragement!  Please help us spread the word about our upcoming album, "Down Home Christmas", this campaign and definitely try out the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
The Sweet & Lowdown...

The High Rollers need your help finishing our next record.  The band's sound has been evolving and recently we have performed to some of the largest crowds ever at our regular gigs around Philly.  We kept costs down in the past by recording our last two records ourselves.  But for this new project we went into the studio and began recording and studios are NOT cheap.  We were able to put down a few tracks back in April but now we are turning to our fans for help to finish this project.

These Foolish Things...

We do not have a million t-shirts to bribe you with.  We don't have dozens of sticker designs.  What we do have is a book of incredibly infectious music that runs the gamut from swing to blues, from New Orleans to Cuba and we want to share that with you! 

We are asking for $2,000 to finish what we have started.  We would welcome any additional funding, as that would go to make the current project stronger.  We may be able to add an additional song or two with extra funding.

We are experimenting with some "not-your-average" crowd funding rewards, so before you decide on any donation amount make sure you check out the full list.  The "estimated delivery time" applies to the actual new album itself, which is included with every perk.  If you choose something like lessons or admission to a Mermaid Inn gig you can redeem that anytime before the "estimated delivery".

What Are We Recording?

We have a bunch of new tunes that are all originals, plus two songs written by local songwriters.  Here is the list that of what is currently slated to be on the new record.
       Isla's Waltz (C. Marsceill)
       @ETUDE (C. Marsceill & A. Garro)
       Carpet Bagger's Blues (C. Marsceill)
       Gene-Pullen (D. Dzubinski)
       Huddle House Honey (C. Marsceill)
       Nowhere Bound Affair (B. Kors)
       Look Where We Have Been (C. Marsceill)
       Pretty Kitty Two-Step (C. Marsceill)
       The Storm (C. Marsceill)
       Jacques-I-Mo (C. Marsceill)

Can't Always Get What You Want...

Not able to contribute? Don't worry!  Support the band in other ways... 
  • Come out to a gig that has a cover charge, even if it is an extra drive.
  • Come down to a gig that doesn't have a cover charge and have dinner.  Venues book us because of their food/beverage sales.
  • Start a Spotify or iTunes channel using your favorite High Rollers song or album.
  • Hire the band, or any band, for your next party.
  • Offer up your spare bedroom if you live near an out-of-town performance.
  • Buy us a drink.

story:
This is new music.

Lorelei Ensemble is a dynamic chamber vocal ensemble based in Boston, committed to the creation, cultivation, and performance of a fresh and fearless repertoire for women's voices. Critically-acclaimed by the New York Times as "warm, lithe, and beautifully blended" and the Boston Globe as "audacious and impressive," Lorelei is quickly gaining recognition as one of the country's most exciting and forward-thinking contemporary ensembles.

This campaign supports the production of Impermanence, our third studio album, this time collaborating with the Sono Luminus label. This is sure to be a brilliant collection, thoughtfully crafted by Artistic Director, Beth Willer, performed with riveting intensity and grace, and masterfully captured by the Sono Luminus team. 

And don't forget that this is NEW music. Impermanence is the first all-female recording of any of Du Fay's isorhythmic and cantilena motets (15c), and only the second recording of selections from the anonymous Turin Manuscript (14c) and Takemitsu's Wind Horse (1966). The premiere recording of Peter Gilbert's Tsukimi (commissioned for Lorelei in 2013) is the centerpiece and inspiration for this album and its concept. This breathtaking work features 8 miniatures on Japanese waka poetry, each featuring a member of the ensemble, and contemplating the moon as a symbol of impermanence.

This is groundbreaking work and we can't wait to share it with you!

What we need & where you come in

In order to make this project happen, we need to raise $15,000. Every dollar of your contribution will support artist fees for our core members: Sonja, Margot, Sarah, Sophie, Christina, Clare, Emily, Stephanie, and Beth. In return, the nine of us will tap into our boldest, most engaging and creative selves, and work incredibly hard for nearly 30 hours in the studio (well, a very nice church) to lay down these tracks.

Luckily, we also have people like Dan and Colin at Sono Luminus who will be sure to transform our live performance into an equally compelling recorded experience that captures our artistry with utmost care. They are truly creative and outstanding collaborators, and we can't wait to share the "studio" with them.

The plan is this: we will record at Church of the Redeemer in Chestnut Hill, MA from July 26-30, 2016. We plan to release the album in the fall of 2017, after editing, mastering, and design is complete. Recording is some of the most intense and exciting work that we do, and we look forward to putting our energy toward an album that is sure to reach an international audience.

Of course, with your pledge to support us come some perks! See the sidebar for details on how you can get some kickback for your generous support.

Who are we?

We are an ensemble of nine women, each with a distinct and compelling artistic personality, lending to the ambitious vision and mission that propels Lorelei: to advance the women's vocal ensemble through passionate, engaging artistry, and creative collaboration. Since our founding in 2007, we have commissioned and premiered more than 50 new works. We program these works amidst and alongside brilliant, hidden gems of the Medieval, Renaissance, and Baroque periods. We thrive on creating narratives within our programming that are socially and culturally relevant, building on concepts and themes that are both immediate and timeless. 

And then we take these programs to our loyal home audience in Boston, and on the road to audiences across the U.S. 

Make an impact on classical music.

A gift to Lorelei does more than create this album. With your pledge you are: 

  • Strengthening the place of women in music—as professional performers, composers, and conductors
  • Expanding the repertoire for women's vocal ensembles around the globe
  • Ensuring that "classical" music takes its place among contemporary musics of our time, bringing rich and meaningful cultural experiences to diverse audiences
  • Supporting nine women who will serve as role models for young women across the country interested in pursuing careers in the arts

Other ways you can help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Help us spread the word to your music-loving friends and family! Share our campaign on Facebook & Twitter (links at the bottom of this page)
  • Attend our concerts in Boston. Stay tuned for information about our 2016-17 concert season at www.LoreleiEnsemble.com
  • Bring us to your community! Lorelei tours throughout our season. Contact us at Lorelei.Ensemble@gmail.com 
  • Give to Lorelei whenever you are able! We are a 501(c)(3) organization and receive donations year round (one-time or monthly options available) at www.LoreleiEnsemble.com

Our sincere gratitude to you for joining us on this journey. If we know one thing after nearly 10 years of this work, it is that building an ensemble is a shared effort, and you are an integral part of that.
