story:
photo: Louis Vignat


South Korea, September 16th, 2016


About me and why I do this campaign…

Hello! I am a German violin soloist, composer, performer, poet and professor of violin and chamber music in South Korea. 

A keen interest of my musical research is how and if daily life can be integrated into a musical form.

Are you aware of your personal "symphony" each day? How do you wake up? Accompanied by words, with the buzz of your tooth brush or with the sound of drinking some tea or water? Do you listen to birds or do you have to listen to the noise of cars? Or do you listen to your inner voice praying for a fulfilled day? Right – these are the themes and motifs of your daily "symphony", varying each day and depending on your activities, environment, team or the humans you interact with. It depends on the sounds we listen to and the kind of thoughts in our heads and hearts. Life is full of sound and noise, which also means, we´re surrounded by lots of information!

What is sound? Vibrations in the air, getting through our ears to our auditory cortex, "translated" via nerve cells into sound, which leads to positive and negative emotions. Previously music theorists divided sound into consonances or dissonances but these times have changed drastically. Our body is comprised of a complex system of nerve cells and we are actually a system of mainly water and „cell function“ through electrical signals. An atmosphere with too many external acoustical and electro-magnetical vibrations such as noise from traffic, industry, complex satellite systems, high frequency oceanic tests e.g. are all interfering with our body and the bodies of all living beings.

                       

                         


                                                                                                   source: internet

I spent my childhood in the Bavarian Forest, a geological  laboratory, very idyllic. During high-school  I studied with a Russian music and violin professor, a walking encyclopedia. I also liked subjects like maths, natural sciences, sports, languages, singing, the fine arts, dance. As a person I have synesthetical perception which means combination of auditive & visual phenomena at the same time and also have perfect pitch. 

Throughout my life I have been fascinated by the violin as "the most perfect thing made by humans - even beating the computer" - a beautiful small, light instrument from wood, a hobby or passion - you do not need any plug ins for ;-).

Music is my "(love) letter" to this world. In order to focus on practice or composition I need the power of silence and calmness as source of creativity. Descartes said: Movement in calmness and calmness in movement. A principle from the baroque time which Johann S. Bach was inspired by. 

After having played many concerts in Europe, the US, South America, Middle East and Asia, and having taught many students from all over the world I have released two CDs in 2015 with a wide range of musical styles for violin and own compositions. 

The following recording will be the continuation of the albums before which means classical music in dialogue with my own musical research as a composer. Enjoy!


More about the music on my third CD

The Six sonatas for violin solo Op 27 by Belgian composer, violinist, pedagogue and conductor, Eugène Auguste Ysaÿe (1858-1931), a real "dinosaur" in the violin world feels like music based on the music by Bach and Paganini in romantic-expressionistic language. Each sonata has its own name and program like "Ballade",  "Les Furies", "Obsession", "L´Aurore", "Danse Rustique" etc. These sonatas are a combination of traditional musical elements and E.Ysaÿe´s innovative use of the material seen from the perspective of the 1920s.  Modal scales sometimes suggest religious atmosphere. There are certain articulations or dissonant energies which might remind you of “fencing with the violin bow”. E. Ysaÿe integrates motifs from the "Dies Irae" and used quadruple chords implying a violin sounds multi-dimensional like an organ. 

No. 1 is the longest including a fugato, No. 2 is well-known because of its reminiscence to J.S. Bach´s Preludio from the E-Major Partita, No. 3 “Ballade” the most famous and often played one, No. 4. is very declamatoric and joyful, the two most virtuoso, bright and lucid sonatas are No. 5 and No. 6.

I started studying these pieces at age 17, have been continuously working on them for many years and dedicated a lot of love and enthusiasm to the interpretation of these beautiful pieces I´ve played many times in concert. I am excited being the first female German violinist releasing this tremendous milestone in autumn 2016 with the goal of searching an interpretation based on the latest edition by Henle, München, 2016. Analytical studies of his music, studies of E. Ysaÿe´s life with a whiff of my own creative access to his music lead me to this interpretation. I have even visited Knokke on the Belgian coast a few years ago to see where E. Ysaÿe composed these sonatas between 1923-1924 - each one dedicated to a famous violinist he was friend with.

               

E. Ysaÿe as young man and years later photographed by Queen Elisabeth from Belgium   (photos: internet)


Autograph from E. Ysaÿe´s "Finale", Sonata Op 27/4, dedicated to US-Austrian violinist Fritz Kreisler (1875-1962) (Juilliard School library, N.Y.)

E. Ysaÿe played violins by Guarneri del Gesù violin and Stradivarius. He preferred the Guarneri. Generously supported by Florian Leonhard Fine violins London I recorded the sonatas with the Ex-David/ Midori Guarneri del Gesù. With this famous instrument I can create sweet, voluminous, dark timbre sounds, it actually allows me to play the violin in another dimension of expressive possibilities. Ferdinand David was a friend of Felix Mendelssohn-Bartholdy which gives the instrument a specific aura. This violin is like a holy vulcano for me. I´m always super excited flying occasionally to London, picking up this instrument, playing it for some concerts or recordings and bringing it back after some days.  

As little extra I wrote poems about each sonata for the CD booklet. The Six solo sonatas are for the 85th year of death of Eugène Ysaÿe, 2016.


I´m recording the Atlantic where Ysaÿe wrote his violin solo sonatas. 

photo: Benjamin Kemminer


"Sojuchameleon for violin solo & field recordings" (2014-16) is an homage to an incredible animal: The chameleon. It has an enormous visual perception, is very sensitive, has a colour-changing skin but - has quite bad ears. Its eye is so sharp that it can read from a distance of one kilometer. The smallest chameleon is only some millimeters long, the biggest around 70 cm and there exist over 200 species. Several chameleons appear in my music like the elephant chameleon, the giant chameleon, the Indian chameleon etc. In African mythology chameleons were put on the heads of ill persons in order to heal or were the "Hermes" of the divines.

The other part of my piece’s title, "Soju", refers to a Korean wine based on rice and is a metaphor for humans´ need to escape into another, better world.

My piece is based on different scales from Europe, Middle East and Asia and includes jazz with virtuoso, demanding aspects for the violinist. My intention was to create a satire about global noise pollution and abuse of alcohol. Humans in many countries on different levels of intensity are disorientated in a globalized world cutting down more and more cultural codes because of egoistic goals and unreflected use of electronically devices, weapons and manipulative mechanisms within this world we humans are no more aware at all. The effect: Living beings become sick. 


The "pure" violin part of my piece "Sojuchameleon", later I added field recordings

serious consequences through abuse of alcohol                                

 photos: private

For this piece I recorded the sea, cities, animals, journeys on the train, daily life and created a "sound map" starting in nature and getting more and more absorbed from sounds, noises, finally nearly collapsing - but: there´s always hope and my music ends positive with a portion of humor. 

If you transfer this piece into the media water - you might get an impression how animals in the oceans suffer from human manipulation. We can easily close our eyes, especially in a world dominated by optical sensations, forgetting the unseen rest of the world: The world of sound, noise, smell, taste and touch. This should be an alarm signal to us and we should ask for more conscious and respectful behavior - also towards animals on this globe. „Sojuchameleon“ is an homage to 100 years Dada Zürich, 2016.


Recording insects during the night


Unknown intensity (in decibel) of several low frequent generators

photos: private

In summary, the program of this CD is contrasting, a musical- socio-cultural dialogue with E. Ysaÿe´s masterworks. I recorded this album in July, am finishing the booklet work these days and am very glad about the result so far.


How you support my CD:

Financial support of this campaign is for the 

* production process 

   (sound engineering, edit, travel, accommodation, food, assistants)

* hall service fees

*  travel/accommodation costs for picking up the violin from Seoul - 

    London - Munich 

* travel to Henle edition in Munich

* SC cards, software updates, batteries

* film 

* foto shootings in Korea and Europe 

*  bow hair

* copy costs

* Label fees (200 additional CDs for reduced price, booklet print in colour)


A part of your donations through this Indieggo campaign is for…

5% of all donations will be given to "ocean care.com" an organization committed to protecting the worlds oceans since 2011 as UN special consultant 

film about noise pollution in the oceans

https://www.oceancare.org

5% of all donations will be given to "Lebensdurst-ich e.V.", an organization in Cologne supporting young persons ill from cancer

http://www.lebensdurst-ich.de


Depending on the financial donation you are able and willing to contribute you will receive gifts like beautifully calligraphic hand made paper letters from South Korea, a signed CD, free concert tickets, skype lessons, the top supporters receive music produced by myself or compositions and will be mentioned in the CD booklet. Check it out! Be part of my next CD!

I am very exciting to have you on board!


CDs before...

My last two CDs - published in 2015 - "Ja(zz)smine Rice - Violin Mysteries"    (Solo Musica, Munich) and "Wild Bird", music for violin & harp, Duo  47/4 with Anna Viechtl (Oehms Classics, Munich) received international acclaim from the American Record guide "recording of the year", "exquisite", The Strad "A violinist with a questing mind (…) beautiful…(…) fearless plaiying, bell-like tone", Neue Musikzeitung "Stunning!" e.g. „Ja(zz)smine Rice" was sponsored by Korean Airline T´Way as main sponsor, "Wild Bird" from an anonymous sponsor.

I loved these recording sessions, their intensity, the music, also anecdotes like interrupting the recording process because of birds´ singing in the garden next to the church, garden work, helicopters a.s.o 


My GOAL

After intense studies with E. Ysaÿe´s solo sonatas as well as hundreds of fascinating, shocking and also witty hours searching musical colours for „Sojuchameleon“ I hope you will enjoy this music - another recording of great quality.

I also want to alert society about the importance of nature and particularly oceans.

The CD will be released with Haenssler Classic, a world renowned German independent label for classical music featuring top artists like Frank P. Zimmermann, David Geringas, Dietrich Fischer-Dieskau a.o.

www.haenssler-classic.de


In my upcoming concerts I will perform parts of this CD and would be happy to say hello to you after concert!

Be sure: New projects will follow!!


THANKS TO

I am very grateful to Florian Leonhard Fine Violins London who punctually gave me this fantastic violin the last three years for special concerts or recordings. Many thanks to Pirastro providing best strings. Thanks to Walderbach Monastery providing a Zen-like atmosphere. Thanks to Heiko Müller/ Studio Wustrack, Seonghak Chang and Keunyoung Song from Yulhaus and all my friends participating in my piece. Special thanks to famous moderator and entertainer Harald Schmidt who speaks the pointe in my piece. Merci to top jeweler Stephen Webster London to allow me patch working his enthusiastic voice in my piece. Editorial thanks to Dr. Seiffert and Dr. Gertsch from Henle Verlag München, Jane Gottlieb from the Juilliard School library in N.Y. and Dr. Ray Iwazumi, N.Y., for our E. Ysaÿe - correspondence. Thanks to wonderful Lily and Klaus Heiliger - always open to organize concerts in their beautiful house. Many thanks to Num Stibbe and Ornan Rotem from Sylph Editions London for many inspiring discussions and musical performances around their wonderful book launches. Gamsahamnida to Twin Dana from De Food Lab for fresh plant based gourmet that makes bodies thrive. Thanks to sound engineer Eckhard Glauche (BR Munich), Felix Bruhns, Joachim Trettin, Louis Vignat and Joepanic for great film and photo sessions. Thousand thanks to my family, Mario K., Juliane R., Robert G. and Benjamin K. And a special "Toda" for Israel born elephant Victor from Berlin´s Zoological Garden, having presented a fantastic c - si flat for one of my many field recordings.

www.florianleonhard.com 

www.pirastro.com

www.stephenwebster.com

http://www.liebenzeller-metall-kolophonium.de

http://www.fxfilm.de

http://www.joachimtrettin.de

www.louisvignat.com

https://studio-wustrack.de

Additional/ other support

You can give me a like on Facebook, on Youtube or tell your friends about my work which Indiegogo supports a lot through this campaign.


Thank you all and warm regards,

Viktoria

The Ex-David/Midori Guarneri del Gesù violin and an acrobatic new piece
photo: Louis Vignat

I spent my childhood in the Bavarian Forest, a geological  laboratory, very idyllic. During high-school  I studied with a Russian music and violin professor, a walking encyclopedia. I also liked subjects like maths, natural sciences, sports, languages, singing, the fine arts, dance. As a person I have synesthetical perception which means combination of auditive & visual phenomena at the same time and also have perfect pitch. 
Throughout my life I have been fascinated by the violin as "the most perfect thing made by humans - even beating the computer" - a beautiful small, light instrument from wood, a hobby or passion - you do not need any plug ins for ;-).
Music is my "(love) letter" to this world. In order to focus on practice or composition I need the power of silence and calmness as source of creativity. Descartes said: Movement in calmness and calmness in movement. A principle from the baroque time which Johann S. Bach was inspired by. 
After having played many concerts in Europe, the US, South America, Middle East and Asia, and having taught many students from all over the world I have released two CDs in 2015 with a wide range of musical styles for violin and own compositions. 
The following recording will be the continuation of the albums before which means classical music in dialogue with my own musical research as a composer. Enjoy!
More about the music on my third CD
The Six sonatas for violin solo Op 27 by Belgian composer, violinist, pedagogue and conductor, Eugène Auguste Ysaÿe (1858-1931), a real "dinosaur" in the violin world feels like music based on the music by Bach and Paganini in romantic-expressionistic language. Each sonata has its own name and program like "Ballade",  "Les Furies", "Obsession", "L´Aurore", "Danse Rustique" etc. These sonatas are a combination of traditional musical elements and E.Ysaÿe´s innovative use of the material seen from the perspective of the 1920s.  Modal scales sometimes suggest religious atmosphere. There are certain articulations or dissonant energies which might remind you of “fencing with the violin bow”. E. Ysaÿe integrates motifs from the "Dies Irae" and used quadruple chords implying a violin sounds multi-dimensional like an organ. No. 1 is the longest including a fugato, No. 2 is well-known because of its reminiscence to J.S. Bach´s Preludio from the E-Major Partita, No. 3 “Ballade” the most famous and often played one, No. 4. is very declamatoric and joyful, the two most virtuoso, bright and lucid sonatas are No. 5 and No. 6.
I started studying these pieces at age 17, have been continuously working on them for many years and dedicated a lot of love and enthusiasm to the interpretation of these beautiful pieces I´ve played many times in concert. I am excited being the first female German violinist releasing this tremendous milestone in autumn 2016 with the goal of searching an interpretation based on the latest edition by Henle, München, 2016. Analytical studies of his music, studies of E. Ysaÿe´s life with a whiff of my own creative access to his music lead me to this interpretation. I have even visited Knokke on the Belgian coast a few years ago to see where E. Ysaÿe composed these sonatas between 1923-1924 - each one dedicated to a famous violinist he was friend with.
               
E. Ysaÿe as young man and years later photographed by Queen Elisabeth from Belgium   (photos: internet)Autograph from E. Ysaÿe´s "Finale", Sonata Op 27/4, dedicated to US-Austrian violinist Fritz Kreisler (1875-1962) (Juilliard School library, N.Y.)
E. Ysaÿe played violins by Guarneri del Gesù violin and Stradivarius. He preferred the Guarneri. Generously supported by Florian Leonhard Fine violins London I recorded the sonatas with the Ex-David/ Midori Guarneri del Gesù. With this famous instrument I can create sweet, voluminous, dark timbre sounds, it actually allows me to play the violin in another dimension of expressive possibilities. Ferdinand David was a friend of Felix Mendelssohn-Bartholdy which gives the instrument a specific aura. This violin is like a holy vulcano for me. I´m always super excited flying occasionally to London, picking up this instrument, playing it for some concerts or recordings and bringing it back after some days.  
As little extra I wrote poems about each sonata for the CD booklet. The Six solo sonatas are for the 85th year of death of Eugène Ysaÿe, 2016.

I´m recording the Atlantic where Ysaÿe wrote his violin solo sonatas. photo: Benjamin Kemminer
"Sojuchameleon for violin solo & field recordings" (2014-16) is an homage to an incredible animal: The chameleon. It has an enormous visual perception, is very sensitive, has a colour-changing skin but - has quite bad ears. Its eye is so sharp that it can read from a distance of one kilometer. The smallest chameleon is only some millimeters long, the biggest around 70 cm and there exist over 200 species. Several chameleons appear in my music like the elephant chameleon, the giant chameleon, the Indian chameleon etc. In African mythology chameleons were put on the heads of ill persons in order to heal or were the "Hermes" of the divines.
The other part of my piece’s title, "Soju", refers to a Korean wine based on rice and is a metaphor for humans´ need to escape into another, better world.
My piece is based on different scales from Europe, Middle East and Asia and includes jazz with virtuoso, demanding aspects for the violinist. My intention was to create a satire about global noise pollution and abuse of alcohol. Humans in many countries on different levels of intensity are disorientated in a globalized world cutting down more and more cultural codes because of egoistic goals and unreflected use of electronically devices, weapons and manipulative mechanisms within this world we humans are no more aware at all. The effect: Living beings become sick. The "pure" violin part of my piece "Sojuchameleon", later I added field recordings
serious consequences through abuse of alcohol                                 photos: privateFor this piece I recorded the sea, cities, animals, journeys on the train, daily life and created a "sound map" starting in nature and getting more and more absorbed from sounds, noises, finally nearly collapsing - but: there´s always hope and my music ends positive with a portion of humor. 
If you transfer this piece into the media water - you might get an impression how animals in the oceans suffer from human manipulation. We can easily close our eyes, especially in a world dominated by optical sensations, forgetting the unseen rest of the world: The world of sound, noise, smell, taste and touch. This should be an alarm signal to us and we should ask for more conscious and respectful behavior - also towards animals on this globe. „Sojuchameleon“ is an homage to 100 years Dada Zürich, 2016.
Recording insects during the nightUnknown intensity (in decibel) of several low frequent generatorsphotos: privateIn summary, the program of this CD is contrasting, a musical- socio-cultural dialogue with E. Ysaÿe´s masterworks. I recorded this album in July, am finishing the booklet work these days and am very glad about the result so far.
How you support my CD:
Financial support of this campaign is for the 
* production process 
   (sound engineering, edit, travel, accommodation, food, assistants)
* hall service fees
*  travel/accommodation costs for picking up the violin from Seoul - 
    London - Munich 
* travel to Henle edition in Munich* SC cards, software updates, batteries* film 
* foto shootings in Korea and Europe *  bow hair
* copy costs* Label fees (200 additional CDs for reduced price, booklet print in colour)
A part of your donations through this Indieggo campaign is for…
5% of all donations will be given to "ocean care.com" an organization committed to protecting the worlds oceans since 2011 as UN special consultant 
film about noise pollution in the oceanshttps://www.oceancare.org
5% of all donations will be given to "Lebensdurst-ich e.V.", an organization in Cologne supporting young persons ill from cancer
http://www.lebensdurst-ich.de
Depending on the financial donation you are able and willing to contribute you will receive gifts like beautifully calligraphic hand made paper letters from South Korea, a signed CD, free concert tickets, skype lessons, the top supporters receive music produced by myself or compositions and will be mentioned in the CD booklet. Check it out! Be part of my next CD!
I am very exciting to have you on board!
CDs before...
My last two CDs - published in 2015 - "Ja(zz)smine Rice - Violin Mysteries"    (Solo Musica, Munich) and "Wild Bird", music for violin & harp, Duo  47/4 with Anna Viechtl (Oehms Classics, Munich) received international acclaim from the American Record guide "recording of the year", "exquisite", The Strad "A violinist with a questing mind (…) beautiful…(…) fearless plaiying, bell-like tone", Neue Musikzeitung "Stunning!" e.g. „Ja(zz)smine Rice" was sponsored by Korean Airline T´Way as main sponsor, "Wild Bird" from an anonymous sponsor.
I loved these recording sessions, their intensity, the music, also anecdotes like interrupting the recording process because of birds´ singing in the garden next to the church, garden work, helicopters a.s.o 
My GOAL
After intense studies with E. Ysaÿe´s solo sonatas as well as hundreds of fascinating, shocking and also witty hours searching musical colours for „Sojuchameleon“ I hope you will enjoy this music - another recording of great quality.
I also want to alert society about the importance of nature and particularly oceans.
The CD will be released with Haenssler Classic, a world renowned German independent label for classical music featuring top artists like Frank P. Zimmermann, David Geringas, Dietrich Fischer-Dieskau a.o.
www.haenssler-classic.de
In my upcoming concerts I will perform parts of this CD and would be happy to say hello to you after concert!Be sure: New projects will follow!!
THANKS TO
I am very grateful to Florian Leonhard Fine Violins London who punctually gave me this fantastic violin the last three years for special concerts or recordings. Many thanks to Pirastro providing best strings. Thanks to Walderbach Monastery providing a Zen-like atmosphere. Thanks to Heiko Müller/ Studio Wustrack, Seonghak Chang and Keunyoung Song from Yulhaus and all my friends participating in my piece. Special thanks to famous moderator and entertainer Harald Schmidt who speaks the pointe in my piece. Merci to top jeweler Stephen Webster London to allow me patch working his enthusiastic voice in my piece. Editorial thanks to Dr. Seiffert and Dr. Gertsch from Henle Verlag München, Jane Gottlieb from the Juilliard School library in N.Y. and Dr. Ray Iwazumi, N.Y., for our E. Ysaÿe - correspondence. Thanks to wonderful Lily and Klaus Heiliger - always open to organize concerts in their beautiful house. Many thanks to Num Stibbe and Ornan Rotem from Sylph Editions London for many inspiring discussions and musical performances around their wonderful book launches. Gamsahamnida to Twin Dana from De Food Lab for fresh plant based gourmet that makes bodies thrive. Thanks to sound engineer Eckhard Glauche (BR Munich), Felix Bruhns, Joachim Trettin, Louis Vignat and Joepanic for great film and photo sessions. Thousand thanks to my family, Mario K., Juliane R., Robert G. and Benjamin K. And a special "Toda" for Israel born elephant Victor from Berlin´s Zoological Garden, having presented a fantastic c - si flat for one of my many field recordings.





www.florianleonhard.com 
www.pirastro.com
www.stephenwebster.com

http://www.liebenzeller-metall-kolophonium.de

http://www.fxfilm.de
http://www.joachimtrettin.de
www.louisvignat.com

https://studio-wustrack.de





Additional/ other support

You can give
me a like on Facebook, on Youtube or tell your
friends about my work which Indiegogo supports a lot through this campaign.

Thank you all and warm regards,
Viktoria

The Ex-David/Midori Guarneri del Gesù violin and an acrobatic new piece

photo: Louis Vignat

story:
What is happening:

  • "The Coldest Sun" is a two year music production from the Portuguese/Russian female fronted metal band "The Autist" and it features Polina Psycheya (All I Could Bleed), Alina Lesnik (Once, Vivaldi Metal Project) and Chiara Tricarico (Temperance). The Coldest Sun is a symphonic metal album for fans of truly melancholic, tragic and  conceptual music that was inspired by deep emotions we all go through on our lives. Hence and since this is so important to all of us - because we're really eager on to make it -, we are asking for all the contribution possible to make this album happen and - most importantly - reward all the people that decided to be a part of this accordingly with awesome loot. 

  • We can't really wait to show you how massive "THE COLDEST SUN" is sounding. So, after the completion of the production phase we're really excited to move towards the next stage and this is where WE WILL NEED YOU THE MOST, since as a band giving its first babies steps on a world full of struggles The Autist wouldn't be a thing WITHOUT YOU. We really want to make this album get to your hands because when we're composing music, the public is such an important factor and - contrary to belief -, we really think that people matter and influence the vibe of our creations in every single song. We think that without the people to perceive it, art would be meaningless and that's why we want to make this so badly reach the hands of our friends and fans.

What we're offering you and how can you help.

  • We're bringing you some really awesome prizes with beautiful artwork such as CDs, T-shirts, Pins, Posters and only for the most curious of all, we'd like to offer a very very special/limited "Pandora's box" edition with some really interesting surprises inside where you'll able to know and explore the unlimited world of fantasies The Autist can provide. 
     
  • ​The Autist is gently asking to raise 2500 euros to pay for the expensive manufacture of the merchandise costs for this merch to reach you. We all know that artists these days aren't really worth anything without their friends and fans backing up the music they like. ​


Let's do this.

How are you affecting The Autist's course by contributing:

  • I believe that being a professional musician is just as important as being a doctor on a society that thrives on cultural enrichment. We're not surviving anymore - we're experiencing life. Artists are the soul plastics that mould the very fabrique of human mind and allows people to explore their feelings by increasing the awereness of what surrounds us - the universe we live. Yet, due to a very poor commercial structure a lot of artists - specially the ones beginning - have to walk a very hard mile to get to people and sometimes it's very hard for them to make a living out of it. Sometimes the art they make doesn't pay bills and isn't buying them any food.
     
  •  We spent a lot of money on the overall production of The Coldest Sun by creating music, videos and artwork to make sure you'd understand our message in the most clear way possible. But we'd like to do more and better in the future - certainly better. We'd like to create a world where no detail is off and only with you, this will be possible. And this my friends, is why contributing to this cause is really that important for us; because we want to keep dedicating ourselves to music and achieve the possibility of being professional artists is without a single doubt our main focus.
     
  • ​Contributing to this cause is paving the way to a road of success where you can't really survive without the help of the listeners because music is created to you. Contributing is letting us expressing ourselves and being overwhelemmed by the wonderful reactions people display when they listen to music we create. We feel truly humbled by this sensation. We are fighting to keep writing honest music and bring you the best and the better we can.​

The struggle is real... but we're overcoming it.

  • We understand this crowdfund to be ambitious but when we started producing this album one year ago we decided to make it right - to make it great with very talented people. We decided that it would be possible to bring the best to the people and yet receive this best people can offer too. We're facing the challange and tackling it as part of a course that might be just a beginning of something greater. Birth is painful, but it opens doors to wonderful things. 

Other things you can do to help us...

  • Any help will be trully appreciated and we promise your efforts to get this band working won't be taken lightly. We really value people that understand the importance of bringing our music to the spotlight. So, share our music and get this crowdfunding to as many people as possible...


​

We can't really wait to show you how massive "THE COLDEST SUN" is sounding. So, after the completion of the production phase we're really excited to move towards the next stage and this is where WE WILL NEED YOU THE MOST, since as a band giving its first babies steps on a world full of struggles The Autist wouldn't be a thing WITHOUT YOU. We really want to make this album get to your hands because when we're composing music, the public is such an important factor and - contrary to belief -, we really think that people matter and influence the vibe of our creations in every single song. We think that without the people to perceive it, art would be meaningless and that's why we want to make this so badly reach the hands of our friends and fans.

​The Autist is gently asking to raise 2500 euros to pay for the expensive manufacture of the merchandise costs for this merch to reach you. We all know that artists these days aren't really worth anything without their friends and fans backing up the music they like. ​

Let's do this.

How are you affecting The Autist's course by contributing:

I believe that being a professional musician is just as important as being a doctor on a society that thrives on cultural enrichment. We're not surviving anymore - we're experiencing life. Artists are the soul plastics that mould the very fabrique of human mind and allows people to explore their feelings by increasing the awereness of what surrounds us - the universe we live. Yet, due to a very poor commercial structure a lot of artists - specially the ones beginning - have to walk a very hard mile to get to people and sometimes it's very hard for them to make a living out of it. Sometimes the art they make doesn't pay bills and isn't buying them any food. 
 We spent a lot of money on the overall production of The Coldest Sun by creating music, videos and artwork to make sure you'd understand our message in the most clear way possible. But we'd like to do more and better in the future - certainly better. We'd like to create a world where no detail is off and only with you, this will be possible. And this my friends, is why contributing to this cause is really that important for us; because we want to keep dedicating ourselves to music and achieve the possibility of being professional artists is without a single doubt our main focus. 
​Contributing to this cause is paving the way to a road of success where you can't really survive without the help of the listeners because music is created to you. Contributing is letting us expressing ourselves and being overwhelemmed by the wonderful reactions people display when they listen to music we create. We feel truly humbled by this sensation. We are fighting to keep writing honest music and bring you the best and the better we can.​


The struggle is real... but we're overcoming it.
We understand this crowdfund to be ambitious but when we started producing this album one year ago we decided to make it right - to make it great with very talented people. We decided that it would be possible to bring the best to the people and yet receive this best people can offer too. We're facing the challange and tackling it as part of a course that might be just a beginning of something greater. Birth is painful, but it opens doors to wonderful things. 

Other things you can do to help us...
Any help will be trully appreciated and we promise your efforts to get this band working won't be taken lightly. We really value people that understand the importance of bringing our music to the spotlight. So, share our music and get this crowdfunding to as many people as possible...
​

story:
Short Summary

This is the 2nd Annual Railroad Square Music Festival - a free festival in the heart of Santa Rosa, CA. This is an event for the community - by the community. The mission of the Railroad Square Music Festival is to expand our local music community by bringing more music to new people, to encourage our local performers to shoot for the stars, and to show that the North Bay is a vibrant cultural and artistic hub.

What We Need & What You Get

This is a free festival and an epic undertaking with tons of hours of volunteer work. The festival is not for profit and runs entirely on sponsorship and donations!

For your contribution we have a range of exciting swag and at our top tiers: tickets to the official RSMF after party, exclusive access to the VIP area and SOMO Concerts tickets! 

The Impact

Festival director Josh Windmiller has brought music to Railroad Square for the past seven years with events such as The Handcar Regatta, Wunderkammer, This Train, and the first Railroad Square Music Festival, which brought 4,000 people to the square in 2015.

We need donations to make this festival run - for free, forever. We want the entire community to feel that they are participating in, creating and taking ownership of this festival.

Risks & Challenges

We face the challenge of not meeting our bottom line. If we are not able to break even on the festival we won't be able to sustain the fun into the future! Our success is paramount this year as in the coming years a train will again run through Railroad Square! We only imagine the festival growing in size in years to come! 

The smallest donation could make the difference in the success of this year’s festival - that’s why we’ve created several levels of rewards. Please invest what you can in the future of Sonoma County art!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you’re unable to donate you can help us by getting the word out to as many people as possible! Like our page on Facebook and share the event to your friends! You can also follow and tag us on Twitter and Instagram. We hope you’ll join us starting at 9:30am Sunday, June 5th in downtown Santa Rosa! You can find out more by visiting our website railroadsquaremusicfestival.com

story:
About the Project

We started Here Together with a goal that even though there are two of us, that many more would feel a part of what we are doing. We want to write songs that let others know that no matter the situation, someone else has been there and they are not alone. It's okay to struggle, and it's okay to doubt.

When this campaign is successful it will greatly affect how we are able to present the songs we have written, get them out for people to hear and be impacted by the music and message.

The Goal and Impact

We have set a BIG goal of $7,000! That will accomplish all of this:

  • Recording and mixing at Gnome Studios in Nashville, TN
  • Professional mastering for the album
  • Physical production of CDs and packaging
  • Digital distribution to iTunes and other outlets

The Rewards

We are offering lots of cool rewards for your contribution!

  • Autographed albums & Digital downloads
  • Specialty coffee & custom HT mugs
  • Super comfy tee shirts
  • Your own personal song written by us
  • Music lessons
  • Acoustic & full band performances
  • AND MORE

Other Ways You Can Help

Aside from contributing, sharing this campaign on social media is a HUGE help. The more people that see this the more likely we are to hit our goal. Thank you for your efforts!

story:
Hi! I’m Vic Sadot! I have some timely topical songs that I want to pitch to you. Maybe one of them will move you to action! I’ve been recording some new music projects for the last 3 years with a talented sidekick named Eric Golub. See the Cynthia McKinney and Eric Golub testimonials after my presentation. I don’t think I could release these studio cuts as soon possible without requesting participation in this “Truth Troubadour” CD Project!

Here are some song highlights!

FULL SPECTRUM DOMINANCE – Maybe you don’t want to live in a post 9/11 surveillance state where you have no Bill of Rights; where the Empire destroys your Republic. If so, help me get a good studio quality mixdown of “Full Spectrum Dominance” out there! I used the raw track to put out a music video already. My brother Rob Sadot provides some electric guitar underwriting of the somber mood of the song. You can watch it here.

NO NUKE BLUES FUKUSHIMA UPDATE – If you an Anti-Nuke activist, then you know damn well that these nuke plants are un unacceptable risk! You may want to help me get my new “No Nuke Blues – Fukushima Update” released on CD! Getting alternative radio airplay!

AN ACT OF STATE: THE EXECUTION OF MARTIN LUTHER KING – I wrote this one after reading William Pepper’s book by the same title. The purpose of this song was to make people of what was in the book about the King Family’s 1999 trial victory in Memphis, TN, the same town where MLK was gunned down in 1968. The song highlights just a few of the startling discoveries that came out in that trial. After hearing this song, you may be someone who thinks it is important that this song about Martin Luther King reaches a wider audience. It was a delight to get a thank you from William Pepper. It’s posted by the music video link!

From William Pepper to Vic Sadot: “Thanks so much for the effort you and others are making in the common struggle to air the truth about how this Republic, and each one of us, lost Martin. Thank you for taking the time to put some important history into a ballad. This, of course, is the role of the Balladeer without whom much of history would be lost, especially in our time with the consolidation of control of the mainstream media. I am grateful. Bill Pepper”

THE HARBOR OF LOVE - Maybe it’s this love song that you’d like to know you helped get into the distribution mix! This new Berkeley, CA recording is just me on vocals and acoustic guitar… with my buddy Eric Golub on viola and ukulele. It can put you in the mood!

MASTERS OF WAR is one of them! It’s a little shorter and less morose than Bob Dylan’s original one… But it has the same meaning and urgency today! You can hear the raw mix version of Masters of War at Eric Golub SoundCloud!

We also have a version of John Lennon’s WORKING CLASS HERO that could fit on this CD! We did some Phil Ochs songs and are likely to pick one! I met and interviewed Phil Ochs in 1973. In 2015 I made a video from that audio that you can watch on YouTube: "Phil Ochs May 1973 Interview by Vic Sadot & Rich Lang" (30:10).

I have a good track record of finishing these projects I set out to do. See the cover art  from past Vic Sadot music project releases that we are able to use for T-shirt premiums now. See these images in the video or at my Crazy Planet  Band T-Shirt Shop at Café Press link at the bottom.

To complete this CD we need to: (1) buy studio time for mix down and mastering work; (2) purchase some license rights for a few cover songs; and (3) we have to pay DiscMakers and CD Baby to get my product factory pressed and “professionally packaged”!

We’ll create some premium incentives. But the main things you get from backing this project would be this Limited Edition run CD, and the good feeling of getting some thought provoking songs out there! We’ll create perks as the formula at IndieGoGo calls for… Note: The T-shirt perks are a little expensive for us to make since they are unique custom T-shirts with the cover art from past Vic Sadot CD, LP, and 45 single releases. Good gifts for those who have all the necessary stuff already! The on-line store for these items is already set up as Vic Sadot Crazy Planet T-Shirt Shop at Café Press. I show them in this video.

This IndieGoGo Fundraising Drive for a Vic Sadot CD to be titled “Truth Troubadour” is being launched on May 28 to run to July 6. We will scale our product to what we can afford. A1000 copy run seems reasonable. 100 is the minimum. More can always be ordered if needed.

There would need to be a CD release party concert for our supporters! Hope to see you there! I hope to have this new  "Truth Troubadour" CD out by my birthday, July 21! Vic Sadot

The Official Vic Sadot Music Site is www.vicsadot.com

Premiums can be seen or purchased at VIC SADOT CRAZY PLANET BAND T-SHIRT SHOP - All Vic Sadot album covers ever released are now available on T-shirts and mugs at Vic Sadot Crazy Planet T-Shirt Shop at Café Press: "Good Time Delaware" 1985 45 rpm single; "Ride the Wind" 1988 LP; "Comin' Home" Planete Folle 1997 CD; “Broadsides & Retrospectives” 2005 LP; and "9/11 Truth & Justice Songs" , the 10th Anniversary CD released on 9/11/11 with 16 songs. http://www.cafepress.com/vicsadot

Cynthia McKinney on her west coast book tour stop at The Arlene Francis Center for Spirit, Art, and Politics in Santa Rosa, CA on April 25, 2013. She had two new books out on Clarity Press, “Ain’t Nothing Like Freedom” and “The Illegal War on Libya”. Cynthia invited Vic Sadot (left) and Eric Golub (right) to perform Vic’s song about the US military intervention in Haiti in 2004 to overthrow elected President Jean-Bertrand Aristide of the Lavalas Party. (Screenshot from the video by Elaine Holtz and James Curtis/Post production by Susan Livingston)

Testimonials by Cynthia McKinney & Eric Golub

Cynthia McKinney, the 2008 Green Party Presidential candidate, six term Democratic Congresswoman for the state of Georgia, and founder of DIGNITY ACTION NETWORK, had this to say about Vic Sadot songs:

"Vic Sadot's music produces in me a wide range of reactions from awe to action to tears. Cheney's in the Bunker produces awe because every line of that song is power-packed with information that most people don't know because it was omitted from the 9/11 Commission's report. Ballad of William Rodriguez and Ballad of Pat Tillman give you so much information and make you want to act to find the truth about 9/11 and reach out to Pat Tillman's parents for their tremendous loss and the Pentagon's lies to them about it. Finally, The Kidnapping Coup, about the U.S.-inspired kidnapping of Haiti's President, Jean Bertrand Aristide, brings me to tears. On song after song, Sadot tells us too much of the sad, sad truth. Not only have I found in Vic a new friend who understands my passion for what is right, I've found someone who knows how to artistically communicate the critical issues of our day."

Statement by Eric Golub on Vic Sadot at Linked In

"Vic Sadot is that rarest of singer-songwriters, combining fearlessness and a zeal for truth with warmth and wit. He combines the classic traits of both the troubadour and the activist, shining a light on difficult or controversial subjects in an accessible and engaging manner in his songs. Whether with his guitar and accordion, or with his voice and pen, Vic's unpretentious style disarms the listener, so that their conscious awareness is raised effortlessly while they're being entertained and encouraged.

It's been a pleasure to work with Vic on many of his recordings over the last several years, and I've found him to be an artist of both integrity and unselfishness, always welcoming to others' input in his projects."
story_txt:
Hi! I’m Vic Sadot! I have some timely topical songs that I 
want to pitch to you. Maybe one of them will move you to action! I’ve 
been recording some new music projects for the last 3 years with a 
talented sidekick named Eric Golub. See the Cynthia McKinney and Eric Golub testimonials after my presentation. I don’t think I could release these studio cuts as soon possible without requesting participation in this “Truth Troubadour” CD Project!Here are some song highlights!FULL SPECTRUM DOMINANCE
 – Maybe you don’t want to live in a post 9/11 surveillance state where 
you have no Bill of Rights; where the Empire destroys your Republic. If 
so, help me get a good studio quality mixdown of “Full Spectrum 
Dominance” out there! I used the raw track to put 
out a music video already. My brother Rob Sadot provides some electric guitar underwriting of the somber mood of the song. You can watch it here.NO NUKE BLUES FUKUSHIMA UPDATE
 – If you an Anti-Nuke activist, then you know damn well that these nuke
 plants are un unacceptable risk! You may want to help me get my new “No
 Nuke Blues – Fukushima Update” released on CD! Getting alternative 
radio airplay!AN ACT OF STATE: THE EXECUTION OF MARTIN LUTHER KING – I wrote this one after reading William Pepper’s book by the same title. The purpose of this song was to make people of what was in the book about the King Family’s 1999 trial victory in Memphis, TN, the same town where MLK was gunned down in 1968. The song highlights just a few of the startling discoveries that came out in that trial. After hearing this song, you may be someone who thinks it is important that this song about Martin Luther King reaches a wider audience. It was a delight to get a thank you from William Pepper. It’s posted by the music video link!From William Pepper to Vic Sadot: “Thanks so
much for the effort you and others are making in the common struggle to air the
truth about how this Republic, and each one of us, lost Martin. Thank you for
taking the time to put some important history into a ballad. This, of course,
is the role of the Balladeer without whom much of history would be lost,
especially in our time with the consolidation of control of the mainstream
media. I am grateful. Bill Pepper”THE HARBOR OF LOVE - Maybe it’s this love song that you’d like to know you helped get into the distribution mix! This new Berkeley, CA recording is just me on vocals and acoustic guitar… with my buddy Eric Golub on viola and ukulele. It can put you in the mood! MASTERS OF WAR is one of them! It’s a little shorter and less morose than Bob Dylan’s original one… But it has the same meaning and urgency today! You can hear the raw mix version of Masters of War at Eric Golub SoundCloud! We also have a version of John Lennon’s WORKING CLASS HERO that could fit on this CD! We did some Phil Ochs songs and are likely to pick one! I met and interviewed Phil Ochs in 1973. In 2015 I made a video from that audio that you can watch on YouTube: "Phil Ochs May 1973 Interview by Vic Sadot & Rich Lang" (30:10).  I have a good track record of finishing these projects I set out to do. See the cover art  from past Vic Sadot music project releases that we are able to use for T-shirt premiums now. See these images in the video or at my Crazy Planet  Band T-Shirt Shop at Café Press link at the bottom.To complete this CD we need to: (1) buy studio time for mix down and mastering work; (2) purchase some license rights for a few cover songs; and (3) we have to pay DiscMakers and CD Baby to get my product factory pressed and “professionally packaged”! We’ll create some premium incentives. But the main things you get from backing this project would be this Limited Edition run CD, and the good feeling of getting some thought provoking songs out there! We’ll create perks as the formula at IndieGoGo calls for… Note: The T-shirt perks are a little expensive for us to make since they are unique custom T-shirts with the cover art from past Vic Sadot CD, LP, and 45 single releases. Good gifts for those who have all the necessary stuff already! The on-line store for these items is already set up as Vic Sadot Crazy Planet T-Shirt Shop at Café Press. I show them in this video. This IndieGoGo Fundraising Drive for a Vic Sadot CD to be titled “Truth Troubadour” is being launched on May 28 to run to July 6. We will scale our product to what we can afford. A1000 copy run seems reasonable. 100 is the minimum. More can always be ordered if needed. There would need to be a CD release party concert for our supporters! Hope to see you there! I hope to have this new  "Truth Troubadour" CD out by my birthday, July 21! story:
Gwendolyn's LULLABIES FOR THE HEART  BRINGS YOU ....Magical songs, Mythical songs, Healing songs, Songs to take you into a place of KNOWING you are loved and held in the arms of Angels! 


These Lullabies will touch your Heart and Soothe Your Soul! Listen to them to comfort a crying child, grandchild, friend, or your inner child! Listen to these songs to deeply relax, and drift off to a healing sleep.


Check out this interview where I tell stories & sing some of the Lullabies!! 

http://crowdfundingcast.tk/crowdfunding-cast-episode-298-lullabies-for-the-heart/


Check me out Further Here!

https://twitter.com/VocalSoundHeal

https://www.facebook.com/vocalsoundhealer/

http://www.cdbaby.com/cd/gwendolyn1

http://www.youtube.com/c/GwendolynMcClurePhD

Gwendolyn@vocalsoundhealer.com


GWENDOLYN'S PASSION FOR SINGING & HEALING!!

For those of you who know me, you are already aware that I am extremely passionate about bringing Love to Heal the world through my songs!I am in my 26th year (August 5th begins my 27th year!!) as a Vocal Sound Healing Practitioner, and wrote my Doctoral Dissertation on the use of the Human Voice for Transformation of Consciousness (Pacifica 1998)!!

Your Contribution to Lullabies For the Heart CD  helps bring Gwendolyn's Voice out into the World for Babies, Children, and Adults alike to Listen, Relax, and Heal!


LET'S CO-CREATE LULLABIES FOR THE HEART COMING TO FRUITION!!!

I am Deeply Grateful for your Consideration to Contribute, so that Lullabies For The Heart becomes a reality! Love, Gwendolyn


What We Need & What You Get

  • I am raising $8000. in this campaign. These funds will cover Recording Studio costs such as Recording Engineer Labor, Melody & Harmony Tracks, Instrumentation, Mixing, Editing, Mastering, musician's fees: Costs For Recording Lullaby Cover tunes of Other Artists, such as Bill Staines First Lullaby and Cris Williamson's Like a Ship in the Harbor; Costs For CD Duplication at the Discmakers Warehouse in New Jersey, distribution of the CD's plus many other behind-the-scene production costs.
  • PERKS!!! In addition to simply pre-ordering the cd, I am including a variety of perks in my campaign: Singing Healing Phone Call, Voice Lesson, Vocal Sound Healing Workshop, Vocal Sound Healing Private Sessions, House Concert & Associate Producer, Producer, & Executive Producer.
  • Photo Example of a Private Vocal Sound Touch Healing Session:


The Impact

  • Lullabies bring peace to the Heart. Gwendolyn's Voice of an earth angel Brings Healing, Love & Comfort to the Soul.
  • Lullabies Through the Generations. Most of these Lullabies are passed down from my Mother & Father, Muriel and Richard McClure, who sang to me as a child. From their generation...to future generations....I honor them with this recording. Love you Mom & Dad! Thanks for Singing me to sleep every night!! 
  • Contributing to the Oral Tradition. Hearing & Learning Songs contributes to the Oral Tradition in our modern world. Lullabies connect us with a long lineage of parents soothing  their children through Loving Voice.

The Lullaby Songs!! See Back Cover List below!


OLD & NEW LULLABIES

This CD includes Lullaby Songs which go back as far as 15th Century England: "I Gave My Love a Cherry, and also includes several modern lullabies such as Bill Staines' "First Lullaby," Peter Paul and Mary's "Gone The Rainbow" co-written with Milton Okun, and Cris Williamson's "Like A Ship In the Harbor," just to name a few!! 

ODE TO LUSSAMIER
"Ode to Lussamier" is a song I wrote to honor my Mom's life. This one song names 4 songs within it that my Mom used to sing, my Mom and Dad used to sing together, and us four girls and our Mom and Dad sang as a family!!  

The song covers my Mom's early life growing up in China, to life in New York, and then life in Sedona. Speaking of my Mom's early days growing up in China, my Mom, born Lois Muriel Hubbard (1923), was the daughter of Methodist missionaries in Malaysia and China. When in China where she was born, the cooks could not pronounce Lois Muriel, so they nick-named her "Lussamier," which is what my Dad always called her!! 

One song referenced in "Ode to Lussamier"  is called "Just Like A Gypsy," which was our Mom and Dad's engagement song. 

Another song referenced in "Ode to Lussamier" is Mom's wake up song. If we didn't wake up in time to do our chores on the weekend, she would bring her guitar in to our bedroom and sing us a rousing version of the wake-up song...until we woke up to do our chores!!  

Songs were so many things to our family...motivators, ways to share love and friendship, ways to grieve....ways to heal. 

This is how "Ode to Lussamier" begins:

"Please Let Me Tell You a Story, About a Beautiful Woman I Knew...She was my Best Friend and Mother, and I Loved Her, Loved Her So True....Oh What a Beautiful Mommy...I Think of You Every Day...Oh What a Beautiful Mommy, Please Hold Me and Love Me Today..."


THE GOLDEN DAY IS DYING

One song on the Lullabies For The Heart CD is called "The Golden Day is Dying." This was a great road trip or hiking song: At any time the sun was setting we would just all stop and start singing...

 "The Golden Day is Dying....Beyond the Purple Hill...The Golden Day is Dying Beyond the Purple Hill...The Lark That Sang At Morning in Dusky Wood Is Still The Lark That Sang At Morning in Dusky Wood is Still...And Soon Above the Meadow the Silver Moon Will Swing, And Soon Above the Meadow The Silver Moon Will Swing...And Where the Wood is Darkest the Nightingale will Sing....And Where the Wood is Darkest The Nightingale Will Sing...." 
What incredibly beautiful memories!!!

GOODNIGHT BELOVED
Another beautiful song on this Lullaby compilation is called: "Goodnight Beloved" This song has a very special meaning to me personally because at the very end of my Mom's life, I moved from Santa Barbara, CA to Sedona, AZ (where I am typing this now!) to become my Mom's live-in caregiver until she passed. Each night I would tuck her into bed, and we would sing the "Goodnight Beloved" song to each other across the hallway, in harmony of course, each tucked in our own beds. Since then, whenever I have the chance to sing this song to someone live, I take it! And now, YOU can hear the "Goodnight Beloved" song every night! 

"Goodnight Beloved Goodnight, Goodnight. God Keep You Safe in His Watchful Sight. Goodnight Dear, Dream of Me. And May Your Dreams Ever Pleasant Be. Good Night Dear, Dream of Me....And May Your Dreams Every Pleasant Be...Good Night Love....."

These songs will touch your Heart and Soothe Your Soul! Listen to them to comfort a crying child, grandchild, friend, or your inner child! Listen to these songs to deeply relax, and drift off to a healing sleep!

PASSING ON THE LULLABY LEGACY TO YOU!!
And now I am passing the legacy on to you and your children, grandchildren, and your Inner Child!! Singing was a daily occurrence in the McClure household, and those of you who know me, know that singing is a daily occurrence for me still today!!  I just call people up and sing them healing songs directly or to their voicemail. And with this CD, MANY MORE WILL HAVE ACCESS TO THESE HEALING SONGS!!

Lullabies For The Heart's Song List



Zoon, Zoon
The Lullaby "Zoon, Zoon" is one my Mom used to sing to me all the time. I adore this song. It speaks of the moon over the ocean and how the moon man "casts his silvery net...fashioned from moon beams three. And some folks say when the net lies long, and no one else is nigh, the moon man fishes for some old song...that fell from a sailor's pipe....Oh the waves roll out, and the waves roll in, and the nodding night winds blow....and why the moon man fishes the sea...only the moon man knows."  What a precious song!

A funny story about the Zoon, Zoon Lullaby, one night many years ago...in the '90's, I went to a Poetry Reading out on the Pier in Santa Barbara. At the end of the professional poets' presentations, they allowed ten people to go up to the mike and read their own poem. I was the 10th person. Imagine....10pm at night, out on a pier, the rings clinking on sailboat masts, and I sang: 

"Zoon, Zoon cuddle and croon down by the crinkling sea, the moon man casts his silvery net, fashioned from moonbeams three...and some folks say when the net lies long, and no one else is there, the moon man fishes for a golden comb...that fell from the mermaid's hair....oh the waves roll out and the waves roll in, and the sea goes dip, and doe....and why the moon man fishes the sea...only the moon man knows......"

There was total silence and everyone there was deeply soothed by the night sea air, the clinking of the sailboat masts, and the "Zoon, Zoon" Lullaby.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR CONSIDERATION TO CONTRIBUTE TO MAKE THE DREAM OF LULLABIES FOR THE HEART BECOME A REALITY!!

MAY THESE LULLABIES BRING YOU PEACE IN YOUR HEART, AND LOVE TO YOUR SOUL!!

 LOVE AND THANKS TO YOU AND YOURS!

Thank you! for Visiting my Lullaby CD campaign! Your interest and Support Mean the World to Me!

Love,

GWENDOLYN

Other Ways You Can Help

To assist me to Reach my Goal, PLEASE SHARE this Indiegogo Campaign Link with any of your friends who you feel would benefit from a Healing Lullaby CD! Via Email, FB, Twitter, Instagram, telephone call, neighborly visit, or any means possible. Thank you!!!! 

  • Please Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Participer à une nouvelle aventure, en soutenant le projet de sortie du second album d'EIDON.

  • EIDON en quelques mots:
    Nous sommes un groupe de rock symphonique qui souhaite faire partager sa musique via tous les moyens possibles, aussi bien internet, cds, radios, magazines qu'en jouant sur scène.
    A l'origine, nous sommes 6 amis musiciens, et c'est en 2008 que nous décidons d'écrire ensemble et de jouer nos propres compositions.
    Après des concerts dans plusieurs villes de France, un EP en 2009, un 1er album Crystalight fin 2012, et plusieurs clips vidéos à notre actif, notre groupe souhaite aller encore plus loin en enregistrant ses nouvelles compositions sur un nouvel album pour ensuite pouvoir se produire sur scène.
     

  •  Ce nouveau projet d'album est très important pour nous et nous tient à coeur, puisque c'est la consécration de plusieurs années de travail et de répétitions, qui suit l'évolution musicale du groupe.
    Nous souhaitons proposer nos nouvelles compositions en concert et pouvoir les vendre au format CD à nos fans et futurs fans.
     
  • En nous aidant financièrement dans ce projet:
    - vous contribuez à maintenir un style musical peu connu:
     le rock symphonique,
    - vous nous permettez également de réaliser un des nos rêves :
     pouvoir concrétiser ce nouvel album, à l'heure où les subventions sont de plus en plus difficile à trouver.
    - vous encouragez un groupe libre qui se produit seul sans label et sans logique commerciale. 

 

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

  • Nous avons besoin d'obtenir au moins 6000€ (si possible), pour l'enregistrement en studio au Dôme Studio à Angers qui débutera mi-octobre 2016 (la plus grosse part du budget), ensuite les différents mixages -> le mastering, le pressage du CD, les illustrations du CD / livret, les photos, et toute la communication visuelle qui va suivre courant printemps 2017, et si jamais nous obtenons plus d'argent nous pourrons filmer pour la sortie de l'album un clip vidéo, où vous pourrez pourquoi pas jouer un rôle de figurant. . .
     
  • Toutes les contreparties seront envoyées en avant-première au printemps 2017 avant la sortie officielle de l'album, vous aurez le loisir de découvrir tout ce que l'on vous prépare avant les autres.


 L'impact

Pourquoi votre contribution fera la différence :

  •  Nous n'arriverons pas seul à mener ce projet à bout, comme dit le proverbe "l'union fait la force", et en nous aidant, vous contribuez à l'aboutissement de notre beau projet d'album.
    Ce sera pour nous une grande fierté de pouvoir vous proposer un second album de qualité, où nous nous sommes dépassés dans nos compositions, nous avons exploité des samples musicaux pour vous proposer de nouvelles ambiances musicales, en essayant d'aller toujours plus loin tout en faisant évoluer notre style.
     
  •  Vous nous avez déjà fait confiance pour notre clip Skyline,
     https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AXUO3PxCaWg
    renouvelez l'aventure en soutenant un projet d'une plus grande envergure.
     
  • Vous entrerez dans une aventure humaine où nous vous en serons énormément reconnaissants, car nous savons que sans vous, nous ne pourrions rien accomplir de concrets, sans jamais voir la sortie de ce nouvel album.
     
  • Faîtes-nous confiance et suivez-nous dans cette nouvelle aventure musicale, en nous soutenant, et en partageant au maximum l'info. Demandez aux gens de passer le mot et de faire de la publicité autour de vous, de partager avec différents outils (facebook, réseaux sociaux, mails...) on compte sur votre aide.

Merci infiniment et à très vite sur Indiegogo,
Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/Eidon-100106154316/
et Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCDrCR29Tx6T-H_...

Stay ROCK EIDON ;)
story_txt:
Participer à une nouvelle aventure, en soutenant le projet de sortie du second album d'EIDON.


EIDON en quelques mots:Nous sommes un groupe de rock symphonique qui souhaite faire partager sa musique via tous les moyens possibles, aussi bien internet, cds, radios, magazines qu'en jouant sur scène.A l'origine, nous sommes 6 amis musiciens, et c'est en 2008 que nous décidons d'écrire ensemble et de jouer nos propres compositions.Après des concerts dans plusieurs villes de France, un EP en 2009, un 1er album Crystalight fin 2012, et plusieurs clips vidéos à notre actif, notre groupe souhaite aller encore plus loin en enregistrant ses nouvelles compositions sur un nouvel album pour ensuite pouvoir se produire sur scène. 

 Ce nouveau projet d'album est très important pour nous et nous tient à coeur, puisque c'est la consécration de plusieurs années de travail et de répétitions, qui suit l'évolution musicale du groupe.Nous souhaitons proposer nos nouvelles compositions en concert et pouvoir les vendre au format CD à nos fans et futurs fans. 
En nous aidant financièrement dans ce projet:- vous contribuez à maintenir un style musical peu connu: le rock symphonique,- vous nous permettez également de réaliser un des nos rêves : pouvoir concrétiser ce nouvel album, à l'heure où les subventions sont de plus en plus difficile à trouver.- vous encouragez un groupe libre qui se produit seul sans label et sans logique commerciale. 


 
Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

Nous avons besoin d'obtenir au moins 6000€ (si possible), pour l'enregistrement en studio au Dôme Studio à Angers qui débutera mi-octobre 2016 (la plus grosse part du budget), ensuite les différents mixages -> le mastering, le pressage du CD, les illustrations du CD / livret, les photos, et toute la communication visuelle qui va suivre courant printemps 2017, et si jamais nous obtenons plus d'argent nous pourrons filmer pour la sortie de l'album un clip vidéo, où vous pourrez pourquoi pas jouer un rôle de figurant. . . 

Toutes les contreparties seront envoyées en avant-première au printemps 2017 avant la sortie officielle de l'album, vous aurez le loisir de découvrir tout ce que l'on vous prépare avant les autres.



 L'impact
Pourquoi votre contribution fera la différence :

 Nous n'arriverons pas seul à mener ce projet à bout, comme dit le proverbe "l'union fait la force", et en nous aidant, vous contribuez à l'aboutissement de notre beau projet d'album.Ce sera pour nous une grande fierté de pouvoir vous proposer un second album de qualité, où nous nous sommes dépassés dans nos compositions, nous avons exploité des samples musicaux pour vous proposer de nouvelles ambiances musicales, en essayant d'aller toujours plus loin tout en faisant évoluer notre style. 
 Vous nous avez déjà fait confiance pour notre clip Skyline, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AXUO3PxCaWgrenouvelez l'aventure en soutenant un projet d'une plus grande envergure. 
Vous entrerez dans une aventure humaine où nous vous en serons énormément reconnaissants, car nous savons que sans vous, nous ne pourrions rien accomplir de concrets, sans jamais voir la sortie de ce nouvel album. 
Faîtes-nous confiance et suivez-nous dans cette nouvelle aventure musicale, en nous soutenant, et en partageant au maximum l'info. Demandez aux gens de passer le mot et de faire de la publicité autour de vous, de partager avec différents outils (facebook, réseaux sociaux, mails...) on compte sur votre aide.

Merci infiniment et à très vite sur Indiegogo,Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/Eidon-100106154316/et Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCDrCR29Tx6T-H_...Stay ROCK EIDON ;)
